story:
Writing Maps can now be ordered directly here   

                  LET'S FILL THE WORLD WITH WRITERS!                     

 What are Writing Maps? 

Yep, we're charting new territory. Writing Maps are a new and exciting way to inspire stories, spice up your writing routine, expand your work, develop work-in progress, or just have writerly fun in ways that will surprise you. Explore the city, the home, your writing, and life in general through inspiring exercises on beautifully illustrated and designed maps.

Writing Maps will guide, inspire, and challenge you. No more writer's block! Never be at a loss for something to write about! With a Writing Map on you, there'll be inspiration wherever you go.

So, what do we need? We need $25,000 to pay the illustrators, printers, market the maps, and make sure the Writing Maps make their way into the hands of everyone who loves to write. We need $16,000 to print all the maps. $4,000 to pay our designers, and $5,000 to cover postage, postcards, packaging, Indiegogo fees, and leaflets to help us spread the word. We will donate 5% to The Reader Organisation charity, and 7% if we hit $40,000.

 What's in it for Me? 

By donating to Writing Maps, you'll receive 3, 6, or the full set of 10 maps to get you writing, and special postcards. Other perks include a customised writing workshop for you and your writing buddies devised by Writing Maps creator, Shaun Levin. Four Super-Contributors, will get a map named after them, based on their passions and interests... now's your chance to put your name on the map!

 Perks 

  • Donate $10/£6 and get 3 postcards
  • Donate $30/£20 and get 3 Maps of your choice + postcards
  • Donate $55/£35 and get 6 maps of your choice + postcards
  • Donate $80/£50 and get 10 maps + postcards
  • Donate $150/£95 and get 3 maps and a customised writing day
  • Donate $275/£175 and get 10 maps, 3 postcards, and a customised writing w/end
  • Donate $400/£250 and get 12 sets of 10 maps (Total = 120 maps)
  • Donate $500/£320 and get a map inspired by and dedicated to you
  • Donate $1,500/£950 and get a writing weekend in the UK city of your choice + maps, postcards and notebooks
  • Donate $4,000/£2,500 and get a writing weekend in your city anywhere in the world + maps, postcards and notebooks

 What If We Raise More than $25,000 

If we raise more than $25,000, we'll give more Perks to our Contributors, and a bigger donation to charity. If we raise $30,000, we'll design and devise a special Writing Map for all contributors who've donated $30 and above. The contents of the map will be based on crowd-sourcing the most popular theme via a poll on the Write Around Town website.

If we raise more than $40,000 we'll design a Limited Edition surprise super-map - which will bring the number of Writing Maps in the series to the perfect dozen - and we'll send all our contributors a copy as soon as it's printed. We'll also create a special Write Around Town notebook and send everyone a copy of that, as well. The notebook will be a uniquely illustrated A6, 40-page booklet with drawings, exercises and plenty of room to write.

 5% (or More) to Charity 

We're donating at least 5% of what we raise to charity. We're excited to be supporting The Reader Oraganisation's Apprenticeship Programme, helping the charity raise the £14,000 they need to make sure young people who've been in care can play an active and creative role in their communities.

We love that The Reader Organisation believes in all those skills so essential to the writer's life: being open to new ideas, shaping situations, imagining alternatives, inner discipline, coping with rejection, and problem solving. Through the experience of shared reading in weekly read-aloud groups, the charity aims to strengthen communities and bring great literature to life.

We want to support their work because we believe that engaged and creative readers make great writers, as well as being an important aspect of what every writer is looking for: an audience who loves the written word, loves sharing stories, and enjoys reading aloud.

 How Do I Use Writing Maps? 

Each Writing Map is:

  • a writing muse and inspiring companion
  • a collection of extended and thoughtful writing exercises
  • easy to carry in your pocket or bag
  • intuitive and accessible to everyone
  • the right size to tuck between pages of your notebook
  • a vital tool for teachers, writing tutors and groups
  • the perfect gift for fellow writers
  • inspiring wherever you are: on holiday, on business, in school
  • the perfect antidote to writer's block
  • a resource to develop your work-in-progress
  • reusable, rechargeable, revitalising

 Who Made the Writing Maps? 

The Writing Maps are devised by award-winning writer, Shaun Levin, creator of the Write Around Town Writing Workshops. Shaun has been running workshops and courses in art galleries, zoos, cemeteries, restaurants, cafes, parks, boats, and in more traditional settings for the past twenty years.

Bringing his love of writing outdoors and in surprising ways, Shaun has been working with a wide range of illustrators and graphic designers to create Writing Maps, an innovative way to inspire writers of all levels and genres.

 Writing Maps so Far 

Map #1: The City of Inspiration: write in the city, in parks, galleries, by water.

Map #2: Writing the Love: exercises that'll send you shopping, swimming, stalking and sending postcards to yourself.

Map #3: Writing People: prompting you to observe, eavesdrop, and talk to strangers.

Map #4: Write Around the House: inspired by Xavier de Maistre's book from 1794.

Map #5: The Character Map: helping you explore characters in fiction and non-fiction.

Map #6: My Writing Life Map: a creative way to take stock of your life as a writer, no matter what stage you're at.

Map #7-10: Maps to be inspired by the passions and interests of our Super-Contributors

Map #11: Special Map for our contributors, if we reach $30,000

Map #12: Limited Edition Super-Map for our contributors only, if we go beyond $40,000

 Spread the Word 

We need all the help we can get, so please mention us to your friends and share the news about Writing Maps with your networks. To make sharing easier, just click on the Facebook and Twitter links below.

Thanks for reading this far and for your intrerest and contribution.

Writing Maps © Write Around Town, 2012

           LET'S FILL THE WORLD WITH WRITERS!           

See more pictures in the Gallery

story:
About Me

Hey there! I'm Julian, a transgender artist from California. I grew up in Orange County, went to school in Oakland, and currently live in Philadelphia, PA. I've been a writer for as long as I can remember. Poetry was my outlet as a kid, fiction helped me through my teen years, and now as a young adult I use experimental memoir to share my experiences as a queer transgender Jew with lots (and lots) of feelings.

I applied for the LLF writers retreat on a whim, never expecting to be accepted. But when the letter came saying I'd not only been accepted to Cris Beam's non-fiction workshop, but that I'd also received a half scholarship of $825, I was blown away. My whim suddenly became a need. I crave the chance to join a community of queer writers. Even more so, I crave the time to seriously work on my writing before starting grad school at San Francisco State University this August.

Cost Breakdown

There are a few obstacles between this writers retreat and I. Firstly, tuition. Although I was given an $825 scholarship, this still only covers half the total cost. Secondly, transportation. I'm moving back to Oakland this summer, but to get between Oakland and LA costs about $175 (assuming I can buy these tickets sooner rather than later). So that's an even $1000.

The fundraising could stop there and I'd be the happiest boy imaginable.

But there's this one other problem. My laptop is no longer portable or functional without a large and heavy monitor/keyboard/mouse set-up. It's in truly sad shape, held together by tape and a dream. Really though, it's falling apart. I'm not only a writer and new grad student, but a photographer and an aspiring filmmaker. In order to be able to write at the retreat, to be able to commute between SF and Oakland for grad school, and to continue my art and business as a photographer/filmmaker, I need a functional computer. If we can come up with another $1000, I could buy a really great laptop that would suit all my needs. 

Perks for Donors

Supporting this project doesn't just benefit me. I've come up with a number of rewards for you lovely donors!

Donate $5-25 and you'll receive a shout-out on facebook, plus a well crafted thank-you email about how wise, generous, and attractive you are.

Donate $26-75 (and give me your address) and I'll send you a HAND WRITTEN letter thanking you for being wise/generous/attractive AND a limerick about your glory and benevolence AND a hand-printed patch that I made. They're really, really cute. Pics to come.

Donate $76-200 and you'll get all of the above PLUS a free photoshoot of any kind from the kind folks (me) at Queer Lens Photography to be redeemed any time you like. If you were already looking to get headshots done by me, this is a great way to do it and to support my epic quest simultaneously.

Donate $201+ and I will do all of the above and clean your entire house while dancing to music of your choice, no joke. Klezmer, 90's R&B, dubstep, anything. I'm fairly neurotic and am really good at cleaning. Lucky you. You will also receive MY UNDYING GRATITUDE BECAUSE I LOVE YOU SO MUCH AND YOU'RE SO AMAZING AND PERFECT.

 

Here's what the LLF website says about the retreat:

By far one of the most important initiatives the Lambda Literary Foundation undertakes is to support up-and-coming writers. In the long run, maybe it’s LLF's most important job. The Foundation does so through The Writers Retreat for Emerging LGBT Voices – this year in Los Angeles, July 28 - August 4. After 5 years of existence, the Retreat has earned a sterling reputation, and for good reason.

 

The Retreat is unlike any other writing program in the world. It’s the only residency established specifically for promising LGBT writers. Classes are taught by a brilliant and diverse faculty, themselves all successful LGBT writers. The sad truth is, many who want to come to the Retreat just can’t afford it. Though some scholarship money is offered, it does not cover all costs to ensure the very best aspiring lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender writers can attend. They need your support today. Your contribution to help send a talented emerging writer to Los Angeles this summer is critical.

 

The “Retreat” – a misnomer, really, since one former student delighted in calling it a “queer writers’ boot camp” – gathers LGBT writers from every walk of life for one rigorous, immersive week. Lives are changed. Students arrive with manuscripts in hand, a novel or short story collection, a book of poetry or a memoir, a mystery or young adult novel that will soon extend the fabric of our literature. At “boot camp” they polish their craft. They work on plot, develop more convincing characters and explore their own distinctive voices. Teaching is personalized. They gain a better understanding of what works and what might need re-working. Besides one-on-one instruction, students forge connections to publishing industry professionals, and most importantly, build a community of peers on whom they’ll depend for years of encouragement, inspiration and friendship.

A writer’s life is full of challenges. Lambda’s emerging voices Fellows come from big cities and rural towns all over America. In many of these places the LGBT community is still under a lot of pressure, subtle and not-so-subtle. When a writer is committed to our queer literary traditions – to stories of unconventional lives and social struggle, to girl-meets-girl and first gay love – work becomes so much harder in isolation. Your gift today will give a talented LGBT writer a real chance for professional growth and personal achievement. Our Lambda Fellows go on to achieve an impressive record of publication and community involvement. They are both prolific artists and ambassadors of the literary arts.

Your generous donation to a student's tuition, room and board will give these shining artists a leg up in their careers, and – not a small side benefit! – it will empower them as agents of social change. Remember, they’re the ones who’ll be telling our stories and continuing our fight for LGBT equality and freedom.

story:
FIGHTING FOR FAIR, INDEPENDENT JOURNALISM FOR SCOTLAND

So, wow. Last month we decided to kick on a little bit as an experiment and put more of our time into Wings Over Scotland, and the results were dramatic. But the truth of the matter is that we can't keep up that level every month, because we have to earn a living.

(Some lovely readers made generous donations over the Christmas/New Year period in particular, which were very much appreciated but not enough to cover the rent on our humble shack for a month, let alone our crippling heroin habit.)

But here's a thing: supporters of independence constantly and loudly bemoan the lack of a pro-independence Scottish newspaper, or even just a balanced one committed to old-fashioned fair-minded and honest reporting.

The last attempt to make a print one crashed and burned a long time ago - as pointedly noted in the image above by Kerry Gill, current political editor of the Scottish Daily Express. And the online Caledonian Mercury, despite being staffed by proper experienced journalists, died (though technically its corpse still twitches faintly once in a while) through a failed funding model, having not found a high enough readership to generate sufficient advertising revenue.

The thing is, it doesn't have to be that way.

 

Wings Over Scotland is pretty small beer in the grand scheme of things. But nevertheless, from a standing start and with very little help from anyone other than its own readers and contributors, this wee site, mostly the part-time work of one person, has built a readership of over 30,000 people. And that’s actually quite a big deal.

We currently have a "subscription" facility where readers can donate £2 a month to help with our running costs. If, purely hypothetically speaking, everyone who reads the site subscribed - at just 46p a week, or 1p more than a single day's edition of the Daily Record - we'd suddenly and startlingly have enough money in the kitty to pay for TWENTY full-time professional journalists on very decent wages.

(Because 30,000 times £2 is £60,000 a month, divided by 20 people is £3000 a month each, or £36,000 a year - a pretty handsome salary for a journalist, or indeed anyone else, these days. Obviously the arithmetic wouldn't be quite that simplistic in real life, but as a basic illustration of the power even a modest readership could harness if it put its mind to it, it's a real eye-opener.)

Now, don't panic. We're not nearly mad enough to think we'd get 30,000 readers to all cough up even that modest sum for the sake of a dedicated, professionally-produced Scottish news site with 20 full-time staff. So after a reader's suggestion a couple of weeks ago, instead of 20 writers we're going to see if we can start with just one.

I first became a professional journalist in January 1991, taking a Staff Writer job on a new videogames magazine. I stayed with the magazine for three years, becoming Deputy Editor and then Acting Editor, and seeing it rise from third place to become the best-seller in its field, with a peak circulation of around 65,000 copies a month. Along with some games- and software-development work I've been a freelance for the 17 years since, working chiefly as a writer for dozens of publications from the Guardian to Esquire, The Face, SFX, Front, Teletext and Wired, on subjects ranging from games to music, TV, films, football, comedy and travel.

The referendum on independence is the most important subject I'll ever be involved in, and I don't want to be doing it as a hobby (and especially to the point where I can't afford to pay my rent from neglecting proper work). So the purpose of this Indiegogo project is to see if enough people are prepared to put their money where their mouth is and hire at least one full-time professional journalist to cover the topic every day without having to follow the agenda of uniformly-Unionist newspaper proprietors.

That modest goal requires a very small commitment from readers: a one-off contribution of just £1 each. If everyone who reads Wings Over Scotland this month contributes that tiny sum I can do this as a job for a whole year.

There'll be more posts every day, and the opportunity to do more in-depth research. The site can have a design overhaul to make it even more accessible and make the additional content easier to navigate. If we exceed the minimum, we can pay other people for still more articles and features, and perhaps ultimately grow a whole online newspaper organically from the ground up. (I like the name "Scotland Tomorrow".)

It's up to you.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Why do you need thousands of pounds to keep doing what you've been doing for free for the past year and a bit?

Because I can't sustain the current level of commitment to Wings Over Scotland and keep a roof over my head. I need to spend more time on earning money and less on writing about Scottish politics for nothing. The ideal scenario, obviously, would be earning a living writing about Scottish politics, but I'm going to hazard a guess that the Herald and Scotsman won't be knocking on the door any time soon, so we're going to have to do this for ourselves.

Why should we pay you when there are loads of free blogs, and lots of other sites who also want money?

That's entirely your decision. Look back at the quantity and quality of content we've published here over the last 15 months and decide whether it's matched anywhere else. And if you do like it, ponder whether an expanded, improved version of it would be worth a little under 2p a week to you or not.

Why don't you just have advertising?

Respectable as our readership is, it's not yet large enough to attract serious interest/revenue from advertisers. More importantly, we're journalists, not ad-sales people - frankly we have no idea how to go about it. One thing we could look at if we exceeded the minimum goal would be hiring someone to sort that out for us, so that we wouldn't have to ask readers for money again next year. But in a perfect world we could fund the site without being beholden to advertisers at all.

Do you really need THAT much money?

We chose the figure to represent a symbolic £1 per reader. (To be honest, we sort of wish we'd had slightly fewer readers last month.) But yes.

The "living wage" in the UK is £15,496 nationwide, or £17,784 in London. Wings Over Scotland is based in one of the most expensive cities in Britain, and the living wage is itself a pretty bare minimum of tolerable existence (plus Indiegogo take a chunk out of the total as commission).

The target sum will keep us alive, cover running costs - including an overdue proper transfer to wingsoverscotland.com, which should stop some people's workplaces blocking us for having the word "game" in our URL - and pay other people for articles and so on too. If we're not working for free, we're not going to ask others to.

So why not just ask for donations as normal?

Because just asking people to bung you money ad hoc is a bit beggy, and more to the point it doesn't bring in much. Every penny in donations is appreciated very much indeed, but since we've had the Donate page the total is well short of four figures, in nine months. This way, your money goes towards a very specific, clear and defined goal - paying properly for the site to be a full-time professional concern. This way it's crowdsourced project funding, not panhandling.

Couldn't you try a paywall?

A paywall would rather defeat the object of the site, which is to reach as many people as possible and give them the facts about the independence debate. "Hey there, No voter - go and read this site to see why the stuff you're saying is wrong! Oh, you'll have to pay for it, by the way" isn't going to change many minds.

Shouldn't I give my cash to the official Yes campaign instead?

We're hoping that a single £1 won't put too much of a dent in your philanthropy budget.

What will we get for our money?

For your £1 you'll be getting a year (or more) of seven-day reporting, at considerably more than 40 hours a week. You'll get more posts every day, even compared to January's record total. We'll be able to devote more time to writing, researching, audio-capturing and transcribing, because we won't have to be fretting that every hour we spend working for the site is an hour we're not earning money to pay the bills with.

Anything over and above the target will be put straight into the site in the form of paid content from other high-quality contributors, as well as other improvements - better webhosting, broader coverage (eg we could afford a subscription to The Times to monitor its Scottish reporting), attending events in person and so on. Ideally we'd make enough to carry on all the way to the referendum, but we're keeping the goal simple for now.

Crucially, more money would also enable us to do something several readers have asked for - produce printed materials that could be used by doorstep campaigners to get vital facts and information across to people who don't frequent political websites.

What happens if you don't reach the target?

We don't have the faintest idea whether the fundraiser will succeed or not. If we don't reach the target amount, we'll put any money we do get into the site one way or another - a couple of months full-time, a couple of paid contributors, a new candle for our desk and an extra pair of gloves to keep our typing fingers warm, whatever.

(If we don't reach the target, incidentally, we get substantially less money than the "final total" - Indiegogo charge more than twice as much commission if you miss your goal as they do if you hit it, to encourage achievable aims.)

It might be that Kerry Gill is right, and that independence supporters will do anything for a fair and balanced quality press except pay 2p a week for it. Perhaps it'll fail by such an embarrassingly vast margin we'll have to close down out of sheer humiliation.

Or perhaps it'll exceed our wildest dreams and we'll be able to offer you a daily diet of stories, features and columns about Scottish politics from the finest writers in the country, from all points of view, with unparallelled quality of research and insight. Those outcomes, and everything in between, are in your hands.

Can I donate more than £1 if I want to?

Oh God yes, by all means. Obviously in the real world not everyone will kick in, so we'll need some people to do more than their bit if we're going to have a chance. And, y'know, if anyone happens to know the Weirs, feel free to send them to this page.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
story_txt:
FIGHTING FOR FAIR, INDEPENDENT JOURNALISM FOR SCOTLAND
So, wow. Last month we decided to kick on a little bit as an experiment and put more of our time into Wings Over Scotland, and the results were dramatic. But the truth of the matter is that we can't keep up that level every month, because we have to earn a living.
(Some lovely readers made generous donations over the Christmas/New Year period in particular, which were very much appreciated but not enough to cover the rent on our humble shack for a month, let alone our crippling heroin habit.)

But here's a thing: supporters of independence constantly and loudly bemoan the lack of a pro-independence Scottish newspaper, or even just a balanced one committed to old-fashioned fair-minded and honest reporting.
The last attempt to make a print one crashed and burned a long time ago - as pointedly noted in the image above by Kerry Gill, current political editor of the Scottish Daily Express. And the online Caledonian Mercury, despite being staffed by proper experienced journalists, died (though technically its corpse still twitches faintly once in a while) through a failed funding model, having not found a high enough readership to generate sufficient advertising revenue.
The thing is, it doesn't have to be that way.
 


Wings Over Scotland is pretty small beer in the grand scheme of things. But nevertheless, from a standing start and with very little help from anyone other than its own readers and contributors, this wee site, mostly the part-time work of one person, has built a readership of over 30,000 people. And that’s actually quite a big deal.
We currently have a "subscription" facility where readers can donate £2 a month to help with our running costs. If, purely hypothetically speaking, everyone who reads the site subscribed - at just 46p a week, or 1p more than a single day's edition of the Daily Record - we'd suddenly and startlingly have enough money in the kitty to pay for TWENTY full-time professional journalists on very decent wages.
(Because 30,000 times £2 is £60,000 a month, divided by 20 people is £3000 a month each, or £36,000 a year - a pretty handsome salary for a journalist, or indeed anyone else, these days. Obviously the arithmetic wouldn't be quite that simplistic in real life, but as a basic illustration of the power even a modest readership could harness if it put its mind to it, it's a real eye-opener.)
Now, don't panic. We're not nearly mad enough to think we'd get 30,000 readers to all cough up even that modest sum for the sake of a dedicated, professionally-produced Scottish news site with 20 full-time staff. So after a reader's suggestion a couple of weeks ago, instead of 20 writers we're going to see if we can start with just one.

I first became a professional journalist in January 1991, taking a Staff Writer job on a new videogames magazine. I stayed with the magazine for three years, becoming Deputy Editor and then Acting Editor, and seeing it rise from third place to become the best-seller in its field, with a peak circulation of around 65,000 copies a month. Along with some games- and software-development work I've been a freelance for the 17 years since, working chiefly as a writer for dozens of publications from the Guardian to Esquire, The Face, SFX, Front, Teletext and Wired, on subjects ranging from games to music, TV, films, football, comedy and travel.
The referendum on independence is the most important subject I'll ever be involved in, and I don't want to be doing it as a hobby (and especially to the point where I can't afford to pay my rent from neglecting proper work). So the purpose of this Indiegogo project is to see if enough people are prepared to put their money where their mouth is and hire at least one full-time professional journalist to cover the topic every day without having to follow the agenda of uniformly-Unionist newspaper proprietors.
That modest goal requires a very small commitment from readers: a one-off contribution of just £1 each. If everyone who reads Wings Over Scotland this month contributes that tiny sum I can do this as a job for a whole year.
There'll be more posts every day, and the opportunity to do more in-depth research. The site can have a design overhaul to make it even more accessible and make the additional content easier to navigate. If we exceed the minimum, we can pay other people for still more articles and features, and perhaps ultimately grow a whole online newspaper organically from the ground up. (I like the name "Scotland Tomorrow".)
It's up to you.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Why do you need thousands of pounds to keep doing what you've been doing for free for the past year and a bit?
Because I can't sustain the current level of commitment to Wings Over Scotland and keep a roof over my head. I need to spend more time on earning money and less on writing about Scottish politics for nothing. The ideal scenario, obviously, would be earning a living writing about Scottish politics, but I'm going to hazard a guess that the Herald and Scotsman won't be knocking on the door any time soon, so we're going to have to do this for ourselves.
Why should we pay you when there are loads of free blogs, and lots of other sites who also want money?
That's entirely your decision. Look back at the quantity and quality of content we've published here over the last 15 months and decide whether it's matched anywhere else. And if you do like it, ponder whether an expanded, improved version of it would be worth a little under 2p a week to you or not.
Why don't you just have advertising?
Respectable as our readership is, it's not yet large enough to attract serious interest/revenue from advertisers. More importantly, we're journalists, not ad-sales people - frankly we have no idea how to go about it. One thing we could look at if we exceeded the minimum goal would be hiring someone to sort that out for us, so that we wouldn't have to ask readers for money again next year. But in a perfect world we could fund the site without being beholden to advertisers at all.
Do you really need THAT much money?
We chose the figure to represent a symbolic £1 per reader. (To be honest, we sort of wish we'd had slightly fewer readers last month.) But yes.
The "living wage" in the UK is £15,496 nationwide, or £17,784 in London. Wings Over Scotland is based in one of the most expensive cities in Britain, and the living wage is itself a pretty bare minimum of tolerable existence (plus Indiegogo take a chunk out of the total as commission).
The target sum will keep us alive, cover running costs - including an overdue proper transfer to wingsoverscotland.com, which should stop some people's workplaces blocking us for having the word "game" in our URL - and pay other people for articles and so on too. If we're not working for free, we're not going to ask others to.
So why not just ask for donations as normal?
Because just asking people to bung you money ad hoc is a bit beggy, and more to the point it doesn't bring in much. This way it's crowdsourced project funding, not panhandling.

A paywall would rather defeat the object of the site, which is to reach as many people as possible and give them the facts about the independence debate. story:
Hello, my name is Benjamin Zupnick, I am a 24 year old from New Rochelle, New York. I am currently working on a Dual MA in Economics / IPED (International Political Economy and Development) at Fordham. I have laways been outspoken about what I believed is right; when I began learning about important issues in current events in school I felt obligated to share my insights.

Normative Narratives is a blog where anything and everything is fair game. Topics covered include sports, politics, economics, transparency, climate change and economic development just to name a few.

I am looking for $800 to copyright my blogs name and protect my intellectual property, as well as spread the Normative Narratives message to a larger community. Copyrighting costs about $150 through any number of online copyrighting services. The remaining money will go to advertising, $300 dollars will buy me an ad on facebook; the more money I can raise the more awareness my website can raise.

 

The great thing about this project is that it is already up and running. Go to www.normativenarratives.com to see exactly what your funding will help promote! I aim to write one high quality blog post every day Monday - Friday, so check back often.


With your contribution, my message of egalitarian values and sustainable development can gain a much larger audience. If enough people become aware of these ideas, there is not telling how much public good can come from a relatively small investment. Talk about ROI!

Normative Narratives will continue to provide high quality analysis of current events for free regardless of your donation. But by giving any amount of money, you will help spread the good word and change the world!

story:
WHAT IF THERE WAS MORE LOVE, BEAUTY, AND ACCEPTANCE IN OUR WORLD?

The Religion-Free Bible Project exists to inspire more love, peace, beauty, goodness, acceptance, compassion, justice and harmony in the world by offering humankind a paraphrase of biblical passages, which combine texts and images to creatively capture the spirit and meaning of the Bible, free from the bias and baggage of man-made religion. The goal of the RFB Project is to make the Religion-Free Bible accessible to all people worldwide, and for 51% of our world population to have a copy of the RFB in some form.

 

THE BIBLE IS NOT A RELIGIOUS BOOK

Jim Palmer will be writing and guiding the process of creating the Religion-Free Bible. Jim is a voice for people seeking God and exploring spirituality beyond organized religion. Since 2005 he has been sharing his journey of “shedding religion to find God” as an author, speaker, and spiritual director.  He is an ordained minister and has a Master of Divinity degree from Trinity Seminary in Chicago.

An advisory circle of people representing various religious traditions, humanistic worldviews, and various forms of spirituality, will be offering feedback and input on the RFB as it is being written. A team of photographers will be offering images as well as their input and feedback on image selection. In addittion to a print and digital version, an RFB app will be created to distribute the RFB via smartphone.

Jim expresses himself with unique emotional depth, courageous candor, self-deprecating humor, gifted storytelling, and profound insight. He has an artistic eye, and has become known for creatively connecting images and words together in powerful combinations. He will be working with Darla Winn in producing and selecting the images for the Religion-Free Bible.

Jim believes that the value of the Bible lies in its capacity to transform people’s relationship with themselves, God, others, life, and world, not perpetuating theological dogma or religious rules and rituals. In frustration about the disempowering spin on the Bible he often saw online, Jim wrote out a paraphrase of one of Jesus’ sayings and posted it on Facebook.  He added and image to his post and referred to it tongue-in cheek as the JPV – Jim Palmer version. A significant response to this and other JPV posts, led to the idea of the Religion-Free Bible, which combines Jim’s paraphrase and images he has selected for each entry.

THE POSSIBILITY YOU ARE CREATING AS PART OF THE RFB TRIBE

The RFB Tribe is a growing community and network of people who believe in the significance and potential of the Religion-Free Bible to impact the world and humankind. The tribe are people who want to contribute to creating, publishing, and distributing the message of the Religion-Free Bible. Joining the RFB Tribe will help birth an inspiring, creative, timeless, transformative and inclusive message, made accessible and distributed to people worldwide in a variety of forms from print, digital, and a mobile software app.

The Religion-Free Bible Project is aiming to raise $7,250 through this campaign, which will fund:

1. The writing and editing, as well as the production and selection of images for the Religion-Free Bible.

2. Creation of the Religion-Free Bible smartphone app.

3. The publication of the RFB in print and Kindle edition.

4. Organizing the inaugural Religion-Free Bible gathering.

In appreciation for cointributions to the campaign, there are perks at every givine level including:

  • A copy of Jim’s, The Stuff That Never Got In (censored excerpts from the original divine nobody),which is a collection of writings that were not allowed or removed from Jim’s previous books.
  • Added to the private RFB Facebook Group, giving access to the Religion-Free Bible as it is being written..
  • A set of framed photogrpahs from Darla Winn.
  • 2 free RFB apps – one for you and one for gifting to a friend.
  • A visit by Jim to your community.

*The names of all contributors (unless otherwise specified) will be included in the online and print publications of the RFB.

WHAT WILL BE THE IMPACT OF THE RFB PROJECT?

Many people are on the journey of shedding religion to know God, and no longer support the view of Jesus or the Bible that is being taught by the institutional church. Different denominations have views that often lead to condemning people of other faiths, forcing Christians to adopt beliefs and practices they often cannot live up to or support in good conscience, and requiring people to promote a message that divides human beings in the name of God. These same people embrace a religion-free Jesus who stood for the inherent, equal, and divine worth of every human being. Seeking to be instruments of love, peace, grace, compassion and justice, these “divine nobodies” courageously work towards a world that works for everyone.

The greatest need of all people has always been and continues to be to know there is nothing wrong with us, that we are loved and accepted by God without condition. This was the meaning of Jesus’ life. This is the highest truth that defies, fulfills and transcends all religion, and this is the truth that sets people free. And yet countless people have shared with Jim the disillusionment and damage that resulted from their experience in organized religion.

THE WORLD WE HOPE AND WORK FOR THROUGH THE RFB PROJECT

A world where every human being knows their divine worth, and affirms this same worth in all others equally.

A world where people aren’t divided based on religious theology, dogma or creed, but united and inspired  to be instruments of love, peace, beauty, goodness, acceptance, compassion, justice and harmony in the world.

A world where the distance between people is dissolved along with the differences that typically separate human beings, and we see all others as our sister or brother.

OTHER WAYS TO BE THE RFB TRIBE

You can play a key critical role in the RFB Project by joining the tribe of people who are actively sharing about the project through social media. Two ways of doing this is to retweet updates from the RFB on Twitter, and share posts from the RFB Facebook Page. Sharing about the project on your blog or website is another significant way to help get the word out. Personally contacting a few key people in your network to educate them about the project and invite their participation makes a huge difference. Contribute your ideas, suggestions, feedback, and input to the RFB Project. We are only scratching the surface of how the RFB can have an impact in our world. Lets create that impact together. No idea is off limits; we want to hear them all. In addition to Facebook, and Twitter, you can email your thoughts, ideas and suggestions to: religionfreebibleproject@gmail.com

story:
Help us publish Breast Dancer, an uplifting book for people journeying along the wild and wooly road of cancer — to help them know that they are not alone. 

About Breast Dancer

I wrote Breast Dancer just after I completed treatments for breast cancer.  Even though I lived in Alaska, I had a great support group of friends — distance runners and survivors— who walked the road with me. 

Here is an excerpt from the book . . .

Breast Journey Step 16 – North to the Yukon

 . . . Some of the heartiest laughs I’ve ever produced, deep and loud and unselfconscious, were with Team Survivor Perseverance, on the Klondike International Road Relay.

Despite our ironclad motto — “What happens on the Klondike stays on the Klondike” — I must share some of the unforgettable moments I’ve spent dancing with these gals on a grassy dance floor under a humid tent in Whitehorse, Yukon. Together we listened with glee to one laid back Canadian band after another, celebrating Life in a way that only Survivors can, having kicked death’s ass and happy to tell the tale. These women distinguished the important (friendship, kindness, passion) from the
unimportant (perfection, guilt and housecleaning). These were Survivors who had
been up all night, running for miles through the mountain passes, and who were
now full of both endorphins and watery beer.

  Especially memorable was the year before I myself had been diagnosed. Appointed fashion consultant for the team, I’d arranged pink boas for each member to wear to the dance and award ceremony. As we danced and the tent became increasingly,
humanly humid, the pink feathers began sticking to all our glistening faces and
arms. For some of these friends, having recently endured the indignities of
surgery and hair loss, these feathery adornments recaptured the first touch of
their lost femininity.

Jan hatched the lovely idea to pass on the boas to anyone with a new diagnosis, and
so the feathers have made their way around the state and the country, with our
sweat and our music still clinging to them, to bring joy and hope to other
women.

Running — and the bold, fearless women who do it — saw me strongly through this odyssey and prepared me for those to come. As with singing, the sheer joy of surrendering myself to the Road, and the satisfaction of giving my all as part of a team, contains some of the deepest spiritual lessons of my life. During radiation fatigue, my motivation to get out the door and run came from my commitment to this team.

 

Why We Need Your Support

It has taken seven years, and many edits, and now we are finally ready to go to print. I keep thinking that perhaps they will find a cure, and that breast cancer will become a thing of the past, but so far, that has not happened. Just last month, I met a woman at a resort on the San Juan Islands who had just finished her treatments, and we shared our stories, and laughed, and cried just a bit. She is waiting for this book to be published. But first, we need your help.

We have included the lyrics to several songs in Breast Dancer. Some music publishers have generously donated the rights to use their lyrics, but for 12 songs, the publishing companies require that we pay a fee. We also have some stock imagery costs related to the cover, and getting the word out about the book. I’d like to record it too, for those people in chemotherapy for whom reading is not so easy, but who might like to listen to my melodious voice. If you contribute to this campaign, then the women who are waiting — for a laugh, for a story, for a dance — can get a copy of this book to set on their bedside table, for those nights when they can’t sleep, and just need to make connection.

Whether or not you can donate, please consider sending this information along to friends and family.

Thank you for your help, and may your life be blessed with health and dancing!

Stretch Goals

All of the editing and book layout work for Breast Dancer has been done pro bono. We’ve set a conservative goal for this campaign, to cover the music rights and the costs associated with self-publishing in e-book and printed formats.

If we are fortunate enough to exceed our goal of $2,500, the additional funding will go toward purchasing books for women who can’t afford them. We’ve got some festive perks to thank our donors, and most importantly, you will get that good feeling that you are helping someone through a difficult time. Survivors come in all ages, sizes, and demographics. Who knows — someday, that person just may be you.

If we do not meet our goal, we will purchase as many reprint permissions as possible, and publish Breast Dancer in a slightly abridged form.  We think all the lyrics are important to the story, but we'll make some hard choices in order to get this book out and into the hands of people who need it. 

About Joyce

The Reverend Joyce Parry Moore is an Episcopal Priest, ordained by the Diocese of Alaska, and serving in the Diocese of California where Mother Joyce serves as at the rector of St. Bartholomew’s Church in Livermore. Meanwhile, she is earning her Doctorate of Ministry degree in Pastoral Counseling. Her dissertation project focuses on providing continued healing through creative arts for women and families affected by cancer.

In 2006, faced with a diagnosis of breast cancer, Joyce had the opportunity to sing Verdi’s Requiem with the Juneau Symphony in Alaska. Mother Joyce recorded her feelings about the healing power of music, and her This I Believe essay aired NPR’s The Bob Edwards Show on August 9, 2013.

Joyce lives in Livermore, CA with her husband, the youngest of her five children of a blended family (shaken, not stirred), their two dogs, two birds and two lizards. You may contact Rev. Parry Moore at jparrymoore@gmail.com to order copies of the book when it is actually published, or to share your stories of healing and surviving.
story_txt:
Help us publish Breast Dancer, an uplifting book for people journeying along the
wild and wooly road of cancer — to help them know that they are not alone.  
About Breast Dancer
I wrote Breast
Dancer just after I completed treatments for breast cancer.  Even though I lived in Alaska, I had a
great support group of friends — distance runners and survivors— who walked the
road with me. 
Here is an excerpt from the book . . . 
Breast Journey Step 16 – North to the Yukon
 . . . Some of the heartiest laughs I’ve ever produced, deep and loud and unselfconscious, were with Team Survivor Perseverance, on the Klondike International Road Relay.
Despite our ironclad motto — “What happens on the Klondike stays on the Klondike” — I must share some of the unforgettable moments I’ve spent dancing with these gals on a grassy dance floor under a humid tent in Whitehorse, Yukon. Together we listened with glee to one laid back Canadian band after another, celebrating Life in a way that only Survivors can, having kicked death’s ass and happy to tell the tale. These women distinguished the important (friendship, kindness, passion) from theunimportant (perfection, guilt and housecleaning). These were Survivors who hadbeen up all night, running for miles through the mountain passes, and who werenow full of both endorphins and watery beer.
  Especially memorable was the year before I myself had been diagnosed. Appointed fashion consultant for the team, I’d arranged pink boas for each member to wear to the dance and award ceremony. As we danced and the tent became increasingly,humanly humid, the pink feathers began sticking to all our glistening faces andarms. For some of these friends, having recently endured the indignities ofsurgery and hair loss, these feathery adornments recaptured the first touch oftheir lost femininity.
Jan hatched the lovely idea to pass on the boas to anyone with a new diagnosis, andso the feathers have made their way around the state and the country, with oursweat and our music still clinging to them, to bring joy and hope to otherwomen.
Running — and the bold, fearless women who do it — saw me strongly through this odyssey and prepared me for those to come. As with singing, the sheer joy of surrendering myself to the Road, and the satisfaction of giving my all as part of a team, contains some of the deepest spiritual lessons of my life. During radiation fatigue, my motivation to get out the door and run came from my commitment to this team.
 
Why We Need Your Support
It has taken seven years, and many edits,
and now we are finally ready to go to print. I keep thinking that perhaps they
will find a cure, and that breast cancer will become a thing of the past, but
so far, that has not happened. Just last month, I met a woman at a resort on
the San Juan Islands who had just finished her treatments, and we shared our
stories, and laughed, and cried just a bit. She is waiting for this book to be
published. But first, we need your help.
We have included the lyrics to several songs
in Breast Dancer. Some music
publishers have generously donated the rights to use their lyrics, but for 12 songs,
the publishing companies require that we pay a fee. We also have some stock
imagery costs related to the cover, and getting the word out about the book.
I’d like to record it too, for those people in chemotherapy for whom reading is
not so easy, but who might like to listen to my melodious voice. If you
contribute to this campaign, then the women who are waiting — for a laugh, for
a story, for a dance — can get a copy of this book to set on their bedside
table, for those nights when they can’t sleep, and just need to make
connection.
Whether or not you can donate, please
consider sending this information along to friends and family.
Thank you for your help, and may your life
be blessed with health and dancing!
Stretch Goals
All of the editing and book layout work for
Breast Dancer has been done pro bono. We’ve set a conservative goal for this
campaign, to cover the music rights and the costs associated with self-publishing
in e-book and printed formats. 
If we are fortunate enough to exceed our
goal of $2,500, the additional funding will go toward purchasing books for
women who can’t afford them. We’ve got some festive perks to thank our donors,
and most importantly, you will get that good feeling that you are helping
someone through a difficult time. Survivors come in all ages, sizes, and
demographics. Who knows — someday, that person just may be you.

story:
I'm an anarchist, a writer, a believer in people

I'm not very adept at writing about myself. It feels heavily egotistical. My sense is that my work speaks more of who I am than any trumped up autobio. At present, I have one novel on the market. In short, my writing centers around the inherent beauty of struggle. Struggle's importance is often overlooked in a world filled with trivial and corrupted pursuits such as politics, law, and religion. Everyday, in so many mediums, we hear people lament the holes in their lives, the emptiness of their existence when the only true and constant thread is individual struggle. When one accepts the exquisite simplicity of it, the world becomes a different place. One realizes that winning means nothing and losing means even less. There are no winners or losers, only volunteers. 

Many of my shorter works are posted here:

The Philosophy of Struggle 

I am poised to write my next novel, an ambitious attempt to deliver a wider audience the full weight of my philosophy. It will be a road story, a story of discovery and revelation. I need help to make it real. So I've decided to request the assistance of people who still care about the art of storytelling and the power of words.

Choked with non-fiction and history, contemporary anarchist literature needs an injection of creative fiction and revelatory stories. Anarchist fiction has a long and illustrious history. Help me bring the drama, humor,and vitality back to a genre that hasn’t seen a Camus or Edward Abbey in quite some time.

Marketing and time are expensive

After self-publishing my novel That Night Filled Mountain, I realized the impact marketing has when scouting the correct audience for a book. I feel the need to explore this avenue to the fullest and, unfortunately, this requires money. More money than a starving writing can afford.      

  • If this campaign is successful, each contributor will receive not only a signed copy of the funded book but also a signed copy of an art book project also in the works. Anyone who contributes $200 or more will be listed in a specific acknowledgments section of the book. 
  • If the $5000 goal isn't met, I will provide each contributor with a digital copy of my previous book That Night Filled Mountain.

story:
En résumé

Située à Bruxelles (Etterbeek), La crèche La Barboteuse existe depuis 25 ans et est dirigée par Michelle Verlinden. Son local arrivant en fin de bail sans renouvellement possible, celle-ci a trouvé un nouveau local qui nécessitait des travaux d'aménagement. Elle a confié les travaux à un entrepreneur qui s'est avéré être un escroc ayant usurpé le numéro de TVA d'un autre entrepreneur, et s'est envolé avec les €52,000 de crédit. Incapable de mener les travaux, la crèche menace aujourd'hui de fermer, sauf si un élan de solidarité réussit à la sauver.
Regardez ce reportage de Télé Bruxelles pour plus d'informations.

Ce qui est nécessaire

Aujourd'hui, il reste de nombreux travaux à effectuer pour permettre à la crèche, son staff et les enfants de déménager dans son futur local:

  • Installation sanitaire complète: radiateurs, lavabos,...
  • Sol: carrelage sur toute la surface
  • Peinture dans tous les locaux
  • Autres travaux divers

Pourquoi participer?

Bruxelles manque de crèches, et  diriger une crèche demande une énergie hors du commun. Aujourd'hui, une directrice qui a consacré sa vie à la petite enfance est dans le désarroi et a besoin de votre aide :

  • Vous pouvez participer à un projet de vie, générateur d'emploi dans une capitale qui manque cruellement de places pour nos tout petits
  • Vous redonnerez de l'énergie à tout le staff et serez reconnu pour votre aide, qu'elle soit grande ou petite
  • Ensemble nous pouvons prouver que les escrocs n'ont pas toujours le dernier mot
  • ...En un mot comme en cents, donnons à cette crèche un nouveau local!

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, toute autre aide est la bienvenue :

  • Du matériel tel que peinture, carrelage, sanitaire (neuf ou quasi)
  • Du temps si vous êtes un bricoleur avéré ou professionnel pour intervenir en temps utile sur le chantier

Contacter la crèche via info@labarboteuse.be si vous pouvez contribuer en temps et/ou matériel.

story:
My pain had a purpose, which is to help others rise out of their struggles. No matter where you are in your journey, know that you are not alone!!

My Story

In September of 2012, my husband was hit by a drunk driver. The driver's side was so badly damaged that firefighters had to use the Jaws of Life to get my husband out of the car. As a result of the accident, he suffered from severe back and neck injuries. It was hard to see my husband in so much pain. The accident devastated our family. It was even harder to explain what had had happened to daddy our five-year-old at the time. Little did we know that this was just the beginning of the many losses that would come our way! Five months following my husband's accident, his cousin, who was more like a brother to him passed away.  The best way to describe his cousin's untimely death, is feeling like we were just swallowed by a deep black hole. We were in so much pain!! My husband was so distraught over his cousin's death that an abscess grew on his face that required surgery. Pain on top of pain!!!

During that time, we experienced loss after loss.  It is noteworthy to mention that my family and I experienced financial losses as well.

This was one of the most vulnerable times of our lives -- but I didn't give up.

Through my pain and loss, I remained dedicated to helping and encouraging other people to rebuild their lives. When a client expresses, “I am in so much pain”; I know firsthand how this person feels.

I was compelled to write Naked & Transparent not only because of my past struggles, but also my experience of dealing with loss in 2012. I believe that this book will touch and impact lives.

I understand your struggle and your pain!! This book will provide you with the tools you need to rise out of your crisis, rebuild your life and to find your way.


The Book

Think about it: Many of us-including those who seem to have it all together-are holding on to some pain in our lives that has the potential to destroy us, and it is costing us our happiness and our relationships.  Discovering who you are is the single most important thing you will ever do in your life because all of our thoughts and actions are based on who we think we are-but the truth is that many of us are not honest with ourselves and make choices based on fiction-not fact, which wreaks havoc in our lives and relationships. My book, Naked & Transparent, will help people identify their true selves so that they can rise above the pain that once held them in mental and emotional captivity. 


Who Am I, and Why am I Here?

My name is Vladimire Calixte. I am a Licensed Mental Health Specialist who has worked with a variety of clients-including celebrities-who struggle with anxiety, PTSD, shame, chronic depression, anger, trauma, and so much more. My work has garnered media attention, and I appeared in Ebony Magazine and TLC’s Starter Wives Confidential.


I am featured in various media outlets including Ebony Magazine, Lumiere Magazine, Delux Magazine, Bronze Magazine, Kontrol Magazine, Café Mocha Radio (hosted by hip hop legend MC Lyte, comedienne  Loni Love and broadcast veteran Angelique Perrin),  CentricTV (BET Networks), Hot 97 FM Street Soldiers with Lisa Evers, The Jennifer Keitt Show, and many others. I am the owner of Life Rebuilding, a private practice in New York, and have worked in the field of Psychology for over a decade.

I am extremely passionate about helping others live from their heart and experience true joy, passion and bliss! More and more people are unhappy, committing suicide, using drugs and sex to numb their pain, or are in dysfunctional relationships-but there is another way, and my goal is to spread that secret to the world.

How Naked & Transparent Can Help Change The World

Naked & Transparent contains vital tools and an interactive workbook and DVD that will transform the minds and hearts of anyone who wants a better, more exciting and fulfilling life, and the results will be life changing! I practiced all of the tools I presented in the book, and they all worked for me and other clients who did the work!

In the book, I’ll be revealing some of my deepest fears and insecurities and how I was able to overcome them.

If the tools presented in the book helped me turn my life around, I know it can and will help others!!


I'm asking for your help to spread the word by funding the publication of my book.

Together, we can change the world!





Please Help Me Help Thousands of People Transform Their Lives!

I've already written Naked & Transparent: The Six Vital Tools to Knowing Yourself & Attracting What You Want In Relationships

What's Next?

Please spread the word and make a donation! I believe in the power of this book, and have donated countless hours into getting the book published by July 30, 2014. However, publishing a book of this caliber takes money. The money I am requesting from this Indiegogo campaign does NOT go into my purse. It will go into the pockets of:

  • Editors
  • Designers
  • Marketers
  • Formatters
  • and a Book Printer

As you can see, I need your help to make Naked & Transparent possible! Please donate any amount that you can so that I can reach more people and transform lives!


What's in it for you?

The biggest perk you will receive is the satisfaction of knowing you're helping thousands of people improve their lives. Additionally, you will receive in return perks/rewards.  Details of each perk are listed along the entire right column of this page. 

If you make a contribution, I will be eternally grateful for your support!

Please share my Indiegogo link with all your contacts as well on your social media sites. I thank you again for being on the front end of this special vision by donating! 


Sincerely,


Vladimire Calixte


 

Finally, I just want to thank you again for your help!

story:
“Every particular in nature, a leaf, a drop, a crystal, a moment of time is related to the whole, and partakes of the perfection of the whole.”
Ralph Waldo Emerson, an American essayist, lecturer, and poet


The Passionate Story for Nature’s Glory

Hello, Amazing People!

My name is Alexander and I come from a small but very beautiful country of Moldova. I am an alumnus of AIESEC, member of JCI and Let’s Do It!, fellow of Kairos Society and an Ashoka Changemaker. It happened so that I am a multifaceted person: engaged in environmental research, social entrepreneurship, education and training, writing prose and poetry, etc. However, all my energy is focused on one PASSION – the NATURE.

"Care about the Earth as the only home and true friend you have.

Because it really is so."

Since early childhood I admire the beauty and wisdom of the Nature. Also I care much about its protection from a large number of environmentally destructive human activities and therefore engage in environmental initiatives and promote the need to protect the environment. This has become my mission in life.

In order to share the Nature’s awesomeness and the importance of conserving it with other people, I started writing poems on this topic. You can read them in my first book “The Thoughts” and my blog with the same name: http://ischenco-thoughts.blogspot.com. I have also made some public readings of my creations at a number of events, such as the Free Tribe in Chisinau, Moldova.

The poems were then supplied by 2 short stories: “Black Hole” and “Road to Happiness”. And now I have come to the point to start releasing my first large trilogy of novels under the title “THE MONSTER”.

This will also be my first “experiment” of publishing and demonstrating the awesomeness of a crowdsourced literature creation – THE NOVEL FOR THE PEOPLE BY THE PEOPLE.


A Novel that is Thrilling and New has been Written for You

“The Monster: Blade of Darkness” is the first part of the science fiction trilogy about the nature, its connection with mankind and the importance of a balanced and sustainable coexistence between them. It is an interesting combination of adventure and detective story, real scientific facts about the environment, philosophical reflections about life and nature and our place in it, and all this is sweetened by a tender romantic story and humour.

One of the key learning points from my trip to South Africa.

The novel will take you to a remote tropical island, where you will join its heroes to save the local tribe and investigate the mystery of the Monster wandering there, as well as of the whole island. Together with Jessie and Jack you will meet a tribe of natural disaster victims, track the footprints of a mysterious creature in the depth of tropical jungle, hunt together with experienced snipers and battle robots, explore the unknown drawings and symbols in the darkness of a cave and during all that enjoy the breathtaking beauty of the island’s natural environment and get to know how its ecosystem functions.


One of the images drawn by me during the writing of the novel.

Thus, by writing and publishing the novel “The Monster: Blade of Darkness”, I want to achieve the following:

+ Take you away from your daily routine to a distant island and offer you to take part in and enjoy the thrilling mystery-solving adventure you will never forget;

+ Show you the beauty and awesomeness of the natural environment and the need to keep it protected and undamaged;

+ Teach you about the wonders of the nature and how the natural ecosystem functions based on real scientific research and facts;

+ Discuss with you the interrelations between Human and Nature in present and how can they evolve in the future;

+ Remind you of the core principles of ethics, empathy and humanity and why we need them;

+ Let you experience the tenderness and unpredictability of true love;

+ And last but not least test the possibility of making a community-created book as part of the concept of collaborative economy and society.


We Interact to Create the Impact

The idea to write “The Monster” trilogy was born back in 2000, when I was in school in the 10th grade. And it is then I had started working on its first novel - “The Monster: Blade of Darkness”. As you see, it took me almost 13 years to write, shape and polish the text of the novel in my native language, Russian. Now it is ready to be released.

My notebooks with the draft version of the novel.

However, I have decided to make the novel open for people’s contributions to make it a crowdsourced one – the novel for the people by the people. And contributions have come.

Nowadays the Russian text is edited by Violina Mihalevskaia, a wonderful professor and expert in Russian language and literature. The text will then be translated into English by a group of experienced translators and my very good friends. The illustrations are provided by an amazing artist from Ukraine, Catherine Starostenko, and a number of other painters, whom I have met at the Free Tribe events in Moldova. Valuable consultations on Medicine, Biology, Ecology, Engineering, etc. to improve the scientific component of the novel and make it exceptionally realistic were supplied by a multitude of friends and people I occasionally interacted with. And even this campaign was done with the support of Tatiana Shevchenko and Michael Watts, organizers of the Free Tribe events and my very good friends.

The first illustration for the novel by Catherine Starostenko.

Of course, all these contributions are made on the basis of pure interest and desire to help. Isn’t it just amazing how people join together willingly to create something meaningful!

Still, I would really like to reward them for their contributions and making the novel take its final shape. Besides, there are still resources needed to publish the first 1000 copies of the book in Russian and English. The budget for the whole project was estimated at 2379 USD.

Not having such resources available I decided once again to use the principles of collaborative society, open this project for contributions and build a true community of contributors to it.

A community that YOU can be part of.


Your Opportunity to Join the Community!

Thus, I invite you to explore the perks offered here and choose the one you would like to have. They range from a personal thank you message, your name in the gratitude list in the book and an e-book to a real book in Russian or English delivered to you (does not include shipping costs!), copies for your friends, interview with you and your personal gratitude page in all books of “The Monster” trilogy.

The Gratitude List with the first names.

You may consider these perks as simple pre-order of the book and other benefits or as joining the community of contributors to a novel that will make many people start perceiving the beauty and wisdom of the nature and taking actions for its protection and conservation.

You are also welcome to help non-financially by:

+ Sharing this campaign and spreading the word about it;

+ Offering your kind support and contribution as an illustrator / translator / publisher.

In any case I will be very grateful to any help you can offer and welcome you to the community of contributors for making this dream happen!


Testimonials

“The novel is quite readable; there are many scientific facts and moments.

The whole picture is interesting; the problem described is of current interest indeed…”

Mihalevskaia Violina Nikolaevna, expert in Russian language and literature and editor of the novel

“Every particular in nature, a leaf, a drop, a
crystal, a moment of time is related to the whole, and partakes of the
perfection of the whole.”Ralph Waldo Emerson, an American essayist, lecturer,
and poet


The Passionate Story for Nature’s Glory
Hello,
Amazing People!
My
name is Alexander
and I come from a small but very beautiful country of Moldova. I am an alumnus of AIESEC, member of JCI
and Let’s Do It!, fellow of Kairos Society and an Ashoka Changemaker.
It happened so that I am a multifaceted person: engaged in environmental
research, social entrepreneurship, education and training, writing prose and
poetry, etc. However, all my energy is focused on one PASSION – the NATURE.

"Care about the Earth as the only home and true
friend you have.
Because
it really is so."
Since
early childhood I admire the beauty and wisdom of the Nature. Also I care much
about its protection from a large number of environmentally destructive human
activities and therefore engage in environmental initiatives and promote the
need to protect the environment. This has become my mission in life.
In
order to share the Nature’s awesomeness and the importance of conserving it with
other people, I started writing poems on this topic. You can read them in my
first book “The
Thoughts” and my blog with the same name: http://ischenco-thoughts.blogspot.com.
I have also made some public readings of my creations at a number of events,
such as the Free Tribe in Chisinau, Moldova.
The
poems were then supplied by 2 short stories: “Black Hole”
and “Road
to Happiness”. And now I have come to the point to start releasing my first
large trilogy of novels under the title “THE
MONSTER”.

This
will also be my first “experiment” of publishing and demonstrating the
awesomeness of a crowdsourced literature creation – THE NOVEL FOR THE PEOPLE BY
THE PEOPLE.
A Novel that is Thrilling and New has been
Written for You
“The
Monster: Blade of Darkness” is the first part of the science fiction trilogy about
the nature, its connection with mankind and the importance of a balanced and
sustainable coexistence between them. It is an interesting combination of adventure
and detective story, real scientific facts about the environment, philosophical
reflections about life and nature and our place in it, and all this is
sweetened by a tender romantic story and humour.
One of the key learning points from my trip to South Africa.

The
novel will take you to a remote tropical island, where you will join its heroes
to save the local tribe and investigate the mystery of the Monster wandering
there, as well as of the whole island. Together with Jessie and Jack you will meet
a tribe of natural disaster victims, track the footprints of a mysterious
creature in the depth of tropical jungle, hunt together with experienced
snipers and battle robots, explore the unknown drawings and symbols in the
darkness of a cave and during all that enjoy the breathtaking beauty of the
island’s natural environment and get to know how its ecosystem functions.One
of the images drawn by me during the writing of the novel.

Thus,
by writing and publishing the novel “The Monster: Blade of Darkness”, I want to
achieve the following:
+
Take you away from your daily routine to a distant island and offer you to take
part in and enjoy the thrilling mystery-solving adventure you will never
forget;
+
Show you the beauty and awesomeness of the natural environment and the need to
keep it protected and undamaged;
+
Teach you about the wonders of the nature and how the natural ecosystem
functions based on real scientific research and facts;
+ Discuss
with you the interrelations between Human and Nature in present and how can
they evolve in the future;
+
Remind you of the core principles of ethics, empathy and humanity and why we
need them;
+
Let you experience the tenderness and unpredictability of true love;
+
And last but not least test the possibility of making a community-created book
as part of the concept of collaborative economy and society.We Interact to Create the Impact

story:
Updates!

I added a 2-chapter preview of my book, just click on the Gallery tab!

If you want to know more about the book and see what it is you'd be funding, that's the perfect place to start. Enjoy. :)


The Book

Synopsis:

demiGod

The world is split between Agnecs--the Old Worlders--and Amblers--The New Worlders.

Aiden is an outcast with at least one dark secret and many mysteries. He's bitterly stuck between being an Agnec--from a world of of magic and shadows--and an Ambler--living a life of "normalcy". Years have passed since he was ousted from the Guild where he once trained to become a part of the magical D'Tari Order, but ever since, he's been making a living as a bounty hunter on the streets of Philadelphia, posing as an Ambler.

When a self-serving Agnec politician announces legislation that could threaten both Agnecs and Amblers, the Guild calls upon Aiden to protect one of their representatives.

But why would the Guild, after having expelled him, after hating him, ask for his help? And who is the young woman he's protecting anyway? Joined by his friend D'Natis, the highly intelligent Raven Lord, Aiden learns he can only find answers by taking the job.

History:

This story has been in the making, in one way or another, for almost ten years, give or take. So to speak. :) The first real incarnation of this came about as a webcomic-turned-comic book. But I knew the story was bigger than what I could accomplish through art. The second incarnation came as an ebook short story and prequel called London Pale, which is currently available for Kindle.

The Goal

If you contribute to this project, there's two things you'll be helping me achieve:

1. Getting my novel demiGod professionally edited and prepped for publication.

2. Getting my publishing company Agnec Press up and running.

This is only Phase 1, but more on that in a minute.

I have a passion to see this story become the best version of itself, and I need a little help to accomplish that. Not only is this a very important story to be told, but when this book is finally published, a percentage of the proceeds will go to the HCMA (Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Association) to help people struggling with HCM, a heart condition I also struggle with.

It needs to be the very best. It also needs to be published outside the bounds of traditional publishing, as most traditional publishers don't often desire to take on a debut novel that gives proceeds to charity.

After this campaign, I'll be moving on to Phase 2: Publication.

What I Need & What You Get

What I need:

  • I need $1536 for comprehensive editorial work. We're talking the works. I want this to be the best it can be, and I have one of the best editors lined up.
  • The rest of the $1800 covers all my startup expenses for Agnec Press: licensing, promotion, etc.
  • Any extra funding will go toward the goals of Phase 2.

What you get (see the column to the right for what you get at each tier of donation, but here's a brief description of some of the prizes):

  • A copy of my ebook London Pale, the prequel to demiGod.
  • An autographed concept art mini-poster, featuring Aiden and D'Natis the Raven Lord.
  • A chance to be immortalized as a character in the book.
  • Recognition as a supporter on my site and in the book! (I'll tell the world you rock!)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to donate, you can still contribute in a few different ways:

  • Spread the word! Tell friends, family, and any generous millionaires who like good fiction. ;)
  • Share this page and any of my demiGod-related materials on all your favorite social media sites.
  • Share my ebook London Pale with people who like good fantasy, urban fantasy, life stories, action/adventure, or just good literature.
  • Tell people about the HCMA!

story:
Who Am I and What's the Plan?


My name is Edward Renehan. I'm the author of numerous histories and biographies which have won critical praise in the New York Times and other publications, and which have sold well both domestically and internationally. My books include The Secret Six (Crown/Random House), The Lion's Pride (Oxford University Press), The Kennedys at War (Doubleday) and Dark Genius of Wall Street (Basic/Perseus). I have also contributed many reviews and essays to such publications as The Wall Street Journal, San Francisco Chronicle, and Hearst's Veranda, and appeared frequently on C-SPAN's BookTV. As well, I'm in the 35th year of a career on the editorial side of publishing, having held major positions at Macmillan, St. Martin's Press and other houses. I am currently the proprietor of my own small, human-sized firm (New Street Communications, founded 2010) doing digital, paper and audio publishing out of a home office near Newport, RI. I love the democratizing impact which the new digital tools have had on publishing, and am delighted to be a participant in helping build/shape a paradigm in which all writers have an equal opportunity to succeed.

My other love is folk music. I am an adequate guitar-picker (to the extent that I recorded with Pete Seeger for Folkways in the 1970s, and have performed on stage with the likes of Happy and Artie Traum). My latest published book is Pete Seeger vs. The Un-Americans - A Tale of the Blacklist. This book was successfully crowd-funded via Kickstarter, and has been praised by the likes of actor/director Steve Buscemi (Boardwalk Empire's Nucky Thompson), who called it "Excellent, a truly enjoyable and informative read."

I am currently on the back-end of researching and writing the first book ever to focus on one of the most important events in American musical culture: Bob Dylan's controversial and dramatic transition from acoustic to electric music with the Paul Butterfield Blues Band at the Newport Folk Festival in 1965 (half a century ago this July). The book is based on new interviews with key participants, as well as unpublished memoirs and other unique, previously-untapped sources. The book also includes numerous never-before-seen photographs. Most importantly, the book dispels the many myths and urban legends which surround the event (many of them perpetuated in the most popular Dylan biographies published in recent years). My aim has been to cut to the facts as they happened on the ground, while also providing context for what Dylan's shift meant as a key moment in the history of the sixties.

The book will be published in three editions: eBook, paper, and audio.

At this stage in the process - with photo licensing fees pending, paper book production pending,  and [very expensive] production to begin shortly on the audio edition - I could use some cash-flow to follow-through on the project. I am therefore seeking to crowd-fund these last stages of the book with what amounts to discounted pre-sale of the various editions, along with perks.

I hope you'll consider joining me in what I consider to be an exciting and important venture.


What I Need & What You Get


  • At this stage in the process, I'd ideally like to get $5,000 (or more) to help complete all phases of the project.
  • I've set up a menu of perks which in essence represent discounts against what will be the retail pricing of the book in its various editions after publication, and also include such additional goodies as the placing of your name in the acknowledgments and a full size poster of the cover art.
  • As mentioned above, the funds will go for the most part toward final production and prep of the various editions, as well as photo-licensing.


Impact


DYLAN AT NEWPORT, 1965 will, I feel, be a very important addition to the canon of literature depicting the era of the sixties and the canon of literature about one of the greatest songwriters of our time.



Help Me Get The Word Out


  • Please let your friends know about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU in advance.
