I wrote this book because I know many people struggle with anxiety and other mental illnesses and are not sure how to cope with or overcome it. As a person who has struggled with anxiety on a daily basis, I figured out different ways to ease my mind and live a life of balance, well-being, and happiness.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you are in control of your destiny, this is your life and you write your story. Do not let your anxiety hold you back. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for living a life of balance and well-being in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you take back your life and control your destiny. You are the author of your life and you have the power to write your story!In this book, you'll learn about:

Mindfulness- How to control your thoughts, live mindfully in each moment of every day, and how to benefit from meditation and yoga practices.
The Law of Attraction - Learn about the Law of Attraction and the Power of Manifestation and how to use it in your life every day.
Diet - In this book I discuss how your gut health is directly linked to your mental health (the mind-gut connection), foods for the mind and body, important vitamins and minerals, and how much water you need each day.

 
You will love this book if you struggle with anxiety, or the related, and want to learn new ways to actively manage your mental health and live a life of balance, health, and happiness.Living Free is a non-fiction book that speaks to people who are struggling with their mental health or those who are interested in living a life of health and wellness.
The book is written in 3 Parts....Part One contains the Introduction + Chapter 1. In the intro, you will learn a little about my story and why I felt called to write this book. You will also learn a bit about the science of the brain and more on mental health statistics. Additionally, you will learn how to look at your life objectively and figure out what triggers you.Part Two contains Chapters 2-14. Throughout these chapters, you will learn many different tips and tricks that have helped myself and many others actively manage their mental health which leads to happier and healthier lives. In these chapters, I discuss mindfulness, living an active life, diet, aromatherapy, spirituality, how to structure your life, how to control obsessive thoughts, the importance of reflection, how to use the Law of Attraction, and more. My hope is that you will learn new things that you can implement into your daily life.Part Three contains Chapter 15 and a Guided Workbook. In the last chapter, I give some of my final thoughts, words of wisdom, and my hope for you. In the guided workbook, I share lists of foods, vitamins, essential oils, stretching routines, workouts, recipes, positive affirmations, and some other recommendations.

story:
The Story of Out of OCD

OCD is one of the top 10 most debilitating and chronic disorders in the world but is still largely misunderstood. If you are suffering from OCD, you may feel alone, ashamed, confused, and, well, crazy. You are not alone. This book can show you a way out and a way forward.

My name is Toi Hershman, I am the author of Out of OCD. I wrote this book because I have OCD and FINALLY, after over 30 years of dealing with this disorder and fighting, I found the right help. I don’t want ANYONE else to wait that long. I wrote this book because I had to. I always felt alone and nuts with my secret disorder. If this book helps just one person seek and find their way out, it is a huge success. 

This book is my memoir based on my experience with this beast/bully called OCD. Your experience will not be exactly the same, but I know you will see yourself in these pages. I hope to convey the utter frustration and helplessness felt with OCD and how escaping from this hellacious mental prison is achievable. 

Out of OCD speaks to OCD sufferers and those who love them. It is for ALL of you who are grappling with this horrible mental illness and aims to provide not only a path out of the OCD prison but what you learn and get from having OCD that will make you the strongest person you know. 

Ultimately, I hope that Out of OCD inspires you and helps you find your own way out of your OCD.

Are you struggling because most therapists you have seen really don’t help you? This book will help you decipher the good from the bad.

Do you feel like OCD is chronic and you cannot get better? You have OCD. However, you do NOT have to live by OCD’s rules. You can make OCD work for you. You will always have OCD... but OCD doesn’t always have to have you!

Are you sick and tired of having an evil micromanager taking up 90 percent or more of your brain space? Yep. Me too. I talk a lot about that and what you can gain from being free of this OCD gremlin. 

Are you mad because OCD is largely exploited in the media and the term is thrown around like an adjective? “Aw, dude! I am so OCD about that...” Yep, that pisses me off too! They have NO idea. This book sheds some light on that one as well. 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with you. I hope you enjoy the book. Thank you, and, I love you! 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs of publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!) - I will have some ideas and suggestions
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in December 2021.

What You Get

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You will have an exclusive invitation to my book launch party.

And much more!

Campaign Goals

Standard Tiers:
Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.
 

About the Author

Toi Elizabeth Hershman is an educational consultant and instructional designer (soon to be a Doctor of Education Instructional Design and Technology). She is driven by her own debilitating struggle with Obsessive Compulsive Disorder and is on a mission to help others battle their own OCD demons. 

She wrote this book because she came out the other side of OCD after a very long, horrible battle with it and is hopeful to help people in the throes of it. Toi has spent a great deal of her life with a large portion of her brain held hostage by OCD. This lead to so much suffering, relationship issues, an eating disorder, and loss of her own sense of self. She wants to, in some way, be a light in the dark for those also being bullied by OCD.

For more information, you can connect with Toi at toihershman@gmail.com. or toi@outofocd.com.  www.toihershman.com, www.facebook.com/toi.hershman. 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please DM me for more information.
 

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)

Use this form:  https://forms.gle/nTHYDbMkCWrggngE7    to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

 

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit).

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #OutofOCD and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag: 
Instragram - @toihershman / @newdegreepress
Facebook - @toihershman / @NewDegreePress 
Twitter - @toihershman/ @NewDegreePress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Toi

Bref résumé

Je m'apelle ALBAN SUAREZ je suis prof de cinéma et aussi journaliste depuis 10 ans spécialisé en manga, japanimation, cinéma, animation et donc jeu vidéo et les projets GAMES HISTORY sont développés par notre association à but non lucratif et pour la première fois je travaille en tant qu'indépendant avec cette collection que j'ai créé en 2010. l'investissement et l'aide que vous pourrez nous donner vous permettra de récupérer au centuple votre argent en livres dédicacés avec votre mention aux crédits de l'ouvrage !

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

3000 euros ici demandés c'est la moitié (un peu moins du prix de l'impression) en sachant qu'un livre, un tome de GAMES HISTORY coute plus de 10 000 euros à fait ces 3000 donc sont un allégemment et un soutient à notre production pour pas que nous repoussions à dans de trop nombreux mois la réalisation de notre prochain livre.

L'impact

avec votre aide pour notre livre c'est un investissement donné à l'histoire du jeu vidéo que nous voulons fair rentrer dans les moeurs et ainsi milité pour un art trop souvent déprécié et pas encore rentrer dans l'esprit du monde comme un art à part entière alors amis militant soutenez nous !!!!!

D'autres façons d'aider

nous aider ce n'est pas que nous donner des fonds c'est aussi et surtout parler de nous, nous faire de la publicité nous proposer des idées pour nous faire mieux connaitre car aujourd'hui avec la grande distribution des lvires nous sommes commes des petits producteurs, fermiers du larzac qui tentons par tout les moyens de pouvoir faire des livres dans le seul et unique but d'ne faire d'autres survivre et ne pas faire grossir un capital pour des nantis car je le répète nous sommes une association culturelle ! nous donnons des conférences participons à des festivals et enseignons nos passions

story:
Fighting for Tucker!

Tucker has cystic fibrosis--and a lot of living to do!  He's just 24 years old, and has had a rough year with long hospital stays, and tough decisions ahead.  Tucker's lungs are damaged from the thick mucus that CF's defective gene creates and builds up, creating rich environments for chronic infections. 

Cystic Fibrosis takes your breath away--literally. 

Like many CF patients who are living into adulthood, Tucker has had insurance nightmares.  It's tough to have full-time work with benefits when you spend large chunks of time in the hospital, and Medicaid hasn't quite caught on that CF patients are living longer, and need appropirate coverage. 

In the 1950's, CF patients were not expected to live to start kindergarten.

Today, young adults with CF are doing amazing things--surfing, running, holding babies up in air!  Carving pumpkins!  Living.  Breathing.  Waitiing for a cure. 

There are only 30,000 people in the United States with Cystic Fibrosis. 

But if you know even one of those people, you know that 30.000 is way too many.

Until a cure can be found (and the folks at www.cff.org are working so hard to make that happen), the best we can do is support full living.  And Tucker needs our help to do that NOW. 

He is home from the hospital, and needs several prescription drugs to keep his lungs clear.  He's fighting for insurance coverage. but needs some short term support. 

Your donation will provide Tucker the air that he needs to see him through this tough spot.  You can donate via PayPal, which will go to Tucker's family immediately, or you can donate via Credit Card, and the funds will be dispersed at the end of this campaign (Tucker's 25th birthday, February 24th, 2013). 

From all of us who know and love Tucker, thank you is not enough.

story:
UPDATE OCT. 5:

First articles are up! Check the updates tab above for links.  Please donate if you'd like to see more!

UPDATE Oct. 2:

Friends and family, your generous contributions helped me hit my funding benchmark before I even touched down in Venezuela. Thank you so much for supporting me, and helping this project get off the ground.  If you are just visiting this page, and still feeling inspired, you can still donate and be assured that the funds will help me complete the project. 

To ensure I rasied money, I did not include the cost of internal country travel, expenses, or any of the labour I will spend editing pieces upon my return.  Any donations over the initial $940 will fund those expenses, and the work I will be doing on the ground while here. If I raise a significant amount over my goal, I will also be able to donate some of the audio-visual equipment I brought with me to the video cooperatives here, and replace it upon turning home.

Also, there´s still some good perks left, so get them while you can!

Always,

x ace.

About the Project

In 2009, I was a Fulbright scholar to Venezuela working with a video collective that empowers people with basic video skills to organize their communities. I was so impressed by their work, that I co-founded a video cooperative in Portland, OR, where I have been working for the past two years as a writer and videographer dedicated to covering issues of social justice in my community.

This October, I will return to Venezuela to report on the historic elections taking place from a people's movement perspective. In order to do this, I need to raise $940 to cover the cost of travel. With your help, I will be able to write four articles, interviewing key members of Venezuela's social movements, and ensure that English-speaking audiences can follow what's really happening on the ground.

Where the $'s Going

While transportation and food are subsidized in Venezuela (they only pay 10 cents/gallon of gas!), the plane ticket is extremely expensive. This is because thousands of Venezuelans currently living in the United States are flying home to vote on October 7. Despite this, Venezuela's democracy and people are so important to me that I've already bought my ticket. Once on the ground, I'll bus around as cheap as possible, and eat big family style meals of rice and beans. With your help, I'll be able to have a birthday cake when I come back...not just a big credit card bill.

About the Impact

There is an unprecedented amount at stake during this election process, and virtually no U.S. coverage is reporting from the ground up. While the mainstream press is focusing on the left/right politics of Venezuela's elections, it is largely ignoring the voices of an entire network of independent media makers, community activists, and the new lower-middle class that form the backbone of the progressive populace that either candidate will have to answer to if they are elected President.  In fact, most U.S. coverage actually deepens misconceptions about the nature of Venezuela's democracy, the extent of crime and corruption, freedom of the press, etc.
 
To counter this lack of analysis, I will write a series of blog posts and articles chronicling the reflections, criticisms, and suggestions of the community activists who will continue doing their work regardless of the election results.   My goal is to frame the election for U.S. readers, so that they understand the divided nature of the Venezuelan political scene, and the inherent class divisions that it usually runs along.  I hope to open up some of the nuance, and address some of the confusion, that surrounds Venezuela's political situation. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This project needs an engaged community to help me pull it off. Even if you aren't able to support me financially, there are lots of other ways to help. You could post the campaign on your Facebook account, so that other people who might be interested can learn about what I'm doing, or tweet about it to people who would be interested in seeing the sort of coverage I'll provide.  You could also email it to any friends or co-workers you have with similar interests.  Finally, as I start to write articles, you could read them and share them on the internet as well, letting people know how they can support the project.  Every little bit counts.

UPDATE OCT. 5: 
First articles are up! Check the updates tab above for links.  Please donate if you'd like to see more!

UPDATE Oct. 2: 
Friends and family, your generous contributions helped me hit my funding benchmark before I even touched down in Venezuela. Thank you so much for supporting me, and helping this project get off the ground.  If you are just visiting this page, and still feeling inspired, you can still donate and be assured that the funds will help me complete the project.  
To ensure I rasied money, I did not include the cost of internal country travel, expenses, or any of the labour I will spend editing pieces upon my return.  Any donations over the initial $940 will fund those expenses, and the work I will be doing on the ground while here. If I raise a significant amount over my goal, I will also be able to donate some of the audio-visual equipment I brought with me to the video cooperatives here, and replace it upon turning home.
Also, there´s still some good perks left, so get them while you can! 
Always, 
x ace.
About the Project
In 2009, I was a Fulbright scholar to Venezuela working with a video collective that empowers people with basic video skills to organize their communities. I was so impressed by their work, that I co-founded a video cooperative in Portland, OR, where I have been working for the past two years as a writer and videographer dedicated to covering issues of social justice in my community. This October, I will return to Venezuela to report on the historic elections taking place from a people's movement perspective. In order to do this, I need to raise $940 to cover the cost of travel. With your help, I will be able to write four articles, interviewing key members of Venezuela's social movements, and ensure that English-speaking audiences can follow what's really happening on the ground.
Where the $'s Going

While transportation and food are subsidized in Venezuela (they only pay 10 cents/gallon of gas!), the plane ticket is extremely expensive. This is because thousands of Venezuelans currently living in the United States are flying home to vote on October 7. Despite this, Venezuela's democracy and people are so important to me that I've already bought my ticket. Once on the ground, I'll bus around as cheap as possible, and eat big family style meals of rice and beans. With your help, I'll be able to have a birthday cake when I come back...not just a big credit card bill.

About the Impact
There is an unprecedented amount at stake during this election process, and virtually no U.S. coverage is reporting from the ground up. While the mainstream press is focusing on the left/right politics of Venezuela's elections, it is largely ignoring the voices of an entire network of independent media makers, community activists, and the new lower-middle class that form the backbone of the progressive populace that either candidate will have to answer to if they are elected President.  In fact, most U.S. coverage actually deepens misconceptions about the nature of Venezuela's democracy, the extent of crime and corruption, freedom of the press, etc.
 
To counter this lack of analysis, I will write a series of blog posts and articles chronicling the reflections, criticisms, and suggestions of the community activists who will continue doing their work regardless of the election results.   My goal is to frame the election for U.S. readers, so that they understand the divided nature of the Venezuelan political scene, and the inherent class divisions that it usually runs along.  I hope to open up some of the nuance, and address some of the confusion, that surrounds Venezuela's political situation. 

Other Ways You Can Help
This project needs an engaged community to help me pull it off. Even if you aren't able to support me financially, there are lots of other ways to help. You could post the campaign on your Facebook account, so that other people who might be interested can learn about what I'm doing, or tweet about it to people who would be interested in seeing the sort of coverage I'll provide.  You could also email it to any friends or co-workers you have with similar interests.  Finally, as I start to write articles, you could read them and share them on the internet as well, letting people know how they can support the project.  Every little bit counts.

story:
Carolina Scientific at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

Hey everybody! I'm Garrick Talmage, the Editor-in-Chief of Carolina Scientific, a student organization at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.  Carolina Scientific strives to provide a way for students to discover and express their knowledge of new scientific advances, encourage students to explore and report on the latest scientific research at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, and educate readers while promoting interest in science research. Carolina Scientific creates a vital connection between the undergraduate students and professors on campus. Please visit our homepage if you would like more information.


We produce two print magazines each semester, and we started a blog to provide additional content to our readers. There are 15 people on our writing staff, 8 members of the production staff, and 8 members on the editing team. We all work together to make the final publication. Writers interview professors on campus about their research, the production staff lays out each article, and the editing team edits articles and improves the overall design of the magazine. Many students spend countless hours each semester to make our publication possible.

Creating an Innovative Connection Between the University and its Undergraduates

Our student organization has an enormous impact on the research community at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Many undergraduates become involved in undergraduate research because of our magazine. The University is very focused on creative initiatives that promote innovation and research, and Carolina Scientific is just that. Without funding, we won't be able to print enough copies of the magazine to spread the news about all of the amazing research at UNC!


What We Need & What You Get

We have two publications each year. To get an idea of the magazines that we produce, you can go to our archives.


UNC-Chapel Hill's Student Congress has been able to fund us $3005. It is difficult for Student Congress to give much more to us because of how many student organizations there are. To print 2500 issues, we need $3800. Thus, we will need:


Fall Issue: $3800 - $3005 = $795

Spring Issue: $3800

Total: $4595


If we don't reach our entire goal, we will try and distribute the money evenly so that we can print an equal number of issues in each semester.


There are numerous different possible perks if you contribute to our project. Our organization would consider you as a part of our team; we would love to help you contribute to the design of the magazine.  You can receive a copy of the magazine as well. If you would like to use multiple copies of our magazine for education or classroom purposes. If you are in anyway associated with the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, we would also love to feature your research project in our magazine. Simply put, there are many different perks we could provide - please contact us if you have any unique ideas, or would like to work something out with us. See the available perks on the right-hand side.

Help us spread the word!

We'd love it if you shared our publication itself! Please share our campaign with anyone that you think might be interested in funding us! Use all of the sharing functions available! Spread the word about us on social media: Facebook and Twitter.


Thank you so much! Any help that you can provide would be tremendous and very much appreciated!

story:
Thank you for visiting the campaign page for my new novel: "Electrical switch grenade".

PLOT:

From Australian author Liam Jennings (Beautiful Cadavers) comes Electrical Switch Grenade, the rock 'n' roll fable of Pella, the lead guitarist in the all-girl rock outfit "The Dregs".

The night of yet another terrible gig, Pella has a run in with a mysterious man named "Popgun". The man claims to not only be able to see music, but also manipulate it. With her help, he promises to elevate the band into the history books and create the perfect sound. After the tragic loss of their drummer, Pella and bass guitarist Gretchen decide to take the man up on his offer with some horrifying consequences.

From the writer of Beautiful Cadavers, comes a salute to the golden era of rock 'n' roll through a psychedelic thrill-ride of would be stardom and lost youth. Sometimes hilarious, but mostly downright absurd, Electrical switch grenade is an experience like no other and one that you will never forget.

 

 

“Getting lost in a stage image is one thing, but getting lost within a persona? That’s when things get really dangerous”

 

GOAL:


My Goal is to raise enough money to successfully self publish a work of the highest quality possible.

The Impact:

With your help, I can publish a novel that is both unique and unforgettable. With my beautiful art, thanks to the lovely cartoonist Lucy Knisley (French milk), I hope it's as eye catching as the novel is engaging.
I will self distribute in a manner of different ways, having the book available to independent bookstores as well as online via PDF and also a print on demand service. The more donations I receive, the more options I have and the better the outcome will be!

I CAN ONLY DO IT WITH YOUR HELP!

Your donation will go towards the cost of:

  • Professional Editing
  • Graphic design
  • Promotional work
  • Printing & Binding
  • Distribution costs
  • Video Trailer
  • Your very own copy of the book!

 


 

REVIEWS (Beautiful Cadavers)

"Liam’s debut is commendable in its raw and unflinching portrayal of a man lost in his surroundings (which just so happens to be the Japanese sex industry). The interesting thing about ‘Beautiful cadavers’ is the lead character – which is a mirror of Liam himself and with the opening quote: ‘to Become a spectator of one’s own life is to escape the suffering of life’ nothing is truer with this book. Though I would never recommend this to a wider audience and the content gets a little too much on occasion, there was something scratching the surface here, something bold and most of all psychotic that kept me interested until the last page, Liam did his research here and it shows. He balances the narrative on a thin line of reality and fantasy where the spiral of his downfall takes many unexpected turns. Just know what you are in for before you pick this one up, I feel this is intended for fans of Skins, Larry Clarke's: Kids & Ken Park. I can see this book growing a small cult following. This is a book to persevere with." By Jane Davidson

"In Beautiful Cadavers, Liam manages to capture an erratic form of love full of lust and dependence. With fascinating concepts and at times poetic language, the story has a unique juxtaposition between the harshness of the world seen through eyes and the painful passion experienced from the heart. Truthful, erotic, raw and sometimes dreadful this story has an underlying tone of sadness and yearning compassion that no amount of blood can cover up. "
By Britt Nichols


LASTLY:

Thank you so much for even reading this far! I really mean it! Thank you, thank you!
This project has been a very personal one for me and if you can help in any way, even by just telling your friends, that would be very much appreciated. The beauty of Social Networking is that little "share" button. It's only one click of your time and it would help me out so much! Spread the word! That's all I need! Lets get underground Australian fiction on the map! Oh! and thanks again!

PS: Follow me on Twitter and say hi!

story:
For the last 3 years I have slowly been working on a memoir called "Because We Are Trees" about growing up on Cape Cod. While that might sound quaint and like it's about seashells, it's about my life...so it's whatever the opposite of quaint is. In order to complete this manuscript, I've got to do research in New England with my family members. I set aside time to do this after I go to Vermont Studio Center from early July to Early August. I was accepted off the waitlist and given a partial scholarship, but was just alerted to the fact they wanted $2450 by June 6th. ***Update, after assessing the financial situation that attending VSC would put me in, I have determined that it no longer makes sense for me to attend this year, which is unfortunate. However, I am still very much going to be writing and researching in New England this summer, and want to make sure that I am able to do so without bankrupting myself. Please assist me in completing this work. All donations will get a thank you in the acknowledgements of the memoir! Much love!

Casey

story:
What is to Become of Humankind?

The future of humankind as an ever-changing organism is a subject of much debate. Where is our evolutionary path leading? Will the next rung take the form of mental transcendence, will it set humankind on a course toward divinity, or will this uncertain path involve a dark and terrible reversion?  Co-editors Michael Bailey and Darren Speegle present eighteen tales of dark science fiction that explore the course of evolution, written by some of the best literary minds in the fields of science fiction and horror:

  • Laird Barron - "Swift to Chase"
  • Chaz Brenchley - "Ch-ch-changes"
  • Ramsey Campbell - "How He Helped"
  • Scott Edelman - "Pity this Busy Monster Not"
  • Brian Evenson - "Nameless Citizen"
  • Erinn L. Kemper - "A Laughing Matter"
  • John Langan - "My Father, Dr. Frankenstein"
  • Roberta Lannes - "Painting the Burning Fence"
  • Tim Lebbon - "Strings"
  • Rena Mason - "I Will Be the Making of You"
  • Paul Meloy - "The Serile"
  • Mark Morris - "Undersound"
  • Lisa Morton - "Eyes of the Beholders"
  • Gene O'Neill - "Spirits"
  • Mark Samuels - "An End to Perpetual Motion"
  • B.E. Scully - "The Mythic Hero Most Likely to Squeeze a Stone"
  • Jeffrey Thomas - "Sliced Bread"
  • Damien Angelica Walters - "Filigree, Minotaur, Cyanide, Bloom"

ADAM'S LADDER will be published in eBook, trade paperback, and in a 100-numbered / limited edition (signed by its editors, Michael Bailey and Darren Speegle).

What is to Become of Written Backwards?

Over the last ten years, Written Backwards has published multiple award-winning anthologies, fiction collections, and standalone novels and novellas, ranging from dark science fiction to horror. Previous anthologies include the Bram Stoker Award-winning THE LIBRARY OF THE DEAD, the Benjamin Franklin Award winning (and Stoker nominated) QUALIA NOUS, and three volumes of CHIRAL MAD (the latest also up for a Stoker). Books published by Written Backwards have seen eight individual works nominated for the prestigious Bram Stoker Award, with three of those stories taking home the statue. Other stories/poems have been nominated for the Nebula, the Rhysling, and others. Foreword Reviews Book of the Year, the Indie Book Awards, the Independent Publisher Book Awards, the Eric Hoffer Book Award, the International Book Award ... Written Backwards titles have seen over two dozen literary accolades over the years through its handful of titles! But we need your help bringing the next project to life: ADAM'S LADDER.

With your help, Written Backwards can continue in its legacy to:

  1. Seek out diverse voices, both new and well-established.
  2. Pay writers, poets, and artists professional rates.
  3. Provide fair publishing contracts.
  4. Design and publish some of the most beautiful books imaginable.
     

What is to Become of this Campaign?

You're probably wondering where your money will go for this particular campaign. Here's the breakdown:

  • 63.64% - goes directly to the writers, which includes professional payment at a per-word rate, plus the cost of contributor copies for the various editions of the book.
  • 31.22% - goes directly to publication costs for the eBook, trade paperback, and hardback editions of the book.
  • 5.14% - covers shipping.
  • And that's it. Zero profit will be made from this campaign. Any additional funds raised will go directly to future Written Backwards projects, some of which are already lined up as expansions/unlocks within this campaign.

This is an all-or-nothing campaign, so if it doesn't reach it's goal, the project gets canned. Anthologies (let's face it), are expensive to make (but we all want them), mostly because there are so many incredible contributors involved. We need to raise $6,500 to make this book happen, so we've come up with some enticing perks.

And that's how you can help ...

Check out the perks to the right to see how you can help bring ADAM'S LADDER to life, and if we get there, together, Written Backwards has some tricks to bring you even more great (and  FREE) books in the form of campaign unlocks and future anthologies.

PELLUCID LUNACY was the first anthology published by Written Backwards, and after ten years, the book is getting a face-lift. When the campaign reaches $7,000, all backers (contributing $95 or higher) will receive a complimentary copy of the trade paperback!

The title and author of the third illustrated book in the Allevon series by Written Backwards will be revealed when the campaign reaches $7,000. When the campaign reaches $8,000, all campaign backers (contributing $95 or higher) will receive a complimentary copy of the trade paperback.

The title and tentative cover of the next dark science fiction anthology by Written Backwards will be revealed when the campaign reaches $12,000, and all backers (contributing $95 or higher) will receive a complimentary digital copy in either PDF or EPUB.

[ to-be-announced ] will include fiction by:

Michael Marshall Smith
Ian Watson
Roberta Lannes
Scott Edelman
B.E. Scully
Lynda Rucker
Brian Evenson
Erinn L. Kemper
Chaz Brenchley
Tlotlo Tsamaase
Gene O'Neill
​Richard Thomas
Paul Meloy
... and others TBA

Stay tuned for more updates ...

 

What About the Contributors?

MICHAEL BAILEY (CO-EDITOR, COVER & INTERIOR DESIGN) 
is a multi-award-winning writer, editor, and book designer, and the recipient of over two dozen literary accolades, including the Bram Stoker Award, Benjamin Franklin Award, Eric Hoffer Book Award, and Independent Publisher Book Award. His nonlinear novels include Palindrome Hannah, Phoenix Rose, and Psychotropic Dragon, and he has published two short story and poetry collections, Scales and Petals and Inkblots and Blood Spots, as well as Enso, a children’s book. He has created anthologies such as Qualia Nous, The Library of the Dead, four volumes of Chiral Mad, You Human, and a series of illustrated books.

LAIRD BARRON ("SWIFT TO CHASE") 
spent his early years in Alaska, where he raced the Iditarod three times during the early 1990s and worked in the fishing and construction industries. He is the author of several books, including The Beautiful Thing That Awaits Us All, Swift to Chase, and the forthcoming novel Blood Standard. His work has also appeared in many magazines and anthologies. Barron currently resides in the Rondout Valley writing stories about the evil that men do.

CHAZ BRENCHLEY (“CH-CH-CHANGES”) 
has been making a living as a writer since the age of eighteen. He is the author of nine thrillers, four fantasy series (under three different names), two ghost stories and two collections. He lost count of his short stories long ago. His work has won the British Fantasy Award and a Lambda Award. He has recently married and moved from Newcastle to California, with two squabbling cats and a famous teddy bear.

RAMSEY CAMPBELL (“HOW HE HELPED”) 
The Oxford Companion to English Literature describes Ramsey Campbell as “Britain’s most respected living horror writer.” He has been given more awards than any other writer in the field, including the Grand Master Award of the World Horror Convention, the Lifetime Achievement Award of the Horror Writers Association, the Living Legend Award of the International Horror Guild and the World Fantasy Lifetime Achievement Award. In 2015 he was made an Honorary Fellow of Liverpool John Moores University for outstanding services to literature.

SCOTT EDELMAN (“PITY THIS BUSY MONSTER NOT”)
has published more than 85 short stories in magazines and anthologies such as Analog, The Twilight Zone, and many others. His collection of zombie fiction, What Will Come After, was a finalist for both the Bram Stoker Award and the Shirley Jackson Memorial Award. His science fiction short stories have been collected in What We Still Talk About. He has been a Bram Stoker Award finalist seven times. A collection of zombie novelettes, Liars, Fakers, and the Dead Who Eat Them, was published earlier this year by Written Backwards.

BRIAN EVENSON (“NAMELESS CITIZEN”)
is the author of more than a dozen books of fiction, several of which have been finalists for the Edgar Award, the International Horror Guild Award, and the Shirley Jackson Award. He lives in Valencia, CA and teaches at CalArts.

ERINN L. KEMPER (“A LAUGHING MATTER”)
lives on the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica where she hangs in her writing hammock, runs with her dog on the beach, and drinks ridiculous amounts of coffee, at least until happy hour. Erinn has sold stories to Cemetery Dance Magazine, Dark Discoveries, and Black Static, and appears in various anthologies including You Human, and Behold! Oddities, Curiosities and Undefinable Wonders. Visit www.erinnkemper.com for updates and sloth sightings.

JOHN LANGAN (“MY FATHER, DR. FRANKENSTEIN”) 
is the author of two novels, The Fisherman, and House of Windows, and two collections, Mr. Gaunt and Other Uneasy Encounters, and The Wide, Carnivorous Sky and Other Monstrous Geographies. With Paul Tremblay, he has co-edited Creatures: Thirty Years of Monsters. He is one of the founders of the Shirley Jackson Awards. Currently, he reviews horror and dark fantasy for Locus magazine. He lives in New York’s Hudson Valley with his wife and younger son.

ROBERTA LANNES (“PAINTING THE BURNING FENCE”) 
was discovered in 1985 at UCLA by teacher/author Dennis Etchison, who published her first horror story, “Goodbye, Dark Love” in his award-winning anthology Cutting Edge. Since then, her varied genre short stories have been published in numerous anthologies, in fourteen languages. Her website, www.robertalannes.com, provides a chronological bibliography, in-depth biographical data, and contact information.

TIM LEBBON (“STRINGS”)
has written more than forty novels, including The Silence, and Relics, and hundreds of short stories and novellas, several of which have won major awards. He is also a screenwriter. His short story “Pay the Ghost” was adapted into a movie starring Nicolas Cage, and The Silence is shooting this year. Find out more at www.timlebbon.net.

RENA MASON (“I WILL BE THE MAKING OF YOU”) 
is the Bram Stoker Award winning author of The Evolutionist, and East End Girls, as well as a 2014 Stage 32 / The Blood List Presents: The Search for New Blood Screenwriting Contest Finalist. A longtime fan of horror, sci-fi, science, history, historical fiction, mysteries, and thrillers, she writes to mash up those genres in stories revolving around everyday life. For more information about this author, check out her website: www.renamason.ink.

PAUL MELOY (“THE SERILE”)
was born in 1966. He is the author of the short story collections Islington Crocodiles and Electric Breakfast, and the novels The Night Clock and Adornments of the Storm (forthcoming from Solaris 2018). His stories have been published in various magazines and anthologies, including The Third Alternative, Black Static, Interzone, Nemonymous, House of Fear, The End of the Road, and Cinema Futura. As a hobby, he is a full-time community mental health nurse.

MARK MORRIS (“UNDERSOUND”) 
has written and edited almost forty novels, novellas, short story collections, and anthologies. His script work includes audio dramas for Doctor Who, Jago & Litefoot, and the Hammer Chillers series. His recently published and upcoming work includes the official movie tie-in novelization of The Great Wall, the Obsidian Heart trilogy (The Wolves of London, The Society of Blood, and The Wraiths of War), the anthology New Fears (as editor), and a new audio adaptation of the classic 1971 horror movie Blood on Satan’s Claw.

LISA MORTON (“EYES OF THE BEHOLDERS”) 
is a six-time winner of the Bram Stoker Award, a screenwriter, a novelist, and a Halloween expert whose work was described by the American Library Association’s Readers’ Advisory Guide to Horror as “consistently dark, unsettling, and frightening.” Her forthcoming releases include Haunted Nights, co-edited with Ellen Datlow. She lives in the San Fernando Valley, and can be found online at www.lisamorton.com.

GENE O’NEILL (“SPIRITS”) 
has seen over 175 of his stories and novellas published, some of which have been collected in Ghost Spirits, Computers and World Machines, The Grand Struggle, In Dark Corners, Dance of the Blue Lady, The Hitchhiking Effect, and Lethal Birds. He has seen six novels published. Gene has been a Stoker finalist twelve times. In 2010, Taste of Tenderloin won for Collection; and in 2012, The Blue Heron won for Long Fiction. Most recent publications include four trade paperbacks in The Cal Wild Chronicles from Written Backwards.

MARK SAMUELS (“AN END TO PERPETUAL MOTION”)
is a British author working in the continuum of weird, strange, and mystical fiction. First published in 1988, his short stories often focus on protagonists who discover deeper vistas of reality lurking behind modernity. His tales have appeared in numerous prestigious anthologies on both sides of the Atlantic.

B.E. SCULLY (“THE MYTHIC HERO MOST LIKELY TO SQEEZE A STONE”)
lives in a crooked Red House that lacks a foundation in the misty woods of Oregon with a variety of human and animal companions. Scully is the author of numerous novels, short stories, poems, and articles. Published work, interviews, and odd scribblings can be found at www.bescully.com.

DARREN SPEEGLE (CO-EDITOR)
is the author of six books, including his recently released debut novel The Third Twin. His second novel, Artifacts, is due in 2018. He is the author of five short story collections, including the 2016 release A Haunting in Germany and Other Stories. He is co-editor with Michael Bailey on the themed anthologies Adam’s Ladder and Prisms (in progress). His short fiction is forthcoming in Best New Horror 28, and Tales from the Lake Vol. 4. His work has previously appeared in such venues as Clarkesworld, Subterranean, Cemetery Dance Magazine, Postscripts, ChiZine, The Third Alternative, and Subterranean: Tales of Dark Fantasy. Between gigs as a federal contractor in the Middle East, Darren resides in Thailand. When not writing, he enjoys outdoor activities like hiking and biking.

JEFFREY THOMAS (“SLICED BREAD”) 
is the author of such novels as Deadstock, and Blue War (Solaris Books), and various short story collections that include The Endless Fall and Other Weird Fictions (Lovecraft eZine Press), and Haunted Worlds (Hippocampus Press). Many of his characters face their challenges in his dark future setting of Punktown, but Thomas himself lives in ye olde Massachusetts.

DAMIEN ANGELICA WALTERS (“FILIGREE, MINOTAUR, CYANIDE, BLOOM”) 
is the author of Sing Me Your Scars, Paper Tigers, and the forthcoming Cry Your Way Home. Her short fiction has been nominated twice for a Bram Stoker Award, reprinted in The Year’s Best Dark Fantasy & Horror and The Year’s Best Weird Fiction, and published in various anthologies and magazines, including the Shirley Jackson Award finalists Autumn Cthulhu and The Madness of Dr. Caligari, Nightmare magazine, and Black Static. Find her online @DamienAWalters or www.damienangelicawalters.com.

What is to Become of Humankind?
The future of humankind as an ever-changing organism is a subject of much debate. Where is our evolutionary path leading? Will the next rung take the form of mental transcendence, will it set humankind on a course toward divinity, or will this uncertain path involve a dark and terrible reversion?  Co-editors Michael Bailey and Darren Speegle present eighteen tales of dark science fiction that explore the course of evolution, written by some of the best literary minds in the fields of science fiction and horror:

Laird Barron - "Swift to Chase"
Chaz Brenchley - "Ch-ch-changes"
Ramsey Campbell - "How He Helped"
Scott Edelman - "Pity this Busy Monster Not"
Brian Evenson - "Nameless Citizen"
Erinn L. Kemper - "A Laughing Matter"
John Langan - "My Father, Dr. Frankenstein"
Roberta Lannes - "Painting the Burning Fence"
Tim Lebbon - "Strings"
Rena Mason - "I Will Be the Making of You"
Paul Meloy - "The Serile"
Mark Morris - "Undersound"
Lisa Morton - "Eyes of the Beholders"
Gene O'Neill - "Spirits"
Mark Samuels - "An End to Perpetual Motion"
B.E. Scully - "The Mythic Hero Most Likely to Squeeze a Stone"
Jeffrey Thomas - "Sliced Bread"
Damien Angelica Walters - "Filigree, Minotaur, Cyanide, Bloom"

ADAM'S LADDER will be published in eBook, trade paperback, and in a 100-numbered / limited edition (signed by its editors, Michael Bailey and Darren Speegle).

What is to Become of Written Backwards?
Over the last ten years, Written Backwards has published multiple award-winning anthologies, fiction collections, and standalone novels and novellas, ranging from dark science fiction to horror. Previous anthologies include the Bram Stoker Award-winning THE LIBRARY OF THE DEAD, the Benjamin Franklin Award winning (and Stoker nominated) QUALIA NOUS, and three volumes of CHIRAL MAD (the latest also up for a Stoker). Books published by Written Backwards have seen eight individual works nominated for the prestigious Bram Stoker Award, with three of those stories taking home the statue. Other stories/poems have been nominated for the Nebula, the Rhysling, and others. Foreword Reviews Book of the Year, the Indie Book Awards, the Independent Publisher Book Awards, the Eric Hoffer Book Award, the International Book Award ... Written Backwards titles have seen over two dozen literary accolades over the years through its handful of titles! But we need your help bringing the next project to life: ADAM'S LADDER.With your help, Written Backwards can continue in its legacy to:

Seek out diverse voices, both new and well-established.
Pay writers, poets, and artists professional rates.
Provide fair publishing contracts.
Design and publish some of the most beautiful books imaginable. 

What is to Become of this Campaign?
You're probably wondering where your money will go for this particular campaign. Here's the breakdown:

63.64% - goes directly to the writers, which includes professional payment at a per-word rate, plus the cost of contributor copies for the various editions of the book.
31.22% - goes directly to publication costs for the eBook, trade paperback, and hardback editions of the book.
5.14% - covers shipping.
And that's it. Zero profit will be made from this campaign. Any additional funds raised will go directly to future Written Backwards projects, some of which are already lined up as expansions/unlocks within this campaign.

This is an all-or-nothing campaign, so if it doesn't reach it's goal, the project gets canned. Anthologies (let's face it), are expensive to make (but we all want them), mostly because there are so many incredible contributors involved. We need to raise $6,500 to make this book happen, so we've come up with some enticing perks.
And that's how you can help ...
Check out the perks to the right to see how you can help bring ADAM'S LADDER to life, and if we get there, together, Written Backwards has some tricks to bring you even more great (and  FREE) books in the form of campaign unlocks and future anthologies.


PELLUCID LUNACY was the first anthology published by Written Backwards, and after ten years, the book is getting a face-lift. When the campaign reaches $7,000, all backers (contributing $95 or higher) will receive a complimentary copy of the trade paperback!

The title and author of the third illustrated book in the Allevon series by Written Backwards will be revealed when the campaign reaches $7,000. When the campaign reaches $8,000, all campaign backers (contributing $95 or higher) will receive a complimentary copy of the trade paperback.

The title and tentative cover of the next dark science fiction anthology by Written Backwards will be revealed when the campaign reaches $12,000, and all backers (contributing $95 or higher) will receive a complimentary digital copy in either PDF or EPUB.[ to-be-announced ] will include fiction by:Michael Marshall SmithIan WatsonRoberta LannesScott EdelmanB.E. ScullyLynda RuckerBrian EvensonErinn L. KemperChaz BrenchleyTlotlo TsamaaseGene O'Neill​Richard ThomasPaul Meloy... and others TBA
Stay tuned for more updates ...
 
What About the Contributors?
MICHAEL BAILEY (CO-EDITOR, COVER & INTERIOR DESIGN) is a multi-award-winning writer, editor, and book designer, and the recipient of over two dozen literary accolades, including the Bram Stoker Award, Benjamin Franklin Award, Eric Hoffer Book Award, and Independent Publisher Book Award. His nonlinear novels include Palindrome Hannah, Phoenix Rose, and Psychotropic Dragon, and he has published two short story and poetry collections, Scales and Petals and Inkblots and Blood Spots, as well as Enso, a children’s book. He has created anthologies such as Qualia Nous, The Library of the Dead, four volumes of Chiral Mad, You Human, and a series of illustrated books.
LAIRD BARRON ("SWIFT TO CHASE") spent his early years in Alaska, where he raced the Iditarod three times during the early 1990s and worked in the fishing and construction industries. He is the author of several books, including The Beautiful Thing That Awaits Us All, Swift to Chase, and the forthcoming novel Blood Standard. His work has also appeared in many magazines and anthologies. Barron currently resides in the Rondout Valley writing stories about the evil that men do.
CHAZ BRENCHLEY (“CH-CH-CHANGES”) has been making a living as a writer since the age of eighteen. He is the author of nine thrillers, four fantasy series (under three different names), two ghost stories and two collections. He lost count of his short stories long ago. His work has won the British Fantasy Award and a Lambda Award. He has recently married and moved from Newcastle to California, with two squabbling cats and a famous teddy bear.
RAMSEY CAMPBELL (“HOW HE HELPED”) The Oxford Companion to English Literature describes Ramsey Campbell as “Britain’s most respected living horror writer.” He has been given more awards than any other writer in the field, including the Grand Master Award of the World Horror Convention, the Lifetime Achievement Award of the Horror Writers Association, the Living Legend Award of the International Horror Guild and the World Fantasy Lifetime Achievement Award. In 2015 he was made an Honorary Fellow of Liverpool John Moores University for outstanding services to literature.
SCOTT EDELMAN (“PITY THIS BUSY MONSTER NOT”)has published more than 85 short stories in magazines and anthologies such as Analog, The Twilight Zone, and many others. His collection of zombie fiction, What Will Come After, was a finalist for both the Bram Stoker Award and the Shirley Jackson Memorial Award. His science fiction short stories have been collected in What We Still Talk About. He has been a Bram Stoker Award finalist seven times. A collection of zombie novelettes, Liars, Fakers, and the Dead Who Eat Them, was published earlier this year by Written Backwards.
BRIAN EVENSON (“NAMELESS CITIZEN”)is the author of more than a dozen books of fiction, several of which have been finalists for the Edgar Award, the International Horror Guild Award, and the Shirley Jackson Award. He lives in Valencia, CA and teaches at CalArts.
ERINN L. KEMPER (“A LAUGHING MATTER”)lives on the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica where she hangs in her writing hammock, runs with her dog on the beach, and drinks ridiculous amounts of coffee, at least until happy hour. Erinn has sold stories to Cemetery Dance Magazine, Dark Discoveries, and Black Static, and appears in various anthologies including You Human, and Behold! Oddities, Curiosities and Undefinable Wonders. Visit www.erinnkemper.com for updates and sloth sightings.
JOHN LANGAN (“MY FATHER, DR. FRANKENSTEIN”) is the author of two novels, The Fisherman, and House of Windows, and two collections, Mr. Gaunt and Other Uneasy Encounters, and The Wide, Carnivorous Sky and Other Monstrous Geographies. With Paul Tremblay, he has co-edited Creatures: Thirty Years of Monsters. He is one of the founders of the Shirley Jackson Awards. Currently, he reviews horror and dark fantasy for Locus magazine. He lives in New York’s Hudson Valley with his wife and younger son.
ROBERTA LANNES (“PAINTING THE BURNING FENCE”) was discovered in 1985 at UCLA by teacher/author Dennis Etchison, who published her first horror story, “Goodbye, Dark Love” in his award-winning anthology Cutting Edge. Since then, her varied genre short stories have been published in numerous anthologies, in fourteen languages. Her website, www.robertalannes.com, provides a chronological bibliography, in-depth biographical data, and contact information.
TIM LEBBON (“STRINGS”)has written more than forty novels, including The Silence, and Relics, and hundreds of short stories and novellas, several of which have won major awards. He is also a screenwriter. His short story “Pay the Ghost” was adapted into a movie starring Nicolas Cage, and The Silence is shooting this year. Find out more at www.timlebbon.net.
RENA MASON (“I WILL BE THE MAKING OF YOU”) is the Bram Stoker Award winning author of The Evolutionist, and East End Girls, as well as a 2014 Stage 32 / The Blood List Presents: The Search for New Blood Screenwriting Contest Finalist. A longtime fan of horror, sci-fi, science, history, historical fiction, mysteries, and thrillers, she writes to mash up those genres in stories revolving around everyday life. For more information about this author, check out her website: www.renamason.ink.
PAUL MELOY (“THE SERILE”)was born in 1966. His stories have been published in various magazines and anthologies, including The Third Alternative, Black Static, Interzone, Nemonymous, House of Fear, The End of the Road, and Cinema Futura. La Novela

El hombre tiende a destruirse a sí mismo y a todo lo que lo rodea. En un remoto pueblo, donde el tráfico de mujeres y drogas han dividido el territorio en dos barrios opuestos y convertido la vida de sus habitantes en un infierno, una familia de clase alta aparece asesinada dejando como único superviviente a Samu: un chico de capacidades especiales. El misterio de esta tragedia llevará al mundo a conocer los secretos y especulaciones que perviven en el territorio. Todos los habitantes del pueblo se mueven por el odio y rencor provocando el hundimiento de sus propias vidas. ¿Qué puede esconder la familia más envidiada y bien vista de todas?

La Autora

Adriana Quesada Ogando nació en O Carballiño (Ourense) en el año 2001. Cursó sus primeros estudios en los colegios María Asumpta y CEIP A. Rodríguez Cadarso, cursó secundaria y bachillerato en el IES Campo de San Alberto de Noia (A Coruña).

Fue ganadora del II Premio Nacional Jóvenes Susurros 2018 convocado por Radio Universo Literario.

Una Muestra

«Sangre por las paredes. Sangre en el suelo. Sangre en las cortinas, en el sofá, sobre los cojines… Solo se podía apreciar el terrible olor de la sangre que, a su vez, le daba elegancia a todo con su color, pero que aún así conseguía marear a Sam.
          —Uno, dos, tres, cuatro… —contaba el chico a susurros.
          Un golpe fuerte en el piso de abajo hizo que se sobresaltara pero no se movió, alguien había entrado en su casa y estaba provocado un ruido espeluznante con sus pisadas.
          —Cinco, seis, siete… —continuó el adolescente intentando no gritar.
          Pasos en la escalera, estaban subiendo al piso de arriba donde Sam estaba escondido. Iban a encontrarlo.
          —Despejado —dijo un hombre desde el piso de abajo—, aquí no hay nada más que sangre.
          Hugo Sánchez caminaba cuidadosamente ya en la segunda planta de la casa, había olido la sangre desde la entrada. Era obvio que algo había sucedido ahí.
          El agente observó las habitaciones una por una viendo los cuerpos inertes de la familia que había estado ocupando esa casa, seguramente, toda su vida. Estaba totalmente horrorizado.
          —Chicos, vamos a tener mucho trabajo.
          Hugo observó que había una habitación de matrimonio donde ambos cadáveres reposaban cómodamente sobre su cama, la siguiente habitación era de una niña bastante pequeña que yacía sentada en un baúl, la otra pertenecía a un hombre ya de avanzada edad el cual estaba tirado en el suelo. Pero no fue eso lo que le llamó la atención, había una habitación más la cual estaba totalmente limpia y vacía, en ese cuarto debía de dormir un joven adolescente a juzgar por los retratos de las paredes».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Adriana Quesada Ogando os lo agradeceremos.
