story:
2/15/16 – I'm doubling my stretch goal, to take the current $1565 raised and turn it into a flat $3000. Why? Because that would cut at least TWO MONTHS off my savings time in Kansas, toward infusion treatment. If that happens, I can be sitting in an infusion lab chair in just SIX MONTHS time! And it literally makes me shake with desperation to think that by next Christmas, I could be DONE with infusion, and my Lyme Disease could be in full remission!! I never thought I'd raise $1565, but now that I have, I'm pushing for a full MIRACLE. I once thought infusion treatment would be impossible. Then I figured it would be close to a decade before I'd ever be able to hope to save up enough to pay for it. To think now, that I'm only $1500 away from having this treatment in just half a year??!! I'm shaking my head...but maybe...just maybe...There really is a chance now. <3

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


2/14/16 – New Stretch Goal: $2500.

There are plenty of perks to choose from at this point, so...I never thought I'd make it this far. My original plan was to get the money for the house and simply SELL all of my belongings, or give everything to Good Will, or leave boxes of free stuff on the side of the road, or a combination of all three. Because I never thought to even hope to raise enough money to get into the house AND keep my belongings or move any of them with me. I was going to hone it down to a few boxes and other things I absolutely can't get rid of (like photo albums of my kids when they were born and really young, some old baby outfits I saved, and other nostalgic things, etc.) that still can't fit into the car with me and the cats, and those few must-keep items would go into a smallest-of-the-small and cheapest-of-the-cheap storage closet here in Salem.

Well, here we are, I've met my initial goal and my first stretch goal...and now we're to the point where I might not have to get rid of ALL my things, maybe rent a slightly larger (double closet?) storage unit, to save more of my things to retrieve later on. Another $1000 and I can keep half my things in a larger storage unit long enough to come back in a uhaul (or save for a uhaul or van line company to bring my things later on), and not get rid of EVERYTHING I own...I just never thought my campaign would even go this far. So, it has, and now I'm throwing in the new extra $1000 stretch goal of not having to sell everything I own in order to complete this move to Kansas. So, PLEASE, consider ordering one of my perks. Maybe this move won't need to be as complicated as I once thought it would be. Maybe we can get my move to only medium-complicated, lol. We'll see.

As usual, however, I appreciate everything you all have done for me so far. More than you all will ever know. <3 Happy Valentine's Day, everyone. I definitely feel a bit more loved this week than last. :)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

2/12/16 – New Stretch Goal PERK Added!

A new perk. For $40 you can now order a SIGNED copy of Lyrical Tales: Collected Poems and Photography, by Jennifer Word. The poetry and art book just released today (2/12/16), and you can have it signed and delivered to your doorstep. (only ships to United States and Canada).


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


2/11/16

STRETCH GOAL!!!!! After only TWO DAYS, it's already time for me to add a stretch goal of $1,500 to reach in the next twelve days!! (and I've already messaged my Atchison, KS Realtor to move forward on the BID for the house I've been looking at!!). The stretch goal could go towards helping me fund the extra costs of the actual move, on top of the 1% down and closing fees for the house. I mean, I will need to stop at motels along the way on my drive with my cats from Salem, OR to Atchison, KS. The drive will take at least 3-4 days, plus motels, gas, and food costs. So, adding a stretch goal of another $500 is probably a smart thing to do, to make this miracle happenstance go as smoothly and stress-free (yeah, right) as possible. But whether we make the stretch goal or not, I'm making a bid on the house. If this happens, it will literally change my whole life for the better. <3

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

2/09/16

This is not easy for me. I don't like "begging" for money. And I'm not looking for a handout. Just to get all of that out of the way up front.

As many of you know, I have been battling Lyme Disease for over five years now. I didn't even get diagnosed properly (didn't even know it was Lyme Disease that I had) until October 20, 2014, a little less than a year-and-a-half ago. I have been on oral antibiotics EVER SINCE. And it has helped to improve a few of my symptoms a tiny bit, but not all that much. I'm still severely disabled, 150 pounds overweight (I was a size 6 before the infamous "tick bite"), now I am a size 3X (utterly humiliating), and I still suffer from severe edema if I remain in an upright position for more than about 2-3 hours in any given 24 hour period of time. In other words, to avoid a potential STROKE, I must remain horizontal, lying down either in my bed or on my couch for most of each day. This has been the only thing to even remotely reduce my high blood pressure.

As some of you perhaps don't know, this is also the very reason I have been given roughly TEN more years to live. Given my physical state, without any stronger treatment for my disease, and barring divine intervention, if I remain on oral antibiotics alone, this disease will progress, and not even being bedridden will save me from the inevitable stroke and/or heart attack that will undoubtedly kill me. Barring those two outcomes, the high level of pain killers I take nearly every day to make the full bodied rheumatoid arthritis that I also suffer from as a direct result of Lyme Disease bearable, will eventually take its toll on my internal organs (most notably my pancreas and liver) and this will in turn cause even more pain, more meds internally ingested and eventually multiple organ failure. If I don't have a stroke or heart attack first, I can look forward to developing pancreatitis (painful and incurable), liver cirrhosis, and/or kidney failure.

And all of this will happen if my disease remains on its current course. I have been on oral antibiotics every day now for fourteen months, and still spend most of my days in a lot of pain, and lying down. I do all my work for EMP Publishing on my couch, in my home. I'm doing the best I can in the situation I have found myself in. And one small grace, in trying to find something to do to fill my days (rather than just stare at the TV and vegetate) is that in founding my publishing company (originally simply to publish all of my OWN writing before I die), I've discovered that I'm actually pretty darn good at it. My books look beautiful (who knew I had a knack for interior layout design?), and I work very well with other authors (I never considered myself a "people person" before!). So, I now have a publishing company on a fast track to actually being successful, i.e. this could end up being my full time job and career (that I LOVE!), and I am able to work from home. What I can't do is actually go for a walk for basic exercise. The exact and varying symptoms of my chronic disease would take forever to explain.

In the past, as many of you again (perhaps) know, I have run fundraisers to try and raise tens of thousands of dollars for help in treating my Lyme Disease, and also in the past to raise money to fund my own personal publishing projects (my life's work before I die). This was simply too much. It is too much. I cannot ask for or expect my community of friends, family and peers to donate $10K for the basic round of infusion treatment (it's the exact same as Chemo, only with high potency liquid antibiotics, straight into a port installed in my heart) I need to have done, in order to kick my Chronic Lyme Disease into remission (at the advanced stage of my disease, remission is the outcome, not a "cure"). I may need to have a round of infusion treatment again 3-5 years down the road, but it's a much more effective treatment than the ineffective antibiotic pills I swallow down 3 times a day that only slow my body's degeneration. There's no hope of recovering any real quality of life without the more aggressive infusion treatment.

But it's too much to ask for that. A round of antibiotic infusion treatment (2-3 times a week for 8-12 weeks), at an outpatient infusion lab (they are found in every single state in our country) would run a cool $10K. I am not asking for that. But I have been praying to God (these are simply my own personal religious beliefs) and I believe He has shown me a way to rebuild my life.

Where there is a will, there is a way. As they say, right? I work from home. And I have an independent income of alimony (and child support) from my unfortunate divorce. Without that monthly support, I would be living with family members and burdening them, so I am very grateful (not for the divorce, obviously, but) for the fact that I do have a monthly "income", especially in light of my inability to work a job outside the home in my current physical condition.

But I have EMP Publishing. And it's going very well. I hope to build my company up to at the very least be a supplemental income for me for when I do return to work (with the Grace of God) and am finally able, once again, to go outside my home and earn money at a job. But my current situation lends itself perfectly to being nomadic, if you will. I can go anywhere in the country and still run EMP Publishing. I can go anywhere in the country and still retain the 25% custody of my two teenagers that I now have. I moved to Oregon, not by choice, but out of financial necessity. I'm not getting any better, physically, and remaining in Southern California was simply not working.

But as I've said, I believe God has shown me a way. On a lark, I applied for a home loan. (Lark meaning, I randomly clicked on the "get pre-approved" button on Zillow one afternoon while daydreaming). With my current credit score lower due to the large amount of medical debt I've taken on over the last several years, and my savings GONE, I never thought a house could possibly be in my future. My life changed roughly 8 weeks ago (early December) when I was pre-approved for a home loan with Quicken, under their new Rocket program (did anyone see that awesome commercial during the Superbowl?!, I started screaming, "That's MY loan!!"). But I wasn't approved for a whole lot, considering my finances. $75K. That's what I was granted. On pre-approval. Of course, I looked in Oregon first. And there's nothing. Nothing that cheap. And in livable condition. The Rocket loan program states the house must be 100% "turnkey" condition, i.e., ready to move into and live freely. No "as-is", no "fixer upper", not "This house just needs a little TLC". Turnkey. And under $75K.

That's harder to find that you might think. I began scouring the entire COUNTRY eight weeks ago, desperately trying to find a house under $75K that is turnkey. Because, given the right situation, all other expenses considered equal (the utilities for the area, the cost of winter heating or summer cooling, etc.) a mortgage on a house at $75K or under, versus what I'm currently paying for my rent here in Salem, OR (which is already 50% cheaper than where I just moved from outside of L.A.) would mean an extra $500/month of leftover income for me to use.

And THAT will get me the $10K I need to raise to pay for my OWN infusion treatment to kick my Lyme Disease into remission. The keys to the kingdom for me, lie in raising the money for the house I have found, after scouring the entire country. I settled on KANSAS. The Midwest, as it turns out, is the most affordable place in the United States. Right smack-dab in the middle of the country. I found the perfect little town (only 30 minutes outside of Kansas City, KS, the LARGEST city in the state), Lyme Specialists to choose from in all directions and within less than 45 minutes drive (and more importantly INFUSION labs), and I can even hit bordering states of Nebraska, Oklahoma and Missouri if needs be (but everything I'd need medically is right there in KC). A cute little town called Atchison (those of you who REALLY know me will know I love this: Atchison is billed as the "most haunted town in Kansas"!!). Population just under 11,000. And the perfect little, one story, 1388 square foot home with a very nice (and DRY) basement, for $45K. And a Rocket Loan from Quicken requiring only 1% down. So, I need to raise roughly $450 for the initial 1% down payment. Then I need (estimated, I mean, I've never bought a home before, and I'm flippin' 40-years-old here) another roughly $450 or so for all the random "closing costs" upon purchasing the home and actually paying taxes and transfer title fees, etc. And I need an additional $325 (my Realtor has told me THIS exact amount for certain) for the home's appraisal/inspection. I want to make certain before putting in a final bid that I'm not buying something that "looks" great, but has hidden mold in the walls, or termite damage, or sits on land emitting ridiculously  high levels of Radon, for whatever reason, or that the walls aren't covered in LEAD paint, etc.), so YES I'm having an inspection done. So:

$450

$450

$325

Comes to a grand total of $1,225. However, I have a very wonderful and incredible friend who has already offered to give me $500 to help me make this happen, so minus that $500, I need roughly $725. I have rounded back up to $1000 to help me cover the cost of hiring movers to move all my things from my current apartment here in Salem, OR, into a storage unit. I'd be driving myself and a few belongings (plus my two cats) halfway across the country to move into this little house in Atchison, KS, and leaving my things behind (most of which I plan to sell or donate to Goodwill anyhow, so my storage unit will be smaller and hopefully minimal cost). Even factoring a storage unit of roughly $100/mo into the equation, if I can get this house in Atchison and begin paying the mortgage on a $45K home, I will be looking at a monthly savings of over $500/month. (ALL other things considered, I've already researched the cost of all utilities, groceries, gas, etc. and it's actually another 10% cheaper than here in Salem), which I then plan to use to pay off my medical debt (another huge stress that doesn't help my physical or emotional health) while simultaneously saving up the $10K I need to pay for my OWN infusion treatment.

So, no more fundraisers or "begging" for money ever again. And certainly not even this time around, for tens of thousands of dollars. I need to raise roughly $1000. That's it. After that, I truly believe I can create a life for myself where I take over, save the money myself, and pay for my own medical treatment, no more having to ask anyone for money for anything EVER again.

So, this one last time, I'm telling myself. And not for a whole lot. Not for some crazy amount of money that I cannot expect anyone to be able to donate for me. And this way, I am enabled to help myself. With just one small step of raising the lesser amount of $1000, I can then take control of my finances, my life, my Lyme Disease treatment and management, etc.

What would YOU be able to do with an extra $500 every month just suddenly handed to you? If I can raise the money needed to buy this house and move to Atchison, KS, it opens the door, it creates the way, the path, towards rebuilding my life. No more begging after this.

So, I am not trying to look for a handout here. To risk sounding cheesy, I'm looking for one last "hand UP". And then I can take it from there. And this WILL change my entire life. This will make a life and a future for myself possible. This will give me hope. This would erase that 'TEN YEAR' death sentence of not expecting to live beyond age 50, because I'd have the hope (and it WILL happen) of getting infusion treatment within a year to a year-and-a-half after moving into a financial situation where I suddenly have an extra $500 per month to put towards my medical goals of treatment. I want to save that $10K myself. And I CAN do it, if I can just come up with $1000. And I don't want to lose this perfect house (turnkey, in a haunted town, only $45K), I want to be the one to bid on it, before someone else takes it off the market. I want to be able to bid on that house before the end of February.

So, this is a fundraiser. And it's "Operation: Save Jen". I'm not trying to be overly dramatic here, but this could literally change my entire life for the better...and eventually and actually prolong my life back to a more normal lifespan expectancy.

Also, once I'm in the home, the loan and mortgage set in place, I have further been pre-approved for a business loan from Wells Fargo (my bank) for $5-$10K to help me run EMP Publishing for the next few years without it costing ME anymore out of my personal and monthly budget. So, despite the new monthly installment to pay off said business loan, that would actually INCREASE my monthly budget again by another $200 per month or more.

I'm looking at a DREAM life, with health, longevity, a HOUSE (another dream of mine, which is why I was even on stupid Zillow to begin with, drooling, lol), the perfect town for me (come on, if you KNOW me, then moving to the "most haunted town" in any state is SO Jen, lol), I was born two days before Halloween, and I LOVE spooky things. I mean, come on, EMP's main "thing" is an extreme horror quarterly publication! (this house I want isn't haunted, though, it was built in 1977, lol). It's not haunted...I checked. ;)

So...it's a fundraiser. I'm asking for money. From whoever wants to donate, and for however much you can spare or afford. And as soon as possible, so I can BID on that house and get it, and set in motion my move there (to Kansas, of all places, lol), and begin saving myself for everything else I need. I'm not offering perks, really. Although, I supposed I could put a few up where I simply offer to send paperback copies of books that EMP Publishing puts out over the next year, if that makes some people feel more "okay" with this, rather than just simply "donating".

Otherwise, aside from those few perks, this is a straight up fundraiser asking for donations. It's the only thing I know to do at this point. I've tried raising the funds with taking on extraneous editing projects on the side, but it hasn't been nearly enough. I tried to WORK to raise the money, as best as I could. I did try. And I asked close friends, but no one has the means (it's hard for everyone right now), except for one friend of mine, and as I've said, they are funding me with $500. But I still need that tiny bit more. And then I'll be in a situation where I can FINALLY help myself.

If you've made it this far, I apologize for writing a book, but I'm not very good at explaining this whole situation in under 1000 words...it's a complicated situation, and if you don't already know any of this, well...this long story explains everything.

Any amount will help. And I've still got a few more things to try and sell on Craigslist. I'm trying to make this happen as much on my own as I can. My own family doesn't have the means to help, but maybe if enough of my friends and peers on FB and Twitter, etc., come together, we can all make this happen for me. Whoever cares to, anyhow, and has the means.

We've all read these types of statements, "If you gave just $1"....or "If everyone gave just $3 right now..." yada-yada. Well, it's true...if every single one of my friends on FB literally gave $1, I'd have more than triple what I need to build my life. So, I only need one third or less of you guys to give $1 (not too much of a hardship, right?), or even just 5% of you to give $5, and I could build up my life and make all this happen.

Or you can order your book perks package from EMP Publishing, lol.

Now, I'm not putting up a video. I know they help. But I'm still too ashamed of how ugly and gross I look, going from 138 pounds to 275. I'm not putting myself on video again. That was too hard, and too humiliating. And I'd rather have people think of me and remember how I used to look. Because maybe, if I can get that treatment and get better, I can hope (as vain as it is to do so) to look a bit more attractive again someday. More like the old me now trapped inside my new, sick body. :( So, no video, folks, sorry.

And that's that. Give if you can or want. Judge me harshly, call me a beggar. Be disappointed in me. Tell me I'm a loser. Or just support me this one last time and give from the goodness of your heart. I've gotten every reaction across the board already. I've grown a thick skin. I can take it.

Thank you all (those of you who bothered to take the time to read this whole ridiculous thing). I appreciate that. And I appreciate you. I personally believe God is overseeing this whole thing. Why He's doing it this way, I don't understand. But I'm going to trust it. Whatever your own personal religious beliefs are...whether you believe in God or not, or a different God than mine (I never said who my "He" was...) if you feel anything (a small whisper in your ear or your mind) urging you to help. Don't ignore it. I think magic is happening here. And I want to get better, tell this stupid Lyme Disease to get the f*ck out of my body and my life, reclaim my future and my dreams, continue running and building up my career and my publishing company, and take my LIFE back, and I want to do it in a haunted town in Kansas, darnit!!!

Thank you.

Sincerely,

Jen Word

 or donate to Goodwill anyhow, so my storage unit will be smaller and 
hopefully minimal cost). Even factoring a storage unit of roughly 
$100/mo into the equation, if I can get this house in Atchison and begin
 paying the mortgage on a $45K home, I will be looking at a monthly 
savings of over $500/month. (ALL other things considered, I've already 
researched the cost of all utilities, groceries, gas, etc. and it's 
actually another 10% cheaper than here in Salem), which I then plan to 
use to pay off my medical debt (another huge stress that doesn't help my
 physical or emotional health) while simultaneously saving up the $10K I
 need to pay for my OWN infusion treatment.So, no more 
fundraisers or "begging" for money ever again. And certainly not even 
this time around, for tens of thousands of dollars. I need to raise 
roughly $1000. That's it. After that, I truly believe I can create a 
life for myself where I take over, save the money myself, and pay for my
 own medical treatment, no more having to ask anyone for money for 
anything EVER again.So, this one last time, I'm telling 
myself. And not for a whole lot. Not for some crazy amount of money that
 I cannot expect anyone to be able to donate for me. And this way, I am 
enabled to help myself. With just one small step of raising the lesser 
amount of $1000, I can then take control of my finances, my life, my 
Lyme Disease treatment and management, etc.What would YOU
 be able to do with an extra $500 every month just suddenly handed to 
you? If I can raise the money needed to buy this house and move to 
Atchison, KS, it opens the door, it creates the way, the path, towards 
rebuilding my life. No more begging after this.So, I am 
not trying to look for a handout here. To risk sounding cheesy, I'm 
looking for one last "hand UP". And then I can take it from there. And 
this WILL change my entire life. This will make a life and a future for 
myself possible. This will give me hope. This would erase that 'TEN 
YEAR' death sentence of not expecting to live beyond age 50, because I'd
 have the hope (and it WILL happen) of getting infusion treatment within
 a year to a year-and-a-half after moving into a financial situation 
where I suddenly have an extra $500 per month to put towards my medical 
goals of treatment. I want to save that $10K myself. And I CAN do it, if
 I can just come up with $1000. And I don't want to lose this perfect 
house (turnkey, in a haunted town, only $45K), I want to be the one to 
bid on it, before someone else takes it off the market. I want to be 
able to bid on that house before the end of February.So, 
this is a fundraiser. And it's "Operation: Save Jen". I'm not trying to 
be overly dramatic here, but this could literally change my entire life 
for the better...and eventually and actually prolong my life back to a 
more normal lifespan expectancy.Also, once I'm in the 
home, the loan and mortgage set in place, I have further been 
pre-approved for a business loan from Wells Fargo (my bank) for $5-$10K 
to help me run EMP Publishing for the next few years without it costing 
ME anymore out of my personal and monthly budget. So, despite the new 
monthly installment to pay off said business loan, that would actually 
INCREASE my monthly budget again by another $200 per month or more.I'm
 looking at a DREAM life, with health, longevity, a HOUSE (another dream
 of mine, which is why I was even on stupid Zillow to begin with, 
drooling, lol), the perfect town for me (come on, if you KNOW me, then 
moving to the "most haunted town" in any state is SO Jen, lol), I was 
born two days before Halloween, and I LOVE spooky things. I mean, come 
on, EMP's main "thing" is an extreme horror quarterly publication! (this
 house I want isn't haunted, though, it was built in 1977, lol). It's 
not haunted...I checked. ;)So...it's a fundraiser. I'm 
asking for money. From whoever wants to donate, and for however much you
 can spare or afford. And as soon as possible, so I can BID on that 
house and get it, and set in motion my move there (to Kansas, of all 
places, lol), and begin saving myself for everything else I need. I'm 
not offering perks, really. Although, I supposed I could put a few up 
where I simply offer to send paperback copies of books that EMP 
Publishing puts out over the next year, if that makes some people feel 
more "okay" with this, rather than just simply "donating".Otherwise,
 aside from those few perks, this is a straight up fundraiser asking for
 donations. It's the only thing I know to do at this point. I've tried 
raising the funds with taking on extraneous editing projects on the 
side, but it hasn't been nearly enough. I tried to WORK to raise the 
money, as best as I could. I did try. And I asked close friends, but no 
one has the means (it's hard for everyone right now), except for one 
friend of mine, and as I've said, they are funding me with $500. But I 
still need that tiny bit more. And then I'll be in a situation where I 
can FINALLY help myself.If you've made it this far, I 
apologize for writing a book, but I'm not very good at explaining this 
whole situation in under 1000 words...it's a complicated situation, and 
if you don't already know any of this, well...this long story explains 
everything.Any amount will help. And I've still got a few
 more things to try and sell on Craigslist. I'm trying to make this 
happen as much on my own as I can. My own family doesn't have the means 
to help, but maybe if enough of my friends and peers on FB and Twitter, 
etc., come together, we can all make this happen for me. Whoever cares 
to, anyhow, and has the means.We've all read these types 
of statements, "If you gave just $1"....or "If everyone gave just $3 
right now..." yada-yada. Well, it's true...if every single one of my 
friends on FB literally gave $1, I'd have more than triple what I need 
to build my life. So, I only need one third or less of you guys to give 
$1 (not too much of a hardship, right?), or even just 5% of you to give 
$5, and I could build up my life and make all this happen.Or you can order your book perks package from EMP Publishing, lol.Now,
 I'm not putting up a video. I know they help. But I'm still too ashamed
 of how ugly and gross I look, going from 138 pounds to 275. I'm not 
putting myself on video again. That was too hard, and too humiliating. 
And I'd rather have people think of me and remember how I used to look. 
Because maybe, if I can get that treatment and get better, I can hope 
(as vain as it is to do so) to look a bit more attractive again someday.
 More like the old me now trapped inside my new, sick body. :( So, no 
video, folks, sorry.And that's that. Give if you can or 
want. Judge me harshly, call me a beggar. Be disappointed in me. Tell me
 I'm a loser. Or just support me this one last time and give from the 
goodness of your heart. I've gotten every reaction across the board 
already. I've grown a thick skin. I can take it.Thank you
 all (those of you who bothered to take the time to read this whole 
ridiculous thing). I appreciate that. And I appreciate you. I personally
 believe God is overseeing this whole thing. Why He's doing it this way,
 I don't understand. But I'm going to trust it. Whatever your own 
personal religious beliefs are...whether you believe in God or not, or a
 different God than mine (I never said who my "He" was...) if you feel 
anything (a small whisper in your ear or your mind) urging you to help. 
Don't ignore it. I think magic is happening here. And I want to get 
better, tell this stupid Lyme Disease to get the f*ck out of my body and
 my life, reclaim my future and my dreams, continue running and building
 up my career and my publishing company, and take my LIFE back, and I 
want to do it in a haunted town in Kansas, darnit!!!Thank you.Sincerely,Jen Word

story:
A guidebook to Argentina's glorious culture, looking beyond the stereotypes to discover the real Argentina.

After much deliberation we are back to announce the fourth publication in our Latin American culture series. For our latest project we have set our sights on Argentina; its music, film, literature, art, theatre, architecture, comic books, underground movements and everything else that fills its cultural calendar.

Sounds and Colours Argentina will be a 200-page book filled with articles, illustrations and photos produced by an extended team of experts, academics, cultural fanatics, artists, musicians and devotees. By focusing on a wide range of topics and using a vast array of points of views we aim to show a true panorama of Argentine culture, looking at the cultural icons of yore as well as the new artists and areas where creativity and integrity are colliding in interesting ways.

The book will come accompanied with a specially-curated selection of new music from Argentina, titled The New Sounds of Argentina.

The book will also be released as a digital book and the compilation will be made available digitally as a stand-alone download.

Illustration by Ezequiel Garcia

 

What Will Be In The Book?

Here are some of the articles that we've already confirmed for the book. More content will be confirmed over the course of the campaign.

  • History of Argentine Hip-Hop
  • Tracing the Footprints of Argentine Rock
  • Argentina Tambien Es Afro (feature on Afro-Argentine culture)
  • Focus on Argentine Street Art
  • How Pablo Katchadjian Annoyed Borges' Estate With His Fattened Aleph
  • Third Cinema and How Argentina Created A New Style of Film-Making
  • Interview with Juana Molina
  • The political activism of Taller Popular de Seriegrafia
  • Influence of Argentina's Indigenous People on Its Culture
  • Rock Barrial and Argentina's Obsession with The Rolling Stones
  • A Cinematic Journey Into Patagonia
  • ZZK Records and the Evolution of Digital Cumbia
  • The Legacy of Argentine Architect Clorindo Testa
  • Cesar Aira, Patagonia and the Wind
  • Ezequiel Garcia's Growing Up In Buenos Aires (Graphic Novel Extract)
  • Photo essays of Argentina's carnival, Patagonia and Clorindo Testa's architecture
  • Illustrations by Lee Hodges, Sebastian Litmanovich, Vivian Mota, Santi Pozzi and Clara Trucco

CD

Compilation produced by Sounds and Colours and Concepto Cero titled The New Sounds of Argentina, that will feature a selection of new music coming out of Argentina, touching on a variety of styles - from digital cumbia to folklore and indie-pop to experimental rock.

Carnival in San Telmo (photo by Ole Gunnar Onsøien)

 

What We Need

We are a completely independent publication. You will not find a single advert in any of our publications. This is the way we like it. It allows us to be completely objective in deciding what content to feature and gives us full creative control.

However, this attitude does bring with it some problems. Namely, a lack of money. For this reason we are using Indiegogo to raise £1,300 ($1,870) for the initial costs of making the book (cover design, artwork, editing, translating) and of printing 300 copies. By buying in advance, you are ensuring that this project can go ahead and letting us know of the demand out there. If we make more than our target then any additional money will be spent on printing more books and/or commissioning additional content, such as original illustrations.

What You Get

Choose to buy Sounds and Colours Argentina as either a digital or print publication and get one of our amazing perks, including the last chance to get hold of some of our older editions.

Digital – Sounds and Colours Argentina will be released as a digital book, available in Kindle and PDF formats. The music compilation will also be released digitally and available in a number of formats.

Print – The print version of Sounds and Colours Argentina will be available in English and will feature 200 pages of articles, illustrations and photos alongside a CD of new Argentine music.

Perks – if you'd like a little something extra then why not get a giclée print of an exclusive design by one of our favourite illustrators, Lee Hodges, especially for the book or one of our postcard sets, featuring images from all four of our publications. It's the perfect gift for anyone who loves Latin American culture.

Exclusive Mixtape – as an extra addition all of our backers will receive an exclusive mixtape of new Argentine music from Doma Tornados.

The Perks

Choose from one of our amazing perks!

- A giclée print of a brand new design made by Lee Hodges especially for the book. This illustration will focus on Argentina's carnival tradition of murga and can be seen below. This image will be printed as a high-quality A3 giclée print:

- A set of four postcards featuring exclusive images from all four of our publications:

 

- Get Sounds and Colours Argentina along with one of our other books on Colombia, Brazil or Peru, all of which are getting close to being sold out!

- Or deem yourself a Sounds and Colours Super Supporter and get our Argentina book as well as our next two publications, which will be out in 2017 and 2018. That kind of support is mind-blowing!

 

What Is Sounds and Colours?

At Sounds and Colours we have made it our mission to find the most interesting stories, influential artists, innovative individuals and illuminating cultural practices happening in South America. This is set to continue with Sounds and Colours Argentina, our fourth publication and one that will focus strictly on the immense music and culture of Argentina.

Sounds and Colours has been around since 2010 in the shape of a website (www.soundsandcolours.com) that regularly publishes articles, news and special multimedia features focused on South American music and culture. In 2012 we grew to become a publisher with the release of Sounds and Colours Colombia, followed by Sounds and Colours Brazil in 2013 and Sounds and Colours Peru in 2015.

Contributors to the Argentina book include regular contributors to the Sounds and Colours website as well as specially-selected individuals from Argentina and the rest of the world who we feel can offer a valuable and interesting insight into Argentine culture. Here are our current list of contributors:

Pablo Bobadilla, Tim Castor, Alan Chac, Alan Courtis, Juan Data, Sarah Foster, Adam Fry, Ezequiel Garcia, Amaya Garcia-Velasco, Diane Ghogomu, Ellen Gordon, Claire Green, Miguel Grinberg. Lee Hodges, George Kafka, Stephanie Kennedy, Jacob Lassar, Ale Leonelli, Sebastian Litmanovich, Nick MacWilliam, Charis McGowan, Vivian Mota, Guillermo Piacenza, Lina Samoili, Lorna Scott-Fox, Jessica Sequeira, Clara Trucco, Bennett Tucker, Russell Slater and Ana Young.

When Will Sounds and Colours Argentina Be Released?

We are aiming for the print edition of Sounds and Colours Argentina to be ready by August, at which time we will send the book to all of our funders. The book will then be made available to the general public in September. The digital edition of Sounds and Colours Argentina will be ready in September. Any changes to this schedule will be mentioned in our Project Updates.

Why Get Involved?

Get involved because you love Argentine or because you want to know more about Argentina, or because you want to help out an independent publisher as they find their way in the world. Sounds and Colours is undoubtedly a niche publication but it's one that inspires a lot of passion and enthusiasm – as nobody else does what we do. Since we began in 2010 we have made no profit. We're happy to continue that way, though we would love to grow and do even more research into South American culture. You can be sure that if you contribute to this campaign your money will not be going into grubby hands or be wasted. We do what we do because we love doing it, and any money we make will go into doing that as best as we can. Plus, we need to cover all the costs of printing this thing!

What To Expect

For an idea of what to expect check out our last publications, Sounds and Colours Peru and Sounds and Colours Brazil. Here's a double page spread from the Brazil book:

Photo at top of page by Oscar Walk

story:
My Journey into Writing

As many of you know, for some time now, I have been working on my manuscript entitled The Storyteller Prophecies.  The novel is both a vision for a future word beyond our current imagination as well as an introspective journey into life's greatest lessons, where the power of magic and the mysteries of the universe are alive at every turn. 

In The Storyteller Prophecies  Carols, a twenty something young Chicano believes that hope is still eternal in a dystopian future. The year is 2160. Nation-states have dissolved almost entirely and a massive energy company named Blango have infiltrated most of the remaining territories. In this new future, Carlos lives in New York City with his best friend Yadira. He teaches 9th grade history and organizing a small bandit of rebels trying to fight for justice in a world where a rich minority have access to an endless supply of electricity, technology, and resources. Meanwhile, the majority of the worlds population  doesn't have access to running water, much less electronics or electricity.  

Carlos' life takes a sharp turn, though, when he losses his job and his grandfather Yonus, a trained Curandero with strange powers beyond most peoples comprehension, sends Carlos on a completely new Journey. Through a ceremony performed by Yonus, Carlos gains the ability to travel into a peculiar but hopeful world 1000 years in an even distant future where humanity, has evolved into something entirely new. In this new future where people can access different powers and abilities such as the ability to control energy, Carlos befriends a gender fluid fortune teller, falls in love with a man with an curious connection to his present, and uncovers some unusual family secrets that link him to the world within his dreams. 

Challenges and revelations await Carlos at every moment. Will he survive this strange new world? And what is the connection between this future world and Carlos present?

VONA (Voices of Our Nation)

More about the workshop I will be attending...

In VONA’s workshops, developing writers of color:

  • Explore their craft in an atmosphere of support and understanding.
  • Learn from the teaching and writing of established writers of color.
  • Are empowered to write about their experiences as people of color.
    VONA is the only writers' conference in the country with a multi-genre focus on writers of color as students and teachers.


    Why I need your Help


    While I am truly honored to be accepted into this years workshop. I need help affording tuition and travel. Moving back to the bay area has proven more expensive than ever before and I need your help to afford the full cost of the writing seminar. Here is the cost breakdown below.
    $500 - Travel to Miami
    $500 - Partial Cost of Tuition
    Total needed to attend conference: $1000

story:
¿Qué?

Hermanas gemelas es una novela de terror sobrenatural que no te dejará indiferente. 

Tras la muerte de su hermana Cristina, Yanira y su familia se mudan a la costa para empezar de cero. Pero su nuevo hogar no lo es todo para que la joven consiga tapar el enorme hueco que los fallecimientos de su hermana y su madre, unos años atrás, dejaron en su alma.
            Además, se siente constantemente acosada por una siniestra presencia que la sigue allá donde va. Una presencia que, en el pasado, fue una pequeña llamada Ana María, que murió en extrañas circunstancias en la misma casa, setenta años atrás.
            En un lugar de leyendas, magia negra, muerte, secretos ocultos y presencias que anhelan volver a la vida, Yanira se enfrentará a sus mayores temores y descubrirá por primera vez, el amor más poderoso de todos.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Carolina Florensa Bello.

Nacida en Madrid en 1993, es amante de los libros y la escritura desde una edad muy temprana, comenzó su andadura por el mundo de las letras en el colegio. Ha sido premiada por la Editorial Club Universitario por su relato corto «Las voces del silencio» en 2011 y el microcuento «Música» en 2018, que fue finalista a nivel internacional de países de habla hispana por Diversidad Literaria.
            Diplomada en Arte Dramático, Canto Moderno y actual profesora de ELE, compagina su actividad como escritora con sus estudios de inglés, alemán, ruso y violín.
            Amante de la creación de historias, Hermanas gemelas es su primera novela. Además, es autora de varios cuentos de terror y dos novelas más, en las que continúa trabajando y que espera que muy pronto vean la luz.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Sus ojos tardaron en acostumbrarse a la oscuridad y cuando por fin lo hicieron distinguió una figura sentada al final de las escaleras, sosteniendo la caja. Con el terror reflejado en sus ojos, Yanira vio que esa figura era la que había visto atravesar  la pared de la cocina. La figura observaba ensimismada el giro que realizaba la bailarina de la caja y al cabo de unos minutos, levantó la cabeza. Instintivamente, Yanira dio unos pasos atrás y trastabilleó, por lo que no alcanzó a ver el rostro de aquella figura que parecía que la observaba mientras lentamente empezaba a descender los peldaños de la escalera.
          Yanira intentó gritar, pero su grito quedó ahogado en su garganta. Por un momento se quedó allí plantada, viendo cómo la figura se aproximaba a ella con cautela sin dejar de sostener la caja de música. Cuando fue capaz de reaccionar, Yanira se levantó torpemente y echó a correr en dirección a su casa. No se detuvo hasta que abrió la valla que velaba la entrada al interior del huerto. Observó la cocina antes de desaparecer tras la puerta de entrada. Una vez dentro de la casa, se apoyó contra la puerta y trató de calmarse.
          Notó que un sudor frío le cubría el rostro y que temblaba ligeramente por el susto. Miró sus manos, y éstas temblaban al igual que toda ella. Un haz de luz volvió a sobresaltarla y vio que provenía del salón: no estaba sola en casa. Tragó saliva y con paso firme se adentró en la leve oscuridad»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción BACK IT es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Carolina Florensa vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

¿Qué?
Hermanas gemelas es una novela de terror sobrenatural que no te dejará indiferente. 
Tras la muerte de su hermana Cristina, Yanira y su familia se mudan a la costa para empezar de cero. Pero su nuevo hogar no lo es todo para que la joven consiga tapar el enorme hueco que los fallecimientos de su hermana y su madre, unos años atrás, dejaron en su alma.            Además, se siente constantemente acosada por una siniestra presencia que la sigue allá donde va. Una presencia que, en el pasado, fue una pequeña llamada Ana María, que murió en extrañas circunstancias en la misma casa, setenta años atrás.            En un lugar de leyendas, magia negra, muerte, secretos ocultos y presencias que anhelan volver a la vida, Yanira se enfrentará a sus mayores temores y descubrirá por primera vez, el amor más poderoso de todos.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Carolina Florensa Bello.
Nacida en Madrid en 1993, es amante de los libros y la escritura desde una edad muy temprana, comenzó su andadura por el mundo de las letras en el colegio. Ha sido premiada por la Editorial Club Universitario por su relato corto «Las voces del silencio» en 2011 y el microcuento «Música» en 2018, que fue finalista a nivel internacional de países de habla hispana por Diversidad Literaria.            Diplomada en Arte Dramático, Canto Moderno y actual profesora de ELE, compagina su actividad como escritora con sus estudios de inglés, alemán, ruso y violín.            Amante de la creación de historias, Hermanas gemelas es su primera novela. story:
Story of My Book

Memestock Alpha Degenerates: How Reddit is changing WallStreet is about the rise of retail investors and their impact in financial markets. Was the GameStop saga in 2021 the beginning of a new trend or a one-time occurrence? What is the unique role that Reddit will play in the future of equity markets?

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the unique impact that Reddit and retail investors will have on financial markets and the future of investing. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the rise of Main Street investors and the impact they are having on Wall Street and large hedge funds. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you think about the new trends in equity markets and what that means for your own financial and investment decisions.

In this book, you'll learn about the unique role Reddit plays in the social media landscape and what you can expect can change after a whirlwind of new investment dynamics that have emerged in 2021. You'll hear stories such as...

  • How a unique social media community called WallStreetBets took on the largest hedge funds on Wall Street... and squeezed them
  • The rise of individual investors during the COVID-19 pandemic... and their unique use of memes and humor to share investment strategies
  • How public companies on the brink of failure have leveraged the risk appetite of retail investors to fund growth... and who has come out on top

You will definitely love this book if you are one of the 10 million members of the WallStreetBets sub-reddit or if you are passionate about the impact of social media on our society. You will also love this book if you are a retail investor on the fence of going deeper into equity markets, if you are an institutional investor looking to further understand the dynamics of new social media trends, if you are a policymaker trying to make sense of the new world where regulations are playing catch up with markets, if you are a finance manager outside the US looking to understand the new trends that may emerge in your own markets, or if you are a passionate follower of financial news.

Memestock Alpha Degenerates: How Reddit is changing WallStreet is a nonfiction book that speaks to individual investors and leaders in business who want to look at the bigger picture of how social media can transform an industry in a short period of time and how adapting quickly in an evolving landscape creates huge risks and rewards.
 

The Book - Memestock Alpha Degenerates: How Reddit is changing Wall Street


The book is written in 2 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-4. The reader will learn about Reddit, its quirks and how it changed the retail investment landscape. The reader will also learn about the history of GameStop, the public company that was part of a short squeeze in January of 2021 that raised the impact of individual investors to worldwide attention. This part of the book argues that Reddit is different and its impact on finance therefore should be understood through a unique lens. My research answers questions such as: Was the GameStop frenzy the wisdom of the crowd or the madness of a mob? The dynamic between individual investors on the Robinhood trading platform and hedge funds was closely examined by Congress: what does that mean for the future of investment regulations? Did the memestock mania create a new type of market dynamic? What does that mean for Wall Street?

Part 2 contains chapters 5-6 and the conclusion. The main thing I examine in this part is whether things in Wall Street truly changed or not. I also look at some of the emerging trends in the investment landscape and propose a few ideas of what those changes will mean in the years to come. I am very passionate about this topic because I believe we are only beginning to see the long-lasting impact the last 10 months will have on the next 10 years.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Winter.
  • I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

Campaign Goals

Tier 1: Hit $5,500 and the ebook/softcover editions get published (this is the minimum needed)
Tier 2: Hit $6,500 and the book will get a hardcover edition
Tier 3: Hit $8,500 and we’ll get an audiobook edition.

 

About the Author

Mariano Gutierrez is a business leader with a track record of global and regional responsibilities in marketing, strategic planning, public affairs and the public sector over the past 18 years. He holds degrees from MIT and Sciences Po. He is a voracious reader and his dream was always to write a book: this is it!

Mariano was compelled to write this book because it is a story for the ages: a tragedy masqueraded as a David vs. Goliath story. He felt like he needed to write this book because there is so much commentary out there: video clips, tweets, news stories, YouTube channels, news articles, analyses, TV specials, etc. But there was no “big picture thinking” and the bigger questions were not being answered. Questions like: Why did this happen? What is the meaning of this incident? Who wins and who loses? Why does this matter? Did something fundamental change in Wall Street or is this a temporary blip in financial history? There are many unanswered questions and the public has been swept up in the “micromoment” or the 15 minutes of fame and we moved on from GameStop to AMC to the next big thing. What if this is the first sign of a fundamental shift? And wat would that mean? He is passionate about looking for meaning in unexpected places.

Outside of writing, Mariano is a family man who loves traveling with his amazing, spectacular wife and three beautiful boys, running marathons, doing jigsaw puzzles and building Legos with the boys.

For more information, you can connect with Mariano at marianogtz @ gmail.com and https://www.linkedin.com/in/marianogutierrez/.

 

International Preorders

Hola! If you don't live in the US and want my book - here's what you need to do. :)

For international preorders, please do the following:

Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks

Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page).

Then please fill out this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days).

Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry!

Please use #MADmarkets and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!

Tag:
Instagram - @marianogtzll / @newdegreepress


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Mariano

story:
Meet Chickpea!

Chickpea is a black and white cow who grows up inside a big farm. Chickpea watches her fellow bovines disappear one by one, including her own mom. One day all the cows at the farm including Chickpea are led towards a truck, which they sense leads to a terrible place. Making a split-second decision, Chickpea takes a brave leap and goes flying over the fence that encloses the farm. This escape leads her into the woods and, thanks to chance encounters and some delicious vegan pie, into the lives of some new friends, human and nonhuman, who welcome her with kindness.

The narrative is inspired by many real-life cases of runaway cows. Some of their stories can be found on the Chickpea Runs Away website at https://chickpearunsaway.com.

About the author

Hi, my name is Sarat Colling and I’m the author of Chickpea Runs Away. Since completing my master’s in sociology in 2012, which focused on the lives of farmed animals who escape captivity, I have been dedicated to writing about animal resistance. As a vegan of 14 years, I value the lives and voices of all animals who, just like Chickpea, have a story to tell.

It has been delightful to work on this project with the talented children’s book illustrator and pet portrait artist, Vicky Bowes, who brought Chickpea’s story to life with her magical illustrations.

What makes this book important

While billions of animals are captive in human society, every day some of them manage to break free: escaping past gates, fences and trailers, and running through the streets, fields, and forests. Such defiant acts are one form of animal resistance.

Chickpea Runs Away depicts both daily acts of animal resistance and escape. Based on true stories, this book offers children an engaging narrative through the lens of animals’ resistance and agency. It’s a potent angle from which to consider animals' perspectives and imagine what it would be like to be an outlaw cow on the run and in the forest.

The story also demonstrates ways that supportive individuals can act in solidarity with animal resistors. The characters Chickpea meets after her escape help with her basic needs, offer her a loving home, and aid her without taking away her autonomy.  

Where does my money go?

Your contribution will go directly to completing, printing, and distributing this book. For your contribution, you will receive a gift that you choose from several options. You will also have our deep gratitude for helping bring this project to life! This book cannot be completed without your support. You can help bring this book into the hands of many children.

Other ways you can help!

Financial contributions are a key part to making this book a reality, but getting our message out to as many people as possible is also vital. Sharing, posting, and talking about this campaign with your family, friends, and anyone you know will help this project reach its goal and get more support for our message. 

When will I get my book?

The books will be delivered in approximately three months from the end of the campaign. 

May Chickpea’s story inspire kids to contemplate the courage within themselves, as well as the meaningful lives of other animals. Thank you for your support!

May Chickpea’s story inspire kids to contemplate the courage within themselves, as well as the meaningful lives of other animals. Thank you for your support!

story:
UPDATE: The campaign has been a success! For Hire: Operator is available at tinyurl.com/ForHireMag1

 

What's What...

Hi! I'm Kevin Patterson and I'm blogger behind Poly Role Models and the author of Love's Not Color Blind: Race and Representation in Polyamorous and Other Alternative Communities. I've been speaking and writing about representation and polyamory for going on 5 years. I've been consuming comics and sci-fi for my whole life. About halfway into writing Love's Not Color Blind, I took a break for NaNoWriMo to write a story I didn't think I'd share to anyone but my friends.  Friends like Alana Phelan, The Polyamorous Librarian, an educator, editor, and book reviewer also local to the Philadelphia area.

By our powers combined, we two polyamorous Wonder Twins have kicked off a queer and polyamorous superheroic world with this book, For Hire: Operator.

What We Need & What You Get...

The goal of this campaign is to cover the cost of publishing and marketing For Hire: Operator. Though our advocacy work offers us a little bit of a platform, it isn't nearly enough to clear the hurdle of getting a book into all of the hands.

What we're looking to cover is:

  • Printing costs
  • Shipping supplies and postage
  • Artwork (credit to Miguel Blanco)
  • Marketing materials (stickers, trailers, etc.)
  • A little financial breathing room to not take on new projects until this one is finished

What we're looking to give you:

  • Early copies of the ebooks
  • Signed copies of the paperback
  • Acknowledgements in the book itself

The Impact

We are nerds and we want to see ourselves represented in characters in a way we can't casually do...yet. We hope to one day see hundreds of books like ours, but until then we will keep writing our diverse world so that others can be reflected in our pages.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this everywhere!

Kevin A. Patterson exists at:
Facebook - Twitter - Tumblr - Instagram - Patreon 

&

Alana Phelan does stuff at:
Facebook - Twitter - Wordpress - Patreon

story:
About the Author

In my day-to-day life, I work in higher education in central New York, but in my free time I like to create stories and paper crafts as gifts for friends and local art festivals. Recently, I created an experience that I as able to share with attendees at an event and it got great reviews. After that beta-test, I was ready to bring it to a larger audience. In the future, I will likely continue to make individual experiences tailored to one recipient, but I may make more larger stories. It's a mystery!

What did people think of the experience?

The experience was beta tested for ease of readability and general "fun" measuring. Here is what participants had to say:

"A haunting and creepy experience." - Angela S.

"You start by assuming you're in control of the experience, but rather quickly see that you're not. This piece struck amazing balance, forcing you to pause and think about subtle dynamics while also pushing you to find out what happens next. I'm still thinking about it a week later." - Dominique D.

"I was really pleased to be [REDACTED] in this activity. The materials in this activity were beautifully made and the story takes a fun surprise twist at the end!" - Isaac R.

"Building the story
Of Sound of Insanity--
Horrifying fun!"
- Amanda S.

"The bells! The bells!" - Ann O.

What We Need & What You Get

The supplies, shipping, and time to create the items are the bulk of the costs here. The story also has over one hundred hours of creation and testing. For a little extra, you can help craft the story by naming a character after yourself or honoring someone else. There is also an option to have fancy hand-addressed calligraphy envelopes. Regardless of whether I sell all of the experiences available, every purchase will get the experience when it is ready and every backer can customize an artifact in the initial mailing.

The experience itself is currently comprised of four mailings of various sizes with more than a dozen hand-crafted items ranging from newspaper clippings to telegraphs to emails - spanning multiple time periods.

The Impact

A story told over time through interactive objects is a unique experience that most people have never had before. Recipients of my stories in the past have been surprised by the intricacy and attention to detail that each piece shows. Here is one example from this past holiday season:

"Just received the most intricate, interesting Christmas gift. It's like an escape room in a box and I'm obsessed." - Dani N.

Risks & Challenges

There are not many risks or challenges involved. Most of the materials are already purchased and the design for the artifacts are already created and just need to be modified with custom information. The two things that are funding dependent:

  • Any "name a character" levels leftover at the end will be filled in by myself with people I know and love (unless they die in the story, then I will pick someone else...).
  • One artifact is cheaper for me the more I buy, but that doesn't affect you ;)

What Happens to the Proceeds?

The materials are purchased, so where does the money go? Glad you asked. First, I need to pay myself back for the supplies, the time creating, and the testing process. Then of course Indiegogo has some fees. I also want to donate a portion of the proceeds to POrtalBurn, a regional event that gave me a grant to create the prototype to be beta tested. The rest will go towards a leadership training certification I have wanted to do for a while and also a medical bill that has been haunting me for a few years. There is no plan to launch a new business or anything like that, just trying out a creative way to share my art and pay some bills.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sound too complicated or weird? Not into light horror themes? Don't know anyone to gift it to? Hate fun? No problem! You can support by sharing the campaign with friends who might enjoy it. There are some share tools located at the top to make it easier!

What, no Stretch Goals?

Oh alright, fine. If I reach the funding goal, I will also include an epilogue of sorts in the form of an expertly designed crossword puzzle that incorporates the story elements and multiple puzzle elements (in case crosswords weren't hard enough!).

story:
When I was 20 years old I got diagnosed with bipolar disorder.  It felt like the end of my life. Back then I didn't know anyone with such diagnosis who would lead a fulfilling life and there was generally speaking  little  or no information on how to heal from that existential condition. Only how to stay reasonably stable with the help of medication. The perspective of staying sedated my whole life didn't appeal to me. Psychiatric treatment felt impersonal, unhelpful  and cold. I wasn't progressing but becoming more withdrawn and self-stigmatizing with each month of it. 

Afer many years of searching for alternatives I found out that what I needed the most was to have people around me who would understand my story. Professionals couldn't do that for me.  People with lived experience did. And the wisdom and acceptance they gave me slowly started to heal me and make me stronger...

I am in a different place now and I know there is healing. I also know that psychiatry is far too pessimistic in its prognosis for people with what it call serious mental disorders.

 

The psychodelic journey from space to Earth is not all about suffering and loss.  It provides the one who undergoes this path with rich experiences, deep understanding of humanity, compassion and awareness of the self as well as unique individuality.

 

Now, after years of my healing process and feeling closer to being whole, fulfilled and strong I feel the need to share with others what I have learnt along the way.

In my book I present a couple of useful truths about the existential condition of being a highly sensitive individual lost in the World. These truths have saved me and I believe they have the  power to help one integrate and emerge from chaos and suffering.

With your help I will be able to share my knowledge with others.

There are too many of us going through experiences of emotional/spiritual crisis alone. Too many of us not knowing there are other weird creatures from the tribe out there waiting to give us a hand.

With your help I'll do my part in breaking the stigma.

<3

xxx

Here's what a specialist in treating psychosis dr. Danielle Knafo wrote about this book:

''The Heavy Volume of Aliens is a wonderful and heartfelt book that embraces difference. Author Anna Lipska writes from experience. She herself has been diagnosed with bipolar illness with psychotic features. She was treated according to the medical model with pharmaceuticals and told she had a lifelong condition. Ms. Lipska eventually had the courage to question diagnostic labeling and drug treatment. Instead of living her life as a patient, she embarked on an inner journey that embraced her difference while it also helped to anchor her in reality. This book is a guide for the many others who live life on earth feeling like aliens. It is very comprehensive and covers areas that are glaringly absent from medical texts: spirituality, creativity, self-care, relationships. Healing comes in many forms and Ms. Lipska empathically writes of the pain people feel and the challenges they confront. Most importantly, she gives hope and direction toward the acceptance of difference and channeling of the universal instinct for recognition and belonging. I recommend this book to anyone who feels he or she does not belong in this world. They will be pleasantly surprised with an alternative perspective that can guide them toward integration and peace of mind.''

Danielle Knafo, Ph.D.,

Clinical Psychologist and Psychoanalyst,

Professor, Long Island University

Author, Living with Terror, Working with Trauma

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • It's simple. I need 3000 euros to bring my book to life. It will cover the work of a professional editor, book and cover designer, preparation of ebooks and obviously print of the actual books.
  • In return for your support I prepared unique perks  - from desktop wallpapers with the best quotes from the book and cosmic illustrations to a meeting with the author. (find your favorite perk on the list above on the right) :)

 

The Impact

  • I want to make a change in the way we see alternative states of mind to provide understanding to those going through them and facilitate acceptance of them
  • I have already received over 100 likes on the facebook book page and got private messages from people interested in reading the book
  • For the last two years I have worked as a mental health activist giving speeches in mental health hospitals and Universities as well as during conferences where I've got in touch with several mental health professionals and institutions who are supporting me in this project 

Risks & Challenges

  • The obvious risks are that I do not raise enough interest to collect the some of money I need to cover the costs of printing books and  the perks
  • I do however intend to do all I can to promote my project through different means of social media and websites devoted to the subject of mental health and stigma 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Like the fanpage of the book

https://www.facebook.com/The-heavy-volume-of-Al...

Share info about this campaign 

Tell your family and friends about “The Heavy volume of Aliens”,

Share our graphics on your facebook/tumblr/instagram/pinterest account

Write about the campaign on your blog/site.

***

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

I started this project after seeing a couple different fandom artbooks go through with great success, both of which were met with much love and support from the Supernatural community. Seeing how much care went into them and how much attention they garnered, I couldn't help but wonder- "what if a similar project existed to celebrate the writers in fandom?"

"Seasons" is a project that's meant to do exactly that- celebrate those authors and give them a bit of a spotlight. Fan fiction is an often underappreciated medium, so I wanted to give it some of the love and attention that it deserves. If this project goes according to plan, then it'll finally get at least a bit of that recognition.

On top of that, I'm hoping we'll get to raise some funds for two very worthy causes- all profits raised for this project beyond production costs will be split evenly between the Archive of Our Own (better known as AO3) and the IMAlive crisis support network. 

What We Need & What You Get

After looking at different costs, here's where we're at in terms of the money we need to see this project through. The $4000 goal I've set pays for...

  • Printing: 100 softcover books and 100 hardcover books, to start with
  • Commissions: cover art, etc.
  • eBook conversion cost
  • Profit margin: to be donated to AO3 + IMAlive

Funds raised past the goal will go to printing of additional books (however many are needed based on demand, plus possibly a few extra copies for post-campaign sales), and possibly to additional rewards.

As for what you'll be getting out of this project- let's talk a little more about the book itself.

The book will be 6x9", approximately 400 pages long, and is offered in digital (eBook and PDF), hardcover, and softcover versions. The cover art has been done by Paula Mould, and inside, you'll find ninety original works by ninety different fandom authors, each roughly 1200 words or fewer, gen, and canon-verse. Each work will be in one of four themed chapters- Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter- with the overarching theme of the book (and the title!) being "Seasons." Also included in the book will be a complete list of writers, betas, and campaign contributors- that's all of you- who've participated in bringing this project to life.

In addition to the books themselves, we've teamed up with some wonderfully talented fandom artists to create a few extra goodies that are available with different contributions. These include postcard prints (by sketchydean), bookmarks (by impalartsociopath), and stickers (by diminuel).

Several of our authors have also signed up to offer written commissions as a part of the campaign! If you're interesting in having a custom fic written and you'd like to learn more about which authors are participating and how to claim their spots, take a look at this page. You must send in an email (to spnshortstories@gmail.com) in order to gain access to and claim one of these commissions.

Every individual who contributes to this campaign will be included in the list of contributors in the final book, whether you contribute dollar or one hundred. Your support means the world to us, and we want to show you a little love, too.

The Impact

Fan fiction is a medium that's often dismissed by people at large, and its creators don't get much in the way of respect for their talent. This project aims to start mending that, by giving those authors the recognition they deserve. If it's successful, and everything goes according to plan, then Seasons could open the door for more, similar projects in the future- ones with different parameters, attracting different authors and different types of audiences.

We're also working to raise money for two very worthy charity causes- the Archive of Our Own and the IMAlive crisis support network.

For fandom writers, AO3 is an indispensable resource for sharing work. For fic readers, it’s a godsend; extremely easy to navigate and chock-full of everything you could possibly want to read. AO3 is a non-profit organization that relies on donations to run, and with everything it's done for our fandom and more, it definitely deserves to get a little something back from us. 

IMAlive is an online crisis network where 100% of the volunteers are trained in crisis intervention. It offers an online alternative to crisis hotlines, where talking over the phone might be too much for an individual to handle. Largely supported by the SPN Family, they’re also present at Creation’s Supernatural conventions and offer support to people who need it. Donations support volunteers and the network itself. 

Risks & Challenges

Right now, the project is in its final stages of being put together. All of the content has been gathered, and now it's just a matter of putting it into the book so everything can be properly formatted. The biggest challenge will be wait time in terms of getting everything printed and shipped out, and I'll be doing everything in my power to make sure it all runs smoothly once the campaign is over.

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest way to help out is to spread the word! We want to get as many people interested in this project as possible, so spreading interest on any social media you have is a huge help. 

Our Participants

And now, a list of all our contributing writers.

adoredean | alexisjane | amazinmango | amirosebooks | anon1adult | archangel-with-a-shotgun | aria-lerendeair | babybluecas | beekeepercain | bernalheights | brokenboykings | casandsip | castielsunshinegrace | chestercbennington | chvystiel | compo67 | cosenangel | crowroad | cryskeeter | cymamoremocha | dandymot | deanirae | deanplease | dean-wxnchester | demonsiget-butpeoplearecrazy | diminuel | disizletzi | doctor--idiot | domesticadventures | dragonflybeach | dusky-gold | envydean | fallen-gabriel | fallintosanity | fides-sam | foolscapper | frozen-delight | godforsakenthing | guildedparadox | highonmarvel | holydarkhallelujah | hunters-with-angels | i-had-bucky | ilovejared | impalartsociopath | indigoneutrino | iwouldvethoughtofabetterurl | jaredsnuggles | jupiterjames | justanothersaltandburn | kalliel | KCScribbler | keepcalmsmile | ladyettejin | leahlisabeth | maaahksheppard | mandylynn4 | marciaelena | nerdygeekypastrychef | puckity | purgatoan | rainsoakedsam | random-fireworks | rebel-cas | revwinchester | rizlowwritessortof | rosemoonweaver | samanddeaninpanties | sammichgirl | sammyatstanford | samsexualdeancurious | sapphireswimming | schmerzerling | seafoxfire | singingflames | soluscheese | stanfordwincest | thatgorgeousarchangel | thedropoutandthejunkie | themegalosaurus | tragidean | ultimatefandomtrash61 | unforth-ninawaters | wideawakeandwriting | winchesterpooja | winchestersinlove | winjennster | withthedemonblood | womanoflettersinthebunker
