story:
Publishing Round 3: Final Run


The Book:

555 pages of My Little Pony Fanfiction, with a focus on providing a self-consistent history for the world, as well as exploring the consequences of an individual's actions and treatment of self and others. Rather philosophical. Written because I knew I had a good idea, and if I didn't do it, nobody would.

The actual physical book is a high-quality paperback produced through the self-publishing website, Lulu.com. It features coverart produced by my good friend Skjolty from South Africa, as shown here and below: http://skjolty.deviantart.com/art/Inner-Glory-Cover-Art-508567519


The Journey:

After finally finishing my three-year work, Inner Glory, a My Little Pony Fanfiction, I had a lot of readers ask me if I would be publishing it, as they wanted a physical reminder of the journey they'd been on. I looked into the logistics, polled my readers for support, and finally went through with it. Two successful publishing runs later, I still have people asking for a copy of the book, as word has gotten out about the story of an individual trying to make sense of a frightening world, and how much it has resonated with the readers.


In the process of learning how to self-publish, compile a story, and to ship books en masse, I've met a lot of my old readers and made friends out of some new ones. I've been to conventions and received a lot of feedback, and so it is with pleasure that I announce this, the final publishing run for Inner Glory, and the beginning of its rewrite in an original world so that the story and lessons inside can be shared with a broader audience than simply one fanbase. This campaign marks the last public chance for people to buy the Pony Fanfiction Inner Glory as I move forward into the next chapter of my life, and rewrite it all from the ground up.


I've been planning for months, and I'm now confident in the direction I'll be taking the rewrite. Significant changes have been made, but the core purpose and themes survive, perhaps stronger than ever. I'm grateful for all the support I've received in the past, and for the friends and readers who have encouraged me to keep following my dreams of authorship.


The Campaign:

Because I'm self-publishing, copies of Inner Glory only exist as orders are made for them. It's not cheap to publish, especially if you only print a few copies. I'm using crowdfunding as a means of making copies of the book affordable to everyone involved, by ordering in bulk and thus chopping down the individual cost. I will be using Lulu.com, the publisher that I used with these last two publishing runs. They've been timely and high-quality for the price. After the orders go through and the books are printed, the finished copies will be sent to me for arranging, signing, and finally, shipping. I will personally oversee the process, and may involve my siblings if I need a bit of extra help.

Having used Lulu.com before, and never having issues with them, I do not foresee any issues with the publishing process, but if anything comes up, I will post updates here and on my Fimfiction page to keep my readers updated.


Rewards:

In addition to receiving your very own physical copy of the book, I will be releasing teaser chapters to the humanization of the story if we reach the base goal of $500. (Humanization referring to the re-write in an original Intellectual Property.) $500 is the minimum goal allowed on Indiegogo, and conveniently the point at which mass printing becomes feasible.

When the teaser chapters are released, I'll post updates both here as well as on my Fimfiction page.


Summary:

This is the last publicly available opportunity to get copies of the pony version of Inner Glory! After we reach our $500 goal, the printing will happen, and everybody who ordered a copy of the book will get it. I'll release teasers for my upcoming rewrite of the story, and finally have this story that I love so dearly in a form that I can truly call my own. Keep your eyes out, and don't forget to spread the campaign around! The more people that know about it, the more creative fuel I'll have for the rewrite!

It features coverart produced by my good friend Skjolty from South Africa, as shown here and below: http://skjolty.deviantart.com/art/Inner-Glory-Cover-Art-508567519The Journey:After finally finishing my three-year work, Inner Glory, a My Little Pony Fanfiction, I had a lot of readers ask me if I would be publishing it, as they wanted a physical reminder of the journey they'd been on. I looked into the logistics, polled my readers for support, and finally went through with it. Two successful publishing runs later, I still have people asking for a copy of the book, as word has gotten out about the story of an individual trying to make sense of a frightening world, and how much it has resonated with the readers.In the process of learning how to self-publish, compile a story, and to ship books en masse, I've met a lot of my old readers and made friends out of some new ones. I've been to conventions and received a lot of feedback, and so it is with pleasure that I announce this, the final publishing run for Inner Glory, and the beginning of its rewrite in an original world so that the story and lessons inside can be shared with a broader audience than simply one fanbase. This campaign marks the last public chance for people to buy the Pony Fanfiction Inner Glory as I move forward into the next chapter of my life, and rewrite it all from the ground up.I've been planning for months, and I'm now confident in the direction I'll be taking the rewrite. Significant changes have been made, but the core purpose and themes survive, perhaps stronger than ever. I'm grateful for all the support I've received in the past, and for the friends and readers who have encouraged me to keep following my dreams of authorship.The Campaign:Because I'm self-publishing, copies of Inner Glory only exist as orders are made for them. It's not cheap to publish, especially if you only print a few copies. I'm using crowdfunding as a means of making copies of the book affordable to everyone involved, by ordering in bulk and thus chopping down the individual cost. I will be using Lulu.com, the publisher that I used with these last two publishing runs. They've been timely and high-quality for the price. After the orders go through and the books are printed, the finished copies will be sent to me for arranging, signing, and finally, shipping. I will personally oversee the process, and may involve my siblings if I need a bit of extra help.Having used Lulu.com before, and never having issues with them, I do not foresee any issues with the publishing process, but if anything comes up, I will post updates here and on my Fimfiction page to keep my readers updated.Rewards:In addition to receiving your very own physical copy of the book, I will be releasing teaser chapters to the humanization of the story if we reach the base goal of $500. (Humanization referring to the re-write in an original Intellectual Property.) $500 is the minimum goal allowed on Indiegogo, and conveniently the point at which mass printing becomes feasible.When the teaser chapters are released, I'll post updates both here as well as on my Fimfiction page.Summary:This is the last publicly available opportunity to get copies of the pony version of Inner Glory! After we reach our $500 goal, the printing will happen, and everybody who ordered a copy of the book will get it. I'll release teasers for my upcoming rewrite of the story, and finally have this story that I love so dearly in a form that I can truly call my own. Keep your eyes out, and don't forget to spread the campaign around! The more people that know about it, the more creative fuel I'll have for the rewrite!

story:
More Than Just One Journal...

Hi!

My name is Ivy Page. I am the editor and founder of OVS Magazine. I started this journal after graduating from my MFA program as a way to stay connected with other poets and artists, and give those same poets and artists a peer reviewed journal that would help them get their work out in the world. 

The AWP Conference is one of the largest writing conferences, and we would love to be able to fund having a table to display OVS Magazine and the artists and poets we have published.

By helping us fund this conference you will be helping every artist and poet in our journals reach a wider audience. We have been publishing since 2009, and have published both undiscovered and well-known artists and poets.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500.00 to purchase the bookfair table, and an additional $500.00 for stickers, cards, and give-away material for those that stop by the table. Anything beyond that would go to having a reading/gallary show off-site for the people we publish to showcase their work.  This will hopefully be the next champaign!

We want to give you something in return...

Every little bit helps, so if you want to contribute $5, or $100, we appreciate it all. 

If we don't reach our goal, any funds will still be used to help get us to AWP. 

The Impact

We really do believe in promoting the talented people we publish. Every bit of our time spent at AWP is an opportunity for an artist or poets work to reach thousands of people.

We have gone to the AWP conference for the past two years, and each time we meet new talent, get to meet some of our contributors face-to-face and spread the word about their work.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, please help us spread the word by sharing this on Facebook, Twitter, or through email!

story:
Announcing the Stories of Our Legacy

The stories of the women in the bible have been hidden from the sight of Jewish women in this generation. Now there is a rising desire for access to the power of the women we have descended from. Sisterhood of the Copper Mirrors: The Legacy of the Jewish Woman reveals the stories and teachings so you can discover these timeless stories for yourself and bring them into your life in concrete ways.

These are the stories that built a nation, and it's time to know them for ourselves. It's time to cash in on our inheritance!

I'm Laya Saul, author of this new book about timeless stories of the Jewish foremothers. Since I began my journey into the world of Torah, I have found truth after truth, wisdom and more wisdom. One of the teachings is about how women impact this world, how women will bring redemption to the world. Women! I'm so passionate about letting women know the power we have had in the past, the very foundation of our nation, and the power we have right now.

I want women (and men!) to know these stories, to honor themselves, to know the truth. Each one of us is a candle that chases away the darkness. By getting this book to print in a big way, by getting this knowledge into women's hands, we can ignite more light within ourselves and others.

I have been teaching the topic of women in Torah internationally for over ten years. With a master's degree in psychology, I have also focused on filling this book with lessons that can have a major positive impact on the quality of our lives. This is not just a book, it's a treasure map.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the breakdown of how we'll use the money:

The funding through this campaign covers the high-quality production of this book: Superb editing and source referencing, cover art, interior layout, indexing, and printing costs.  We did not hold back on bringing this book to excellence!

Your participation gets you more than just ink on a page. It's timeless wisdom, something you can grow with and give to others. Check out the unique copper mirror pendant especially designed by artist Tzipora Hoynik, whose jewelry has been on exhibit in the Smithsonian. There are opportunities to get this book into the hands of Jewish women who might not otherwise find it on their own through campuses and outreach.

If we reach and surpass the goal, I'll be your emissary to spread the light and get this book into even more hands!

The Impact

Your contribution gets you more than a book. Statistics show that one book is read by multiple people. The light of your candle ignights the wicks of other candles.

The time has come for this generation to know the truth about our own foremothers and learn from both their mistakes and their strengths.

My self-help book for teens went to print fifteen years ago. It's still selling and still impacting lives for the good.

Here's a chance for you to truly be a link in the chain of the legacy of our nation.

Advance Praise from Jewish Leaders

"Laya Saul has written a book that will give today’s generation of Jewish women their rightful inheritance: the role models that reveal our legacy and illuminate our future."

Lori Palatnik, Founding Director, Jewish Women’s Renaissance Project (JWRP)

"Accessible and inspiring. Laya Saul tells the epic stories of women of the Torah and brings to life the lessons and values of being a Jewish woman. I am happy to recommend and support such a wonderful book."

Olivia Schwartz, co-director, Chai Center, Los Angeles

"Sisterhood of the Copper Mirrors is an in-depth exploration of fourteen of the most prominent women in the Hebrew Bible. By focusing on the eternal archetypes represented by each female character, Saul illuminates the spiritual lessons these strong women teach us—lessons that are as relevant today as they were thousands of years ago. Saul writes in a clear, engaging manner, making this book accessible to all Jewish women, whether this is their first introduction to biblical heroines or they’ve been studying the material for years. Sisterhood of the Copper Mirrors is an entertaining book that is sure to inspire Jewish women of all ages and backgrounds."

Nina Davidovich Litvak, screenwriter and co-creator, Accidental Talmudist

"Sisterhood of the Copper Mirrors is a marvelous foundational “family history” that mirrors the wisdom, power, and spiritual DNA of the Jewish woman."

Adrienne Gold, Trip and Education Leader, Jewish Women’s Renaissance Project (JRWP)

Why Copper Mirrors?


Risks & Challenges

This is not technology—there's nothing to break. The book is written and edited. This campaign is about going to print, and it's a process I've done before. I did a campaign for a picture book for toddlers that is in print (in limited quantity for now). We can do this!

I suppose the most dramatic risk is that there is a delay in the process. That is not anticipated, and I will keep you posted.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you can make a financial contribution, please:

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

Copy and paste any part of this page with the URL and share with friends and family on social media or via email.

Say a little prayer or send me an encouraging word. It all makes a difference!

Thank you so much!

About the Jeweler

Tzipora Hoynik is a lifelong artist and jeweler who uses natural gemstones as the inspiration for her one of a kind jewelry designs.

For this project, Tzipora was inspired by some of the stories to create this fundraising piece.  Made of cast, lead-free pewter, dipped in copper, and then sealed, it is a reflection of the beauty in all of us. The leaves on the mirror represent the hadassah plant (myrtle). Hadassah was Queen Esther’s birth name. (The leaves are used during the holiday of Sukkot in the lulav where they represent the eyes and also sweet deeds we do in this world.)

Tzpiora’s work is on display at the Smithsonian in connection with the Burning Man exhibit. Currently working in precious stones and metals her work can be found at https://www.etsy.com/shop/spiraljewelry

story:
Who Are the Freshman 15?

Before the first storyteller, there was the struggle.  Its influence can be seen in every battle, heard in every story in human history, between those bestowed the power of the First and those that desire it.  The world's first war will at last come to an end on the twenty-fifth birthday of the Quarterlife Child.  The Quarterlife Prophecy foretells of one, who will be a true heir to the First who will end the war forever--one side wants him, one side wants him dead.


Huntar Fischer is totally cool with that, but right now he's eighteen.  After all, he wants to find himself too.  He wants to find himself a major, a man and a fake id.  But the harder he tries to keep his superpower, scholastic, and sex lives apart, the more they insist on the one type of threesome Huntar can't handle.  


The Quarterlife Series follows Huntar and his friends’ journey over their college years, through battles, under covers, and around the world as he learns to accept who he really is, all the while dealing with toga parties and teleporting, finals and flight, soul mates and super strength. 

 

As with all heroic journeys Huntar’s begins with a choice, and the reader will be able to see what life is like on both sides of the fence.  This is merely part one.  Part Two, an alternative timeline to Part One will be released next autumn, which will complete the first volume of the Quarterlife Crises.

**the first chapisode of The Freshman Fifteen is available for download (for free)**

What's the Plan?

The Freshman Fifteen is structured into ten chapisodes that will be released from October until December, allowing us a two month period to spread the word and build momentum.  We are going to promote The Freshman Fifteen with a book tour disguised as homo-house party themed promotional events, such as beer pong competitions, masquerade parties, and storytelling nights in Madison, Minneapolis, Chicago, Milwaukee, and a final location to be chosen by a donor ($1500+).

 

In this project, we are exploring new ways of doing business, content generation, distribution, and promotion using internet grass-roots techniques.  All of this is to promote creativity and inspiration between various creative personalities (like bringing in other singers, storytellers, artists, etc. to promote the various communities that I'm proud to be a part of--friends, LGBT, storytellers, minority groups, and future communities I haven't met yet).  We are doing this by pushing ourselves to our limits and embracing the entrepreneurial spirit of the internet with only an author and a reader, no middlemen publishers (because that's the one kind of threesome I can't handle). 

 

We believe that with a good book, hard work, and a knack for self-promotion, we can make our voices heard and change the world.

$pending & $WAG

We are seeking funding to be able to promote the book with a regional book tour.  By working with our connections in the service industry and other cities we have found ways to host awesome events on pretty tight budgets.  Our costs can be broken into three categories:

  1. Travel costs (e.g. bus tickets [no high-speed rail in WI yet], food, incidental transportation, etc.).  Lodging will be provided by our dear friends in other cities.
  2. Event costs: venues, and food/drink.
  3. Promotional materials (i.e. ads, printed materials, SWAG).

 

We strived to offer interesting perks at each level of donation that are reflective of the book and of our gratitude for your support of The Freshman Fifteen.

Be a Part of the Experience


Aside from monetary contributions there are many other ways to help and participate. 

  • Social Media:  You can follow Ean on twitter and additionally use the hashtag #F15 when tweeting about the book, the campaign, or events.  You can also 'like' both The Freshman 15 and Ean on Facebook.  Also, subscribe to Ean's blog via RSS.
  • Events:  If you're in the Midwest you can attend a promotional event, details will be listed on Facebook through the fanpage.
  • Buy the Chapisodes and the Book:  The chapisodes will be e-published weekly, and digital (Amazon, Barnes&Noble, and iBooks) and print-on-demand copies of the entire book will be available for purchase in December.

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

For some time now, I’ve known that God has called me to something far greater than myself.  Over the past 14 years God has given me the honor to preach His word. In November 2013, God gave me the vision to plant a Church. This is not going to be an easy task but I’m confident that God will make a way.

For almost 10 years I’ve had the pleasure of serving on the ministerial staff at Mount Carmel Baptist Church in Washington, DC. During this time, God has developed in me a huge passion for ministering to His people. I feel that this has been one of the greatest experiences – one in which I’ve grown in so many ways.

At Mount Carmel I was given so many leadership opportunities. Over the years I’ve helped to start an after school program for teens as well as a Sunday evening service for college students and young adults. I’ve also partnered with the community to host community events and forums. I had the opportunity to learn about radio by helping the church expand their radio broadcast from one to ten cities. Mount Carmel has been a place where I’ve truly seen the major role that a Church has in the community. This has inspired me to do the same in Laurel, MD.

The Opportunity

There are over 9 million people in the Baltimore – Washington, D.C area and Laurel sits in the middle of both cities. With a large and growing business and residential population, this is an ideal place for a new Church plant. With a large and diverse ethnic population, we will not only be able to reach those locally within this community, but we will also have the opportunity to reach and impact lives around the world. With many young professionals moving to the area, this city is in desperate need of a church that ministers to their needs. In order to make the vision a reality we need the financial support of men and women who want to make a difference with their lives and resources. Below is a detailed break down of our plan and the resources needed to accomplish it.  It is my prayer that you will join with us to help uplift minds, hearts and the spirits of God’s people.

Uplift Church Strategy:

Attract people from the community

·  Community Outreach

·  Direct Mail

·  Personal Invite

Compelling Worship Services

·  Joyous people to welcome our guest

·  Amazing Children’s ministry with appropriate teaching and supervision

·  Heart felt praise and worship music

·  Relevant and uplifting sermon

Uplifting Relationships

·  Membership classes

·  Small Groups

·  Community Outreach

Leadership Development

·  Identify potential leaders and invite them to take more responsibility

·  Small Group leadership opportunities

·  Oversee a service area

Our Timeline:

Phase One (Dec 2013 –May 2014)

·  Build launch team

·  Start fundraising

·  Launch upliftmd.com website

·  Prayer

Phase Two (April –June 2014)

·  Continue to build launch team. Our goal is to have 100 launch team members

·  Continue launch team meetings

·  Continued prayer

·  Outreach events in Laurel

·  Preview services (June, July, August)

Phase Three (July & Beyond)

·  Official launch of Uplift Church

·  Start Small Groups

Budget (First Three Months):

Nursery:

Diapers, wipes, changing station, toys

$1000

Children:

Supplies, toys, curriculum, videos, books

$1000

Visitors:

Follow-up material, visitors reception, contact cards

$1,500

Outreach:

Service projects in the city

$2,500

Marketing:

Website, direct mailers, signage,

$14,000

Equipment

Video production, sound and lighting

$8,000

Facility:

Rental

$12,000

TOTAL

$40,000

$50 Will help purchase videos for our children's ministry

$100 Will help us send out 1400 mailers

$250 Will help us purchase six flag banners

$500 Will help purchase four microphones and stands

$1500 Will help purchase our sound system

Partner Together

Thank you for taking the time to consider financially supporting the launch of Uplift Church. We are so excited to see what God is going to do.

You can be a part of this effort by giving a single gift or sending monthly support. All contributions are tax deductible. You will receive a contribution statement next January for tax purposes.

God Bless,

Rev. Marquez Ball, Pastor
Uplift Church

community events and forums. I had the opportunity to learn about radio by
helping the church expand their radio broadcast from one to ten cities. Mount

people in the Baltimore – Washington, D.C area and Laurel sits in the middle of

community, but we will also have the opportunity to reach and impact lives
around the world. With many young professionals moving to the area, this city
is in desperate need of a church that ministers to their needs. In order to
make the vision a reality we need the financial support of men and women who
want to make a difference with their lives and resources. Below is a detailed
break down of our plan and the resources needed to accomplish it.  It is my prayer that you will join with us to
help uplift minds, hearts and the spirits of God’s people.

story:
The Isle of the Phoenix novels is my attempt to share Christian truths through a medium of entertaining adventure. All of my currently published books are in the realm of Christian self-help/devotionals. But as a father, I wanted to write something for my children as they enter their teenage years—something that would pull my boys into reading while providing me with an opportunity to share biblical truths and concepts in a unique way.

Having read many different genres, I felt that the use of a fantasy realm would provide me with the most varied, flexible, interesting, and entertaining series of adventure novels…thus the Isle of the Phoenix was born.

Read an excerpt here!

They are fast-paced novels that will draw young readers in and captivate their imagination in an engaging manner while sharing lessons of life that will prepare them for their own adventures. Each novel is a complete story, though often laying the foundation for the novels yet to follow. The novels will follow a wide variety of characters and their descendants to form an in-depth world that a young imagination can blossom in a positive way.

Read another excerpt here!

This is an ambitious project. I anticipate writing dozens of adventure novels attuned to the Isle of the Phoenix. But anyone who has ever published a book knows how expensive it can get, so the purpose of this campaign is to raise the necessary funds to get it published right—proper editing, art preparation, publishing expenses, and marketing.

This isn’t just about my children. It’s about having clean books absent all the sex, casual death, foul language, and humanistic philosophies—while dealing with real issues of everyday life and promoting Christian values. These books will be great for anyone—kids, teens, young adults, old fogies...everyone. What we read has a huge impact on our thinking, our way of life, our understanding of life, and our attitudes. Fiction is a perfect medium to positively affect those ideals, strengthen our morals, and instill positive values.

With this campaign, you can help fund this dream…and I pray you will.

Read excerpts of the first book, The Phoenix Quest, at: www.isleofthephoenix.com

Imagine an island that changes every year. I mean really changes. The Isle of the Phoenix undergoes a dramatic topography transformation every year upon the advent of the Phoenix’s Rebirth. Valleys can appear where mountains once towered. Swamps can replace scorching desert. Volcanoes can form where only trees once grew. Deep snow can be found where a steaming tropical jungle once stood. The entire ecosystem and climate of the island changes every year at the Rebirth. However, the general outline of the island never changes.

The only things other things that do not change are human built structures, but even these are only safe towards the coastline of the island. Anything in the interior can find itself on a cliff one year and in a river the next. The effect is not so dramatic towards the coastline, so most of the human population lives there. Only creatures of the island live in the interior, making the interior not only unmapable, but also incredibly dangerous.

There are two main population centers. The inhabitants of Khol, the northern city, are typically followers of the Phoenix and those with a Gift of the Phoenix serve as the public servants within the city. The inhabitants of Taninim, the southern city, are typically worshipers of the Dragon. Those with a Gift of the Dragon are rulers, often ruling dictatorially and harshly. Around both cities can be found a scattering of villages and farms.

A mysterious fog surrounds the island, preventing anyone from leaving. Those who attempt it are never seen again, though the wreckage of their ships are often found washed ashore. Occasionally, someone emerges from the fog having entered it from the other side, became wrecked on the treacherous reefs hidden within the fog, and is then washed ashore, marooned.

Within the interior of the island live a variety odd creatures that seem to have emerged from folklore. Though their natures tend to remain consistent, their physiology changes with each Rebirth. One year, a creature can be taller than a human and the next year, no higher than the same human’s knees. Their overall appearance remains the same, but they can be thinner, stockier, fatter, stronger, weaker, etc. than precious years. They are different than normal animals which, like humans, don’t change from year to year. Some are very intelligent and some have intelligence little better than animals. Regardless, they are special and can be either helpful or incredibly dangerous if encountered. 

It is in this fantastical land that all the adventures take place. The map above is what the characters of the first book discover. The next book will have an entirely different map as the island will have changed.

www.isleofthephoenix.com

Everything in the book symbolizes some aspect of Christianity. This is not overtly stated in the actual novel, but anyone who tries to see the symbols will find them easily enough.

For example, the Phoenix is actually an ancient Christian symbol that depicted salvation and the new birth in Christ. In my book, the Phoenix symbolizes the Holy Spirit and the Gifts of the Phoenix represent the various gifts of the Spirit found in 1 Corinthians 12. The Dragon represents Satan and his "gifts" represent the three sources of sin: Lust of the Eyes, Lust of the Flesh, and the Pride of Life (1 John 2:16).

Each book has an overall theme that is represented by a Scripture verse at the very beginning of the book. For the first book, The Phoenix Quest, the theme deals with two intertwined themes: the problem with a bad reputation and bullying. It shows the difficulties of changing a bad reputation once you have it and issues surrounding bulling and friendships. The particular Scripture used is Proverbs 22:1. Every book will follow a similar theme straight out of the Bible.

Although these books are intended for teenagers and young adults, anyone, adult or otherwise, will benefit from seeing these Biblical truths illustrated in these fun-filled, clean adventures. The stories make for great discussions. 

www.isleofthephoenix.com

I think so. I absolutely loved writing the first one and I tested it out on two of my own children. One is nearly 13 and the other nearly 11. Both of them consumed the book. In fact, I have never seen my 11 year old so singly determined to read a book such as he did this one. As the author, I loved watching him read and read and read. It is written at about an 8th grade reading level, so he came to me on numerous occasions asking about what a particular word meant, but I figured he is still young enough that if he didn't like it, he would have gotten bored and wandered away--no matter if his daddy wrote it or not. 

After he finished, we had a great discussion on the many lessons on the book. For me, this book is already a success. Both of my two oldest cannot wait for the second book to be finished. 

My brother, in his 30's, and his wife both loved the book as well.  My brother said, "This is probably the best book you've ever written." He began reading a chapter each night to his own children. His oldest got impatient with that and wanted to read it on his own.

A teenager in our church who is not a reader by any stretch of the imagination has started reading it. He said, "I like the story!" His father likes it too.

Both of my parents have read the first book and these "old fogies" loved the adventure as well. My mother commented that it would make a great movie. My father is already tossing around ideas with me for the second book. Both are avid readers and they felt the book is on par with many other well known authors.

You can read excerpts of the book and explore the Isle of the Phoenix yourself by going to www.isleofthephoenix.com.

The funds that are raised here will go for a variety of purposes:

  1. Editing and Proofreading - up to $1000
  2. Art work, cover design - up to $500
  3. Publishing expenses - up to $1000
  4. Website development - up to $500

I am planning to publish this book regardless of what comes in or does not come in, so be assured that I will fulfill all contribution perks. 

Contribution Perks:

$10 - A Helping Hand

  • Receive a special edition e-book available only through this campaign. Includes two scenes viewed from an alternate character perspective and a special forward from the author. The e-book will be available in mobi, epub, azw, or PDF and emailed to you before the official launch (sometime in September).

$25 - Two Helping Hands

  • Everything in the Helping Hand perk
  • Plus a paperback copy of the book signed by the author after the official launch.
  • For international shipping only, add $20. 

$50 - A True Believer

  • Everything in the Helping Hand perk
  • Plus 2 paperback copies of the book signed by the author after the official launch.
  • Plus have YOUR NAME mentioned in the acknowledgements of all official versions of the published book.
  • For international shipping only, add $20. 
$100 - Your Name in Print

  • Everything in the Helping Hand perk
  • Plus 3 paperback copies of the book signed by the author after the official launch.
  • Plus "photo-bomb" the book with your first name (or someone of your choice) appearing here and there in all official versions of the book. Your first name will appear at least three times in a tasteful manner within the the normal story of the book.
  • Plus your full name will appear in a special section of the acknowledgements page. This could be a great gift idea for those who love to see their name in print
  • For international shipping only, add $20. 

$250 - Personalized Story!

  • Everything in the Helping Hand perk.
  • Plus 5 paperback copies of the book signed by the author after the official launch.
  • Plus a personalized "prologue" to the special edition that only you receive, but will be available on the website for all to read. Your name and the names of two others of your choice will be the central characters of the prologue, meshed as a prelude to the adventure of The Phoenix Quest.
  • Plus your first name will be given to a minor character in the book that will play a small part in the story, but might be brought back in later books for an expanded role.
  • Plus your full name and of the two others will appear in a special section of the acknowledgements page. This could be a great gift idea for those who love to see their name in print.
  • For international shipping only, add $20. 

$1000 - Change the Book

  • Perk Applies to Future Books Only: Name a Major Character after you (or someone of your choice) first name only, your full name in the acknowledgements in reference to the character.
  • Plus you get to include a significant real-life event of said person that the author will incorporate into the book somewhere and in some manner as a significant element of the plot.
  • Plus you will receive an e-book, and 10 signed copies of the book in which your name appears.
  • There is a limit of 1 per book for this.

$2000 - Become "THE" Character

  • Perk Applies to Future Books Only: Name “the” Major Character after you (or someone of your choice) upon which the perspective of the book is based on, first name only, but your full name will be in the acknowledgements in reference to the character.
  • Plus you get to include a significant real-life event of said person that the author will incorporate into the book somewhere and in some manner as a significant element of the plot.
  • Plus you can provide the author with a character sketch of yourself or the person you are wanting to use (character strengths/weaknesses, physical appearance, likes/dislikes, etc).
  • Plus you will receive an e-book, and 15 signed copies of the book in which your name appears.
  • There is a limit of 1 per book for this.

www.isleofthephoenix.com

The Phoenix Quest

  • Story line / Plot: 100% complete
  • Writing: 100% complete
  • Editing: 50% complete
  • Art / Cover Design: 10% complete
  • Publishing: 5% complete

Book 2 (Untitled)

  • Story line / Plot: 100% complete
  • Writing: 2% complete
  • Editing: 0% complete
  • Art / Cover Design: 5% complete
  • Publishing: 0% complete

Website Development

  • Website: 50% complete
  • www.isleofthephoenix.com

Check back for more updates or go to the website.

    Get the word out! Share this with your friends and others who may have an interest in good, clean adventure stories for teens and young adults. Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word.

    Feel free to make suggestions. All comments and thoughts--particularly your prayers--are appreciated. 

    You can also make comments on the website: www.isleofthephoenix.com

    Thank you for your consideration.

    Greg S. Baker

story:
Short Summary

One of the cornerstones of Tri Destiny Publishing is to allow authors freedom to be creative with their own voice and in their own way. Liz is a shining example of how well this approach can work. With this campaign we hope to be able to help more authors stay true to who they are and write books from their souls without the restrictions of a formula or expectation.To make this dream come true, however, we need your help both in contributions and spreading the word.

This Campaign is to get Tri Destiny to RomFest 2012  to increase our visibility with both authors and readers. RomFest 2012 is a Romance book convention. This year's keynote speaker is Sherrilyn Kenyon 

The contributions will cover our cost of attending RomFest as well as bringing a number of printed books to sell (which will be autographed by author Liz Crowe) and other basic business needs such as business cards, brochures, and a table banner. 

Since its founding in December 2011, Tri Destiny Publishing has:

  • Released the first published book in December, 2011, with the second book released in January 2012, a third book in February 2012, and the fourth book in March 2012.
     
  • Partnered with Autography for customized autographed eBook offerings.
     
  • Released the first three titles by Liz Crowe (Floor Time, Sweat Equity, and Closing Costs) with a fourth title released in May and a fifth title planned to debut at RomFest inJune. (All books available on Amazon.com (domestic and international), Barnes & Noble.com, AllRomanceebooks.com, and iBooks).
     
  • Signed 2-title backlist deal for re-release of Liz's titles.
     
  • Become an active participator in a number of online groups, and specifically of a 300+ member reader group on Facebook.
     

Tri Destiny's Future Plans Include:

  • Joe McCoubrey first book being released by Fall 2012. Joe writes adventure/suspense/thrillers. He has an editor working with him that is familiar with the specifics of his genre and is making sure that his voice is kept while helping him to hone his skills. He is also working with a social network coach to help him with blogging, using twitter and FB while maintaing the person his is and letting that shine through

 

  • Brad Fleming first book is scheduled for realease Fall 2012. Brad writes both adventure/suspense/thrillers as well as mysteries. He has an editor working with him that is familiar with the specifics of his genre and is making sure that his voice is kept while helping him to hone his skills. He is also working with a social network coach to help him with blogging, using twitter and FB while maintaing the person his is and letting that shine through

 

  • Tasha Turner first short story is scheduled for release late June 2012 - she is honing her skills with a few short stories before releasing her 1st novel. She will be writing fictional stories of Jewish Vampires - she is working with a writing group, has a number of beta readers lined up, and has a social network set up and growing with her website where she teaches social networking as well as does book reviews, she is active on twitter and FB. story:
Introduction

The Festival of Writers (FOW) is an annual event held in Rensselaerville, NY which benefits The Rensselaerville Library. For the past three years, an annual haiku project has been organized to raise funds to support The Rensselaerville Library.

The 2014 edition of the project was curated by Shin Yu Pai, author of AUX ARCS (La Alameda, 2013), Adamantine (White Pine, 2010) and numerous artist book projects. Participating writers included Pai, sound artist and musician Steve Peters, NEA-award-winning poet and performance artist Lisa Gill, filmmaker Shelly Silver, and Tom Gilroy, author of The Haiku Year(Soft Skull) and director of Spring Forward and The Cold Lands. These five writers  committed to writing one haiku a day for the entire month of April. The group wrote their poems in handmade books that were collected together and will be sold at auction to benefit the Library.

A special edition printing of excerpts of the group's haiku  poems will be printed on individual cotton bandanas and dish towels by Rick Roth.

What We Need & What You Get

Last year, we exceeded our fundraising goal on IndieGoGo and are raising the bar. Our fundraising goal this year is $7,000. Proceeds go directly to benefitting the library.

  • A donation of $20 gets you 1 silkscreened haiku bandana.
  • A donation of $30 gets you 1 packet of 25 haiku broadsides (from 2013).
  • A donation of $40 gets you 1 silkscreened haiku dishtowel.
  • A donation of $50 gets you 1 silkscreened bandana and 1 dishtowel.
  • A donation of $80 gets you 1 bandana, 1 dishtowel, and 1 broadside packet.
  • A donation of $120 gets you a set of 4 dishtowels.

  • A donation of $100 gets you 1 softcover First Edition of the haiku year.
  • A donation of $160 gets you 1 hardcover First edition of the haiku year.

  • A donation of $100 gets you a copy of The Cold Lands/Somembody Else's Nowhere.

  • A donation of $200 gets you a framed fine art photograph/author portrait of Dave Eggers and David Cross playing chess. Signed by artist Joe Pacheco.
  • A donation of $200 gets you a framed fine art photograph/author portrait of Jonathan Ames. Signed by artist Joe Pacheco.
  • A donation of $100 gets you an unframed fine art photograph/author portrait of Jonathan Safran Foer . Signed by artist Gabrielle Russomagno.
  • A donation of $100 gets you an unframed fine art photograph/author portrait of Hari Kunru. Signed by artist Gabrielle Russomagno.

  • A donation of $1,000 gets you a hybrid book art piece (explained in campaign video).

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign to your network. If you know any special collections librarians that would take an interest in this project, haiku lovers, or book arts collectors, please forward information to them!

story:
A Little Background

We All Become Stories is a book about the experience of age and how memory changes as the years roll by. Blue Denim Press is publishing the book in the fall of 2013.  Blue Denim’s Shane Joseph and Sarah Jacobs are convinced that although old age is a scary topic to many, there are a plethora of readers who want to know what it’s really like to age – and to hear about it from older people themselves.  Perhaps you also want insights into how to care for the older people in your life, or to get ideas about how to think about your own old age. 

We’ve all heard about the so-called tsunami-like impact of the aging population: the effects on the economy and the health care system, the rapidly depleting social safety net.  There’s plenty of information about what to do about old age (and old people, as if they’re things!). We can learn about health and aging, sex and aging, memory “decline,” about the physical, emotional and social losses that come with aging, about how and where the elderly should live, and so on.

And we like hearing old people talk about the past: what they did in the war, family stories, about people they knew in the “good old day.” But we don’t hear them talking about their own experiences of aging. On that topic, something all of us will experience, their voices seem silenced. I gave voices to silenced women in My Grandmother’s Hair (Edgar Kent, 2005) and I wrote about the repression of those who draw our attention to the disappearance of so much of our natural world in Shadow’s Light (Longboat Alliance 2005) and in The Risks of Remembrance (Words Indeed Ltd, 2010).

Conversation as Action

As we are living in a time when the population is aging, it’s important to broaden the conversation, give a voice to the elderly and listen to what old people have to say about aging and old age.

That’s why I’d like We All Become Stories to reach as wide an audience as possible. To do that, my goal is to raise $7,500 – enough money to cover a broader range of promotional activities and expenses than was necessary to promote my earlier books.  Your support will help me cast a wider net and build a network of bloggers, writers and researchers who are interested in this topic.

What We Need

We need a total of $7,500.00 but we are fundraising for $5000.00 in this campaign. With your help we hope to hit, if not surpass, this target. Here is how that money will be used:

$6000 will go towards a marketing campaign from now to the end of 2013, including publicity costs, promo material design, and some of the printing costs (we know how to make these dollars stretch!)

$1000 will subsidize travel and production costs of readings and other events that will publicize We All Become Stories.

$500 will subsidize the fee to my editor, who worked so hard – at a less than market wage.

 

What You Receive

There are a variety of contributions as outlined on the left, but the best ones are highlighted below.

For a $30 donation you receive: We All Become Stories bookmarks, buttons, and a selection of 3 greeting cards featuring individual illustrations of the people featured in the book and a pull quote.

For a $50 donation you receive: bookmarks, buttons, tote bag plus a limited edition set of twelve greeting cards.  These attractive cards are illustrated with line drawings of the people in the book and poetry excerpts. You won’t find cards like these on Hallmark shelves – We All Become Stories cards celebrate the late-stages of life, and send a positive greeting to the people-of-age in our lives—those elders who are of the generation that laments the disappearing habit of letter writing and sending greeting notes!

For a $100 donation you receive: bookmarks, buttons, tote bag, set of greeting cards plus an autographed copy of We All Become Stories. 

Thank you!

I am grateful for any contribution and I appreciate that not everyone can offer a financial gift. You can also help by sharing this campaign on facebook, twitter or other social media with others, and by starting conversations about old age with people you know.

If, as a result of those conversations – face-to-face, on social media, wherever – we can encourage others to make a donation toward my $7,500 goal, know I can reach out and bring this book and its unique message to a great many people.

story:
Short Summary

My daugther has been writing since she was 11 years old, she's already written 3 books and is working on her 4th. She is turning 19 by the end of the month and. I want to surprise her with the funds to help her publish her latest Toons and Doodles illustrations book, filled with little drawings of everyday happenings in a young couples life. It is charming, fresh and funny!

'Toons & Doodles The real-life happenings within a romantic relationship, brought to life by the silly illustrations of outlet faced stick figures, named Jay and Emma... Drawn by Faceface. Check it out here: http://toonsanddoodles.tumblr.com/

My daughter is a very strong, dedicate and passionate girl. see what she has done in her life already!

  • She has wrote 3 books and is writing her 4th.
  • She has homeschooling herself almost all on her own.
  • She has create the toonsanddoodles illustrations figures charming, fresh and funny caracters.

P.S. I can't mention her name 'cause she doesn't know I am doing this, hope you understand. Thanks! :) She goes by the name of Faceface, or :) :)

What We Need 

Here the details of her coming book:

  • Here the details of her upcoming illustrations book:

    • $5000 is to have her book all set-up, images uploaded and ready to print.
    • The other $5000 is going towards funding (500 books print @ 10/book).
    • If we don't reach the total goal, we will have the book printed on demand, until we can print 500 of them and go on a tour to national book fairs!

 

What You Get

    • Every $25 perk will get a signed book.
    • Every $75 will get 4 signed books.
    • Every $100 will get 5 books signed plus a Tootles sticker!
    • Every $200 will get 10 books signed, including a personalized drawing by the author.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please make some noise about my campaign to help my daughter get published and make her 19th birthday the best ever!
  • Contribute as little as $1, any donation will help!
  • Please share with Indiegogo tools!
  • Send to all your friends and help the Toonsanddoodles get some traction!

BIG THANKS AND HUGS TO EVERYONE!

 

SOMMAIRE

Ma fille écrit des livres depuis qu’elle a 11 ans; elle en a déjà écrit 3 et travaille présentement sur son 4e. Elle va avoir 19 ans à la fin du mois et je n’ai pas pu l’aider à publier aucun de ses travaux. Je veux lui faire une surprise en faisant une levée de fonds pour l’aider à publier son dernier livre illustré « Toons and Doodles ». C’est une livre plein de dessins d’événements de chaque jour dans la vie d’un couple. C’est charmant, nouveau et drôle!

Toons and Doodles sont de petites illustration de la vrai vie d'une relation romantique avec humour et des petits desseins de caractères appelé Jay et Emma...dessiné par FacaFaca :) :) . Visitez les ici:

http://toonsanddoodles.tumblr.com/

 

Ma fille est une fille très forte de caractère, dévouée et passionnée. Voyez ce qu’elle a fait dans sa vie déjà :

Elle a écrit 3 livres et est en train d’en écrire un 4e.

Elle a fait ses études à la maison presque tout par elle-même.

Elle a créé « The Tootles », personnages charmants, nouveaux et drôles.

P.S. Je ne peux mentionner son nom parce qu’elle ne sait pas que je fais ceci, vous comprenez? Merci! Elle se donne le nom de Faceface ou :) :)

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin:

Voici les détails de son prochain livre d’illustrations :

$5000 pour la mise en page de son livre, télécharger les images et prêt à imprimer.

Un autre $5000 servira pour le financement de l’impression de 500 livres @ $10/livre

Si nous n’atteignons pas ce but, nous allons faire imprimer le livre sur commande jusqu’à    ce que nous puissions en imprimer 500 et aller en tournée à des salons du livre nationaux.

Ce que vous obtenez :

Pour chaque don de $25, vous recevez un livre autographié.

Pour chaque don de $75, vous recevez 4 livres autographiés.

Pour chaque don de $100, vous recevez 5 livres autographiés plus un collant Tootles!

Pour chaque don de $200, vous recevez 10 livres autographiés, incluant un dessin personnalisé par l’auteur.

 

Autres manières de nous aider :

Certaines personnes ne peuvent peut-être pas contribuer, mais cela ne veut pas dire qu’elles ne peuvent pas aider :

 

S’il vous plaît, parlez de ma campagne pour aider ma fille à publier ses livres et faites que son 19e anniversaire soit son plus beau!

Vous pouvez contribuez aussi peu que $1, tout don va aider!

S’il vous plaît, partager avec vos amis avec les outils sociaux de Indiegogo!

Envoyez à tous vos amis et aider à faire avancer le « Toonanddoodles »!

GROS MERCIS ET GROS CALINS À TOUTES ET À TOUS!

C’est une livre plein de dessins d’événements de chaque jour dans la vie d’un couple. C’est charmant, nouveau et drôle!



Toons and Doodles sont de petites illustration de la vrai vie d'une relation romantique avec humour et des petits desseins de caractères appelé Jay et Emma...dessiné par FacaFaca :) :) . Visitez les ici:
http://toonsanddoodles.tumblr.com/
 
Ma fille est une fille très forte de caractère, dévouée et passionnée. Voyez ce qu’elle a fait dans sa vie déjà :
Elle a écrit 3 livres et est en train d’en écrire un 4e.
Elle a fait ses études à la maison presque tout par elle-même.
Elle a créé « The Tootles », personnages charmants, nouveaux et drôles.
P.S. Je ne peux mentionner son nom parce qu’elle ne sait pas que je fais ceci, vous comprenez? Merci! Elle se donne le nom de Faceface ou :) :)
 
Ce dont nous avons besoin:
Voici les détails de son prochain livre d’illustrations :
$5000 pour la mise en page de son livre, télécharger les images et prêt à imprimer.
Un autre $5000 servira pour le financement de l’impression de 500 livres @ $10/livre
Si nous n’atteignons pas ce but, nous allons faire imprimer le livre sur commande jusqu’à    ce que nous puissions en imprimer 500 et aller en tournée à des salons du livre nationaux.
Ce que vous obtenez :
Pour chaque don de $25, vous recevez un livre autographié.
Pour chaque don de $75, vous recevez 4 livres autographiés.
Pour chaque don de $100, vous recevez 5 livres autographiés plus un collant Tootles!
Pour chaque don de $200, vous recevez 10 livres autographiés, incluant un dessin personnalisé par l’auteur.
 
Autres manières de nous aider :
Certaines personnes ne peuvent peut-être pas contribuer, mais cela ne veut pas dire qu’elles ne peuvent pas aider :
 
S’il vous plaît, parlez de ma campagne pour aider ma fille à publier ses livres et faites que son 19e anniversaire soit son plus beau!
Vous pouvez contribuez aussi peu que $1, tout don va aider! 
S’il vous plaît, partager avec vos amis avec les outils sociaux de Indiegogo!
Envoyez à tous vos amis et aider à faire avancer le « Toonanddoodles »!
GROS MERCIS ET GROS CALINS À TOUTES ET À TOUS!

story:
Want to know how to get your health back for real?  Looking for a permanent solution?  Please donate whatever you can to help pay for the editing costs for my book. "A Holistic Way Out For Sick People Everywhere"is the guide to getting your health back. It's the owners manual for your body. We need donations to get it made!

You can donate $10 or $500 or anything in between... whatever works!

I wish I had this book when I was sick for 10+ years going to countless doctors only to be told nothing was wrong with me because all of my labs came back normal. I never thought I’d be able to get my health back and here I am, 14 years later feeling better than ever!  I eventually trained as a practitioner in the technique that got me back on track to my recovery. I opened a holistic wellness & nutrition center in Los Angeles, California in 2008 and have since worked with many people to successfully regain their health and get their lives back.

In this book, I’m going to tell you why people get sick, why your labs come back normal even though you’re feeling sick, why drugs and many medications are frequently just a band-aid, and what you can do in your everyday life to help yourself.  I’ll go over many different holistic techniques out there that you can try. I’m going to explain how and why the body responds the way it does.  

I'm looking to raise $5400 to pay for editing costs so the information is put together in a way that will appeal to publishers and the general public.  Swimming through Peanut Butter -A Holistic Way Out for Sick People Everywhere is the tentative title of the book based on a journal entry I wrote about what it felt like to be sick. We don't have a publishing deal yet since it is still being edited so if you get a perk for a signed copy, and we can't get you a hard copy in a timely manner, we will send you a printed bound version

My motto is “Treat the source… not the symptom” and my book aims to explain what this means and how to do it.   To read more about my work and process, please visit my website at www.mlhwellness.com

I am writing it to give answers, information, inspiration, a reason to keep going and not give up, and most of all… a voice.

Please help make this book happen!  Thank you so much for your help and support!

story:
***(9/10/2014*** CHANGE OF PLANS
Well, it looks as if I'm stuck for the next few years, but instead of getting down about it, I've decided that I will not let the negative things in life win. Thanks to some good friends offline, we're moving towards becoming self sufficient. Hopefully enough to keep us afloat eventually. We're working on having a micro-farm, already have chickens, a lady with an autistic child like our raises goats and is going to donate two pygmy goats to us. It will help our autistic child, plus give us free milk, fiber, and weed control. These goats are used for therapy, much like therapy dogs!
I'm working on the next book in my series - self publishing it. I will have control over my work from now on.
So what I'm asking for now, is help easing this present situation so we can become self sufficient. I cannot edit the funding amount and I'm not going to move sites - now while people can see the entire situation here. A lot to digest. We just need to get by until my book is finished and up for sale AND we have our little micro-farm going. I am building a greenhouse that will grow things this winter and provide heating by venting it into the house.
I'm still sick, husband is still disabled, and our kids still need us. While there's been a bump in this road - I refuse to get down about it. I'm taking control of this life and will be posting pictures on a blog so you can watch what your help does. Live nearby or willing to take a trip? Once all is said and done, you can set up a visit to meet the goats, eat a few fresh organic eggs, and take a hike in the state forest. Can't do that? Instead of one of the listed perks, I can send you soap, cheese, yarn, or something made from here as a thank you.
We are still in need of:
Washer (this is the most urgent need of all)
Dryer
Help with groceries (SNAP doesn't cover all our needs) and personal needs (like clothes and hygiene items)
Nails/Screws/Tools/fencing (for both the animals and our daughter. She's autistic and wanders)
Vehicle and insurance(to make it to our doctor appointments)
Renewing driver license
Woodstove for heat this winter or fireplace doors for the open fireplace. Propane is too expensive and social services does not cover it in full (at $4 a gallon for heating, it's just far too much when wood is only $55 a face cord!)







https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=10203113183243109&l=9113073698624510776
(my video)



***8/27/2014***

Still looking for a lawyer. Not sure how it is going to turn out on that end. May end up needing to do small claims - I don't know. All I know is right now stress has put me into a flare up. It is difficult to write, talk, or walk. For right now I need help with personal expenses more than anything until a lawyer is found.***


Author JE Fletcher (Julie) has been supporting her family through her writing income since 2005. Recently her chronic illness and a legal problem concerning her work has reduced that income well below the amount needed to continue to support her family and gain legal help during this very stressful time.

Julie is being treated for an undetermined suspected autoimmune disease.( Her first visit to a rhuematologist is August 28th as previous treatment through her primary has been unable to determine anything further than persistent hematuria (blood in urine) from undetermined sources, and persistent vitamin deficiency even with supplementation. ) Joints in her hands become swollen and severely painful which limits her ability to write. So much that her income has been slashed to the point she is unable to continue to support her family or procure legal counsel.




What She Needs & What You Get

Julie needs to get her family through this difficult time and hire a lawyer as the legal aid in her area does not provide services in literary or publishing. The family had to resort to applying for public assistance which does not cover the needs of a family of seven for a full month. The funds from the fundraiser will go toward:

Life/personal expenses such as grocery/bill/clothing/repair costs

Procurement of attorney services (initial counsel, travel to law office or court if needed) and all fees.


The family needs to purchase a used vehicle as they live in a rural area and there is no public transit and the cost of a taxi per trip is prohibitive on their income.


What contributors get:

Eternal gratitude at every donation level, even just shares of the link.

Every contributor of $50 or more will receive a signed print copy of Fletcher's upcoming novel.

Contributors of $100 or more receive acknowledgment in back of the book and an exclusive short story written custom for the contributor.

Contributors of $1000 or more will be listed as a sponsor on the re-release of a novel Fletcher previously authored.

Contributors of $5,000 or more will get a signed card from Fletcher who will probably be in the hospital recovering from shock at a donation that huge.(Seriously, you'll get a print copy of both Fletcher's novels when released, mention in the back of the book, listed as a sponsor on the re-release, and a special place on all of Fletcher's websites plus free advertising for life on any of her sites.)





The Impact

The impact contributors have with this fundraiser is significant on the author and her family. Not only will you, the contributor, help us, you'll help Julie prove that authors and author rights are NOT something to joke about or take advantage of.

Artists are treated unfairly by those that would make money off those author's works, but let those authors end up in poverty. This isn't right – for Fletcher or any other author going through such a thing. She hopes that this will set a standard for all authors that have been tricked into giving up their rights.

You'll also be helping keep a family afloat – three of the four school aged children still need school supplies and clothing. Clothing donations from a personal friend has helped supply clothing in full for one of the children, in part for the others. They still need shoes and supplies.

You'll help buy the parts to repair their washing machine – being poor is fine, being stinky is not.

You'll help them buy a used car so the family can make it to medical/dental appointments. This is extremely important as Fletcher missed enough dental appointments due to scheduled cabs not showing up (from Medicaid paid transport) and cannot receive treatment from her dentist as the office no longer will see her as a patient- her disorder is causing her teeth to break apart.

The author will (hopefully) be able to secure a lawyer that can help her in a publishing legal problem and recover damages along with moving forward with the publishing of a novel. The proceeds will allow the author to support herself and family with a passive income stream when Julie isn't able to write due to chronic joint pain. It will also cover cover art and release costs.

Risks & Challenges

I may not win my legal case. This is always a risk.

I could become severely disabled or die suddenly which would leave me unable to fulfill my part of the fundraiser obligations. I've been hospitalized once for stroke-like symptoms in Rochester (Strong Memorial) in 2012 and then sent to the emergency room for another stronger, more severe neurological emergency event this year (2014).

It may take some time to find a lawyer that will fight my legal case. It may take a long time to recover damages and publishing rights for the current situation.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute you can help by sharing this fundraiser. Someone else may be able to help.

If you are a lawyer or know a lawyer who would be interested in helping Julie – please let her know.

If you're interested in helping with school supplies or clothing, but don't want to donate here because you're worried, gift codes for online shops is a way you can donate and receive verification of what is purchased with the code or online gift card. (These work best as the family doesn't have a car and can have clothing or supplies delivered).

story:
The Axe Factory is a quarterly online literary journal that publishes contemporary poetry, prose, and visual art in any 2D medium.  We curate each edition of like a gallery exhibition--drawing together pieces in various styles and media that complement and offset each other.  We encourage collaboration, blending of media, and experimentation.


What We Need....

Here at the Axe Factory Press:
1. We believe that authors and artists should be paid for their work.  Publicity is not currency, which is why we have been dedicated to paying an honorarium to our authors from the start.
2. We believe that our readers should have the ability to access our publication in the format that they prefer, which is why, despite being primarily web-based, we are publishing a print edition as well.
We are looking to raise $2,000 in three weeks.
90% of the funds raised by this campaign will be used to sponsor authors and artists in future editions of The Axe Factory.  If we reach our goal of $2,000, we will be able to fully fund six editions of The Axe Factory.
10% of the funds raised will go towards publication of the first print edition of The Axe Factory Press.  

...& What You Get

We're offering an array of Axe Factory Press merch, plus a special pre-order of the first print edition of The Axe Factory.  
For a $5 pledge, we'll send you an art-print Axe Factory Press postcard with a personal thank-you, plus we'll thank you on our website.
If you pledge $15, you're pre-ordering the first print edition of The Axe Factory!  We'll keep you updated on the process and once publication is complete we'll send the edition your way!  
We're also printing Axe Factory Press t-shirts featuring our crowned bear logo; for a pledge of $25, we'll send you one!  $25 sponsors an author or artist for publication, so we'll list you as a sponsor and thank you on our website.
If you pledge $50, you're subscribing to The Axe Factory for one calendar year (four print editions-- and a savings of $10 versus buying them individually).  
For a pledge of $100, you'll get a year's subscription (four print editions) and the aforementioned Axe Factory Press t-shirt, plus an embroidered Axe Factory Press bookbag.
For $250, we'll list you as a PATRON on four print and web editions of The Axe Factory.  You'll receive a copy of each issue, plus the bookbag and t-shirt.
And for $500, you become a BLACK BEAR BENEFACTOR!  We'll dedicate one edition of the The Axe Factory to you!  We'll send you three copies of that special edition, plus you'll be subscribed for the remainder of the year (six print editions total).  Your three special editions will arrive inside your Axe Factory Press bookbag along with a crowned bear t-shirt.  

The Impact

As I've mentioned before, 90% of the funds raised will go towards paying author honorariums.  We're an organization made up entirely of volunteers, and our passion is to create a launchpad for emerging authors and artists.  

We don't look at resumes and we don't read author bios until after we've studied the work.  We accept work from students, emerging professionals, established authors, and those just returning to a love for writing.  We respect talent and passion above accolades and awards.  

Our team is willing to dedicate our time to the work-- combing through submissions, organizing layouts, scrambling for author photos, mocking-up cover art-- but the talent belongs to our authors and artists.  And they're the ones who will reap the benefits once we reach our goal of $2,000.  We'll be able to publish at least six future editions and fully pay all of our authors and artists for each one.


    Risks & Challenges

    Our primary challenge at the moment is prevalent throughout the publishing industry: how can we reconcile print and digital media?  There were a lot of factors at play in our decision to actively pursue publishing on both fronts.  Digital publishing is less expensive, obviously, but it's also harder to reap the benefits in order to continue publishing into the future.   We'd also like to be able to provide our authors and artists with a copy of the publication in which they're featured, which we can't do online.  

    We want to honor personal tastes, which is why we're publishing on multiple avenues.  Our risk is that we will be spread too thin, but I am utterly confident that we can overcome.  This publication is our passion, and we have brought it this far; we can see it past the next obstacle.  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute to our campaign but still want to support us, you're not out of options!  

    1. Share Axe Factory Press and our crowdfunding campaign on social media.

    2. Spread the word to artists and authors-- we're always looking for new contributors! 

    3. Subscribe to our newsletter on our website, axefactorypress.com, to stay updated on new editions and developments.

story:
My Story

Hi, my name is Stephanie Schroeder and my project is to travel the US in search of the happiest communities.  What are the happiest communities here in America?  What common threads do they share?  And, as social media becomes a part of our daily lives, is it bringing us closer relationships or is it weakening our physical communities?  In order to get my answers, I will be traveling by car in a time of 7 weeks to 29 randomly selected locations across the continental US.  I'll interview people in grocery stores, on the street, in front of their houses, from the young to old and from all walks of life and backgrounds.

The Impact

The great thing about my project is that it affects everyone.  Pretty much everyone's lives are impacted by social media and networking.  As humans, we all want to belong in a community as it's one of our basic needs!  We can all apply what makes some communities happier than others in our own lives.  By the end of my trip, I will have very detailed information to publish research on American happiness today.   This research will be the basis for my book in which I will share the data I collected, conclusions I drew, and adventures I had along the way!


What I Need & What You Get

I will be needing around $3,000.  Even though I have a pretty fuel-efficient car, the majority of this need will be gas money.  Other money will be used for printing surveys, buying cans of tuna to eat along the way, and hopefully enough to stay in campsites instead of my car.  Money will also go back to give people perks for donating!  Those who help support me will be rewarded in return with some pretty neat incentives, such as t shirts, kitsch souvenirs, and more.


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!! This is a well-thought out and researched project that is applicable to everyone!  Support this project and tell others about it!  I would be so happy!

story:
"Brass Knuckles LA", is a poetry slam team, with members: Judy Holiday, Mr. Poetic (Darnell Davenport), Madison DiNapoli, Ashley Catharine, and E. Amato. The team was formed out of it's home venue, Kaos Network, in Leimert Park. For several months, the venue holds slams open to the general public for performance poets to compete. Slammers go through vigorous competitions in hopes of making the final five. But it's after all slots have been fought for and earned, that the REAL work begins. The five artists come together and write collaboratively, practice, fund-raise, receive coaching, and perform together for 3 months all in preparation of competing against 80+ teams on a national level. This is Brass Knuckles' second year having a team, and we are excited to share our work outside of our city on a larger platform, and receive workshops from some of the most respected artists in our community...and YOU can make that possible.

 

Our Team has sacrificed a lot of time and work hours all for the sake of our dedication to our team. When we are on stage and surrounded by our peers in the poetry community...we are most alive. Our practicing and collaborations will NOT be a waste if we are not able to go, because we are fortunate to have achieved all that we have in such little time. However the ability to witness and perform in front of other artists on a national level will be missed without your help.

 

In order to make it all the way to Boston, (plane tickets, lodging, food, etc.), we need to raise $5000.  Which means we need any bit of help you can offer. Every penny counts and is deeply apperciated. But wait! You won't just be recieiving that warm, tingly feeling of charity. Check out our donation rewards:


$5 - High Five
$15 - Hug
$25 - Chapbook + Choice of an Individual Work from one of the members of our team
$50 - Jump Drive with video, audio, image, and text of our works
$100 - Year Membership to Brass Knuckles + Chapbook
$250 - Year Membership + A Guest + Jump Drive
$500 - Team Takeover (Date night with the team for dinner and drinks) + Jump Drive + All Indie Works

 


If you're not entirely convinced of our credibility or you can't afford a large donation then come on out to Brass Knuckles  in Leimert Park (4343 Leimert Blvd. LA, CA. 90008) every Monday night at 8:30pm. It's Hosted by Judy Holiday and Nikki Blak.  Brass Kunuckles is an explosive open mic night always guaranteed to fully entertain. Help spread the word about our venue and our team. Add us individually on Facebook and Twitter (BrassKnucklesLA) so you can share us with your world.
