story:
Hello beautiful people!

My name is Josie Moon. I wrote a story called THE BUBBLE TREE. Although a children’s picture book, I suggest this story for people of all ages. I aim to evoke the dreamer within. 


What is THE BUBBLE TREE?

The Bubble Tree is about a young girl who craves adventure. After discovering a tree that grows bubbles, she longs to follow the bubbles that float out into the world. She goes on an inward journey,  learning lessons in life, which evolves her soul and enriches her heart. 

This project is a result of a game I once played with a friend of mine seven years ago. The name of the game is “what would you rather be?” The players ask each other what they would prefer to be. I had suggested a tree, or a bubble. My friend Evan was torn over which to choose, for they are both so appealing, though total opposites. Then I imagined living a life as both a tree and a bubble. I imagined embodying a life of balance in having the qualities of something so strong and grounded, and something so light and free. Although I wrote THE BUBBLE TREE seven years ago, only now is it ready to be exposed. The story evolved along with all my travels and changed with each new path of my journey. Finally, after many explorations and self evolution, I am ready to share it with the world. 


Who am I?

I come from Big Hollow road in Maplecrest, New York. I grew up in a family of seven in a house that my father built. 

 I think of myself as a writer, a traveler, a dreamer, a dancer and a peaceful warrior. 

Since I can remember,  I´ve felt the value of togetherness and human companionship,  though over the years I have learned the importance of the self. As much as I love and miss my family, I´ve decided to live on the other side of the ocean to learn about the world and about myself.

I spent my childhood discovering the imagination. Whether it was looking for fairies in the forest, directing plays with my sisters, or writing tales, I made sure my world was filled with magic and adventure. Now as a twenty-eight year old woman, I have lived in numerous cities and countries fulfilling my desire to explore the world. This story THE BUBBLE TREE is a depiction of my lust for exploration and the unknown.  The protagonist in the story finds a tree growing bubbles and follows the bubbles into the world to seek her own adventure and realize true growth from within.

Why is this project so important? 

I am twenty eight years old and I still go directly to the children's book section. For me, they are a magical world to discover. As a child, illustrated tales were so important to me. It made me believe in worlds other than the one around me. My sister Iris and I used to sit on the couch together and ¨jump¨into the illustrations. We did this by putting our faces so close to the page we couldn’t see anything except the pictures and our blurry noses. Picture books are a beautiful escape, and all children deserve their own journey. 

THE BUBBLE TREE is my first attempt for publication. The success of this campaign is so important to me for many reasons, one being that it's a personal story of mine brought to life.  Time to fly!


Why do I need funding?

THE BUBBLE TREE is a picture book, and the nature of all picture books is that the pictures carry the story. I, as the author, have always had very specific images of each and every page. I wanted the images full of color, in a soft, dream-like place that made the reader feel warm and enchanted.  When my illustrator Laura Castello made her first sketches for me, I knew right away she was the one! Her work is beautiful, with diverse techniques, small detail, and amazing color work. Her job is massive: she must sketch and paint 24 pages of this wild tale, plus the cover art and all design elements. I, alone do not have the funding to pay her. She has completed the first five pages, and will finish the book if we reach our goal! We must also pay Indiegogo a percentage of our amount raised. Once the book is ready, we then send it into be published and will be faced with additional printing fees for maximum quality coloring, and in hard cover edition.  We will print the first copies for our offered "gift perks" for participating, but the book will always be available on line with a 'print-on-demand' format. 

Why choose crowd funding? 

Crowd funding is a new concept for me, and at first I felt skeptical. After realizing the nature of how it works, I was delighted. Publishing this book the traditional way would be great, but doing it because there is a network of support and energy behind the project is a true victory! If this book can speak to enough people to accomplish the publication,  then it will become not only my dream, but a collective dream. A small bubble carried by loving winds. 


There are some gifts to offer for your support!

We are working on designing posters and stickers of THE BUBBLE TREE cover art.  We are also making canvas tote bags with THE BUBBLE TREE cover art , in which  you can carry your apples, carrots and onions in :) 


I will also be giving my personally crafted mini SWINGS as gifts. 

I love to swing. Its one of my greatest therapies. Since I have lived in Barcelona, I started collecting recycled fruit crates from the street, breaking them, sanding them, and painting them uniquely. Now there are many hanging in the trees of different Barcelona neighborhoods. They are my street art, and each one is totally unique. They are perfect for your favorite tree, to hang in your house, or, they're even  small enough to  wear as a necklace!




The Impact of THE BUBBLE TREE

This story has gotten amazing reviews reviews and reactions from the people I've shared it with. Most of them are enchanted, and some very surprised, though one older couple in Barcelona had a different response. They thought the message behind the story was too "deep" for children.  Although it’s a children's book, there IS a deeper message that I hope will speak to people of all ages. I can recall the books of my childhood that I read now, and realize the various, more profound messages behind these tales. Kids have a way of filtering what they can make sense of. What they may not understand lies in their subconscious and may appear later on in life. Why not instill positivity and support through storytelling while the young brain is developing?

Why believe in this story?

I believe in this story because it promotes a positive message. In a world where we must find our way through many struggles, fight for what we want, and realize our dreams, I think it’s important for people to believe in themselves, and their potential at a very early age. The Bubble Tree’s message encourages self exploration and expansion. It reminds people that magic exists if we want to experience it. I invite everyone to participate in this project, young or old, because we all have dreams to realize.


Risks & Challenges?

My challenges thus far have been mainly myself. It has taken me so long to get to this point, mainly for not taking enough initiative! Talking about doing something is quite different than actually doing it. I think many people suffer from the crippling state of laziness, fear, and self doubt. What a toxic place! I decided it was time to stop talking and get things rolling. I wanted to prove to myself (and all the others I shared this project with) that I could make it a reality. 

The second obstacle is not having the financial means to do it alone. Many people misunderstand my situation and think that I come from heaps of money because I've been fortunate enough to travel quite a bit and live in Europe. This is far from the truth. I come from a modest family, rich in love and health, who taught me how to get where I need to go by working hard.

 I have faith in this project:  first off, because it comes from a very pure place, and has nothing but good intentions. Secondly, I have faith in my supporters and know I have an amazing group of people who will be the angels that help carry it through.


ALTERNATIVE WAYS TO SUPPORT!

To my fellow starving artists who can't contribute financially, I salute you! I am one of the pack. Your love and support and ability to SHARE is immeasurable and I am forever grateful for your super powers in propelling this book into reality!! In a world full of technology, I still believe strongly in word of mouth! This is the true essence of story telling!  I have whispered this story to people from the mountains of North Carolina, shouted it through the noise of NYC, spout it to the bass of booming clubs in Berlin , told it along the wandering Quai's of Paris, and danced the story alive to drums in Barcelona. After having reached all these people verbally, THE BUBBLE TREE is begging to be put to ink and paper.  If this story speaks to you, PLEASE share it with fellow dreamers, and more importantly, those who need a reminder of the dreamer they are. 

Meet ~Laura Castello~ the Wizard behind the pencil & paint! 

Laura Castelló is a Spanish illustrator who graduated in Fine Arts and post-graduated in Professional Illustration at the Polytechnic University of Valencia. Along her career, she has learned  to deal with customers and to develop different drawing styles by working for companies such as Zara and Pull&Bear, where she also developed team work skills. 

At the moment, she is working as a freelance illustrator, and making collaborations with the European University of Madrid. You can check out her work further as co-editor of  "El Fresquito Fanzine", an independent publication about illustration.

She has illustrated several children's books "La vie commence ici" and now  "THE BUBBLE TREE".

In 2013 , she published "Brackets" ( Ultrarradio Ediciones ) , a comic about teen years and in 2014 she published an Artist Book ( Veinticuatro Editions ) where she collects some of her works over the last years. 


THANK YOU~ GRACIAS ~MERCI~ DANKIE~
I would like to THANK many key factors in making this whole project possible:

Laura Castello~ she is the one who painted my dreams! I can't express how happy I am with our collaboration. Thank you Laura for your visions and talent. 
Paco Gramaje~ he is the magician composer of Girasomnis who's responsible for the music in THE BUBBLE TREE video. The song is called "Lullabies for Big Dreamers" Paco has been a loyal friend and inspiration for me, always pushing me to get the project going. 

Jesus Munoz~ he is the master camera man behind THE BUBBLE TREE video. With his creative talents, his kids, and much patience, he was able to make a beautiful video for me. Thank you Jesus for being a friend, Papa, and artistic inspiration.  

Philisa Williams~ thanks to Philisa, I was able to make this page. I am a writer who does not own a computer. She has graciously let me use her Mac day in and day out! Thank you for your keys and for your lovely self! 

Julian Bueno~ he is the first editor to see my book and believe in it. Thank you Julian for showing me the ropes of crowd funding and the breakdown of the whole process. I am grateful for all of your time! 

Cinta Dannhauser> thanks for being the best skat for a skat. You will help me with my next tale. 

Tess and Tom Pelham> My Mama and Papa, from whom I am forever proud to have  as leaders. I LOVE YOU!

story:
REVOLUTIONIZING VOCABULARY ACQUISITION

Since we process new information more fluently via shapes, forms, and colors.  Visually-rich calligrams amply helps acquire and retain newer or abstruse words more easily than blind memorization.  And since gaming offers many benefits such as cognitive flexibility, attention, working memory, and abstract reasoning, we provide free sections to gaming for Indiegogo backers in our website.

 

 

 

 

FEEDBACK FROM PARENTS

MEET THE DESIGN TEAM

Some of America's most creative minds and leading graphic designers bring to you this meaningful and rewarding Indiegogo project.

 

IN THE NEWS

 

FUNDS USAGE

All Indiegogo backers are provided with FREE access to the gaming section of the website. The calligram-rich book and the associated rewards shall be packed in cardboard box with higher bursting strength to ensure safety in shipping.  Shipping costs—domestic USA or international—will be mailed from the U.S. Postal Service with signature confirmation and insurance coverage.  Please look for alternative rewards if you want media mail.

 

CONTACT DETAILS

BOOK
Twitter:        @awordtotheeyes
Instagram:   awordtotheeyes
Website:        www.awordtotheeyes.com

AUTHOR
Twitter:         @iSudio
Instagram:   iSudio

[For international orders, please get in touch with me directly at xi_x_yang@alumni.brown.edu. Thank you for your support!]

Story of My Book

The Autonomy Mind provides practical advice on taking back our lost freedom of self-determination through adopting an autonomy mindset, and offers an antidote to the fear of missing out, blurred personal boundaries, and other symptoms from the loss of personal autonomy.

My name is Jason Yang, and I am the author of The Autonomy Mind. I wrote this book because I’ve found so many talented and diligent people in my life never live up to their full potentials. They gradually give up their personal autonomy as a result of long being in a subordinate position, or they simply chose to succumb to groupthink. In a world full of ever-changing fads, sink-or-swim work culture, and information inequality in hierarchies, it is now more than ever the moment for us to adopt an autonomy mindset to look after our own interests and achieve self-realization in our careers.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to develop your autonomy mindset in your life. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for initiating this change in mindset. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool and a road map to help you develop a new mindset that empowers you to focus on and dedicate to your most cherished goals in your professional and personal life.

In this book, you'll learn about how we gradually lost our personal autonomy, how the loss is accelerating in the modern world and several principles that help you rebuild your personal autonomy and unleash your full potential.

You'll read about the latest research in cognitive sciences that dissects the scientific dynamics of personal autonomy, and real-life experiences from the author, his friends and interviewees, ranging from graduate school students to corporate employees in different capacities.

The Autonomy Mind is a nonfiction book that speaks to students, corporate employees, and entrepreneurs alike. You will love this book if you want to navigate your professional and personal life in a way more truthful to your most cherished goals, or if you want to unleash your underutilized potentials and create your own future.
 

About the Author

Jason Yang works in Artificial Intelligence/Natural Language Processing. He approaches his multiple ventures with the top-down perspective of an entrepreneur and the bottom-up perspective of an engineer. He earned an MS in Cognitive Sciences from Brown University, an MS in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University, a BS in Software Engineering and a BA in Japanese from Dalian University of Technology.

He wrote this book because he’s seen so many talented and diligent people never live up to their full potential because they gradually give up their personal autonomy. He feels the urge to bring more awareness to our personal autonomy and the urge for us to take action to develop the autonomy mindset. In the book, he offers effective actionable items towards adopting the mindset and points out that personal autonomy is in our human nature, rather than a luxury afforded to a select few.

Aside from writing and building out his ideas in AI, Jason boasts of his huge personal library of books in English, Chinese, Japanese and French in downtown Manhattan. He is a relentless life-long learner with infinite curiosity to better understand our world. When outside of his home office, he can be found enjoying hiking, biking, museum-going or archery.

For more information, you can connect with Jason at xi_x_yang@alumni.brown.edu.

 

The Book - The Autonomy Mind

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 - How We Got Here: contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-3. We explore our loss of personal autonomy in the modern world, how the recent trends in technology and the workplace are accelerating it, and the various psychosomatic symptoms that result from it, backed by the latest research in cognitive sciences, management sciences and more. Particularly, we will see how the debate between David Graeber and Peter Thiel on technology trends related to personal autonomy, and moreover, we show how the recent Covid-19 disaster uncovered our latent tendency of groupthink. Then, we move on to look at how being in the subordinate position in any relationship, either at school or at work, usually contributes to the loss of autonomy. We wrap up this part with examples showing the urgency that we develop an autonomy mindset to tackle the challenges in our personal and professional life and how to thrive based on the autonomy mindset.

Part 2 - Principles of the Autonomy Mind: contains Chapters 4-8. We will dig into specific theories and examples of what the various principles of the autonomy mindset are and what this mindset looks like in real life. We will find out how phenomena such as the fear of success, the fear of being rejected, the fear of missing out, the fear of saying no, and the fear of dedication all share one common root cause — the lack of personal autonomy. We look at how people work on getting back their autonomy and see their life strategy work out successfully in different settings, through adopting each of the five principles, citing examples from my interviewees, friends and myself.

Part 3 contains the Epilogue. In this final section, we will revisit some of the important points raised in Part 1 and 2, on the urgency of developing an autonomy mindset in the modern world, and how a successful combination of all the five principles of the autonomy mindset can initiate the change in us to pursue our own interests and goals more freely. Furthermore, we will see some interesting latest developments in our society’s increasing awareness of our loss of autonomy, such as the RISE 4 MIT movement, which fights for more graduate student autonomy and has made great progress so far.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in the summer of 2021.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much much more!

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AutonomyMind and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jason Yang
